〈他動〉To expose (anything) to the fire; to broil (fish); to roast (meat); to grill (chicken); to toast (bread); to warm (one's hands, etc.)

content.content: 手を焙る
to warm one's hands at the fire
着物を焙る
to warm one's clothes at fire―over the fire―before the fire
火に焙ると匂いが抜ける
Hold it over the fire,―Show it the fire,―and the smell will go off.

content:
あふれる〔溢れる〕
〈自動〉
1. To overflow (the bank); to run over (the brim); to brim over; to flood; deluge; inundate (the land with water)

content.content: 河が溢れる
A river overflows.
大雨で河が溢れた
The river overflowed in consequence of the rain―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The heavy rainfall made the river overflow.
盃が溢れる
A cup brims over.
盃がいっぱいで溢れそうだ
The cup is full to the brim―brimful (of wine).
いっぱいで溢れそうな盃
a brimming cup
最後の一滴盃を溢らす(大抵大概の程を知れ)
“The last drop makes the cup run over.”
日本の人口は溢れんとしている
Japan has an overflowing population.
溢るる人口が出口を求むるのは理の当然である
It is quite natural that an overflowing population should seek an outlet.
聴衆堂に溢る
The hall was filled to overflowing―crammed to suffocation.
溢れるほど申込がある
We are deluged with offers―flooded with offers.
来訪者溢れて応接に暇あらず
We are inundated with callers―flooded with callers.
パリには外人が溢れるほど集った
Paris was flooded with foreigners.
溢れるほど手紙が来る
We are flooded with letters―deluged with letters―inundated with letters.
電車は乗客が溢れている
The cars are overcrowded with passengers.
市場には品物が溢れている
The market is glutted with commodities.
目には涙が溢れていた
Her eyes were streaming with tears.
紙入れには札が溢れている
His pocket-book is bursting with bank-notes.
(何が)溢れるよう
to be overflowing with―brimming over with―brimful of―profuse of―something
彼は同情溢るるばかりだ
He is overflowing with sympathy.
彼女は愛嬌溢るるばかりだ
She is brimming over with charm―overflowing with smiles―profuse of her smiles.
彼は元気溢るるばかりだ
He is brimming over with spirits―in exuberant spirits.
彼はその報に接して悦び溢るるばかりであった
He was overjoyed at the news.

content:
あぶれる
〈自動〉(A woman of the town will) fail to get a customer;(a jinrikishaman will) fail to get a fare; (A sportsman will) fail to find game

content.content: (銃猟家が)今日はあぶれた
I have had no game today.

content:
あべこべ
〈名〉The wrong way; the reverse; the inverse

content.content: あべこべにする
to reverse the order―invert the order―put the cart before the horse
(飯を食ってから湯に入る)それゃあべこべだ
That's putting the cart before the horse.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=に)(in) the wrong way; in the reverse order; the other way about

content.content: (和服を着た西洋人に向かって)それでは前の合わせ方があべこべです
You fold your gown the wrong way.
(女中に向かって)それではお膳の並べ方があべこべだ
You have set the trays the wrong way―the other way about.
上下あべこべ
upside down
それでは本の持ちようがあべこべだ
You hold your book upside down.
表裏あべこべ
inside out―the wrong side out
それでは敷物があべこべだ
The carpet is inside out―the wrong side out.
負かすつもりであべこべに負けた
I meant to beat him, but it turned out the other way.

content: 2. (=却って)instead (of...)

content.content: 負かすつもりであべこべに負けた
I meant to beat him, but got beaten instead―Instead of beating him, I got beaten.
人を殴ろうとしてあべこべに殴られた
He tried to thrash, and got thrashed instead―Instead of thrashing, he got thrashed.―“The biter bit.”

content:

to smoke opium
日本では阿片を喫すると死刑になる
In Japan, opium-smoking is prohibited on penalty of death―To smoke opium is death in Japan.

この薬に阿片が入る
Opium enters into the composition of this medicine―The medicine contains opium.

an opiate
阿片丁幾{あへんちんき}
tincture of opium―laudanum
阿片中毒
opiumism

How absurd!―(人を笑うのなら)―What an ass!―(自分を笑うのなら)―Fool that I am!

content.content: 雨上りは晴れ晴れする

content:
あまい〔甘い〕
〈形〉
1. Sweet (taste, fruit, etc.)

content.content: 砂糖や蜂蜜は甘い
Sugar and honey are sweet―They taste sweet.
甘い物
sweets
彼は甘い物が好きだ
He is fond of sweets―He has a sweet tooth.
下戸は甘い物が好きだ
Teetotallars go in for sweets.
内の主人は甘いも辛いも知っている
He has tasted the sweets and bitters of life―He has seen much of life.
甘い汁を吸う
to suck one dry
塩が甘い
(料理なら)The dish is not salt enough―(漬物なら)―The pickles are not sufficiently salted
汁が甘い
The soup is not salt enough―(の“salt”は形容詞、名詞に用いれば)―The soup has not enough salt in it―There is too little salt in the soup.
漬物は塩が甘いと悪くなる
Pickles will go bad if they are not well salted.
この魚は塩が甘いから長く持たぬ
This fish will not keep long, as it is not sufficiently salted.
東京の料理は塩が甘い
Tokyo dishes have too little salt in them―Tokyo cooking is sparing of salt.
東京では魚でも野菜でも甘く煮る
Tokyo people cook their fish and vegetables with too little salt―Tokyo people are sparing of salt in cooking their fish and vegetables.
塩を甘くしておくれ
Do not put too much salt in it.
人間が甘い
He is soft―soft-hearted―soft-headed―soft-witted―good-natured―indulgent.
彼は人間が甘過ぎる
He is too soft-hearted―too good-natured.
甘いところがある
He has a soft spot in his head.
君は子どもに甘い
You are too indulgent to your children.
甘い親
an indulgent father
甘い母
a fond mother
彼は女に甘い
He is too susceptible to female charms―He has a soft heart towards the fair sex.
甘い奴だ
He is a spooney.
人を甘く見る
to presume upon one's good nature
貴様は俺を甘く見たな
You have presumed upon my good nature.
子どもを甘く育てる
to spoil a child
母が甘いと子どもが甘く育つ
Children are spoiled by a fond mother.
甘い言葉
kind words
甘い言葉をかける
to speak kindly to one
甘いタバコ
mild tobacco
焼きが甘い
The blade is too soft―not well tempered.
先生は点が甘い
He is unsparing of his marks―He is a good marker.

〈名〉A stone figure of a Korean dog (guarding either side of the entrance to a shrine)

content:

〈自他動〉
1. To presume upon (one's good nature); to take liberties with (one's superiors); to dally with, coax, tease (mamma, etc.)

content.content: それではせっかくですからお言葉に甘えて
Since you are so pressing, I shall presume upon your kindness―avail myself of your kind offer.
あの男はちょっとお太鼓肌で長官に甘えて勝手な事を言う
He has something of the buffoon in him, and takes liberties with his chief.
子どもがお母さんに甘えている
The child is teasing mamma.
花ちゃんはお母さんに甘えて何でも欲しい物を買って貰う
Hana-chan will coax her mamma out of anything she wants.
大きくなってからお母さんに甘えてはおかしいわ
A big girl ought not to dally with her mamma.

content: 2. (=甘たれる)to get spoilt

content.content: 君は子どもを大事にし過ぎるから甘えるのだ
You make too much of your children, and that's why they get spoilt―(他動詞構文にすれば)―You spoil your children by making too much of them.
犬が主人に甘える

content:
あまもよう〔雨模様〕
〈名〉Signs of rain

content.content: 雨模様あり
There are signs of a coming rain.
雨模様がしてきたぜ
It looks like rain―It threatens to rain.
［天気予報］晴ただし雨模様あり
Fair, with signs of rain.

content:
あまもり〔雨漏り〕
〈名〉A leak in the roof

content.content: この家は雨漏りがする
The roof leaks.

content:
あまやかす〔甘やかす〕
〈他動〉To pet, fondle, cocker, coddle, indulge, spoil (a child)

content.content: この子はお婆さんが甘やかすものだから甘ったれて困る
The child is petted and spoiled by Grandma.
一人子だから甘やかしておきます
I indulge him―let him have everything his own way―for he is my only child.
君は生徒を甘やかし過ぎるから生徒が増長するのだ
You spoil the students by over-indulgence.

content:
あまやどり〔雨宿り〕
〈名〉Taking shelter:(=する) to take shelter (from the rain)

content.content: 途中で雨に逢って路傍の神社に雨宿りした
I was caught in a shower, and took shelter in a wayside shrine.
雷雨に逢った時、大木の下に雨宿りするな
When you are overtaken by a thunderstorm, do not take shelter under a tree.

content:
あまよけ〔雨除け〕
〈名〉A shelter; a shed; a cover

content.content: 貨物の雨除けをする
to cover the goods

content:
あまり〔余り〕
〈名〉
1. (=余分)what is left over; surplus; superfluity:(=の) superfluous; spare

content.content: (きっちりで)余りは無い
There is none left over―no surplus.
金はきっちりで余りは無い
The money is barely sufficient, and leaves no surplus.
要るだけの金は貰ったが余りは無い
I have received the sum I want, but I have no money to spare.
使い余り
what is left over after spending―the remnant
食い余り
scraps―leaving―remnants of food

content: 2. (=過度)excess:(=の) excessive (joy); too much (care); immoderate (pride); inordinate (pride); extravagant (hopes); exorbitant (price)

content.content: 彼は悔しさのあまり自害した
He killed himself in the excess of his vexation.
嬉しさのあまり何事も打忘れた
I forgot everything in the excess of my joy―(を略して)―in my joy.
嬉しさのあまり落涙した
I shed tears in my joy―in the fullness of my heart―I cried for joy.
彼はあまりの嬉しさに気が変になった
Excessive joy has turned his head.
彼女はあまりの悲しさに目を泣きつぶした
She cried herself blind in the excess of her sorrow―in her sorrow.
あまり急いで財布を忘れてきた
I have forgotten my purse in my hurry.
熱心のあまり用心を忘れてはならぬ
You must not forget your caution in the excess of your zeal―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your zeal must not outrun your caution.

content:
〈副〉
1. (形容詞、副詞に伴えば)too

content.content: あまり大きい
It is too large.
あまり多い
There is too much―There are too many.
あまり少ない
There is too little―There are too few.
彼はあまり気が大きい
He is too generous―generous to a fault.
あまりまじめだ
He is too grave―grave a sadness.
あまり気が優しい
He is too tender―tender to weakness.

content: 2. (動詞に伴えば)too much; to excess

content.content: 君はあまり酒を飲む
You drink too much―You drink to excess.
あまり早口だ
You speak too fast.
あまり働く
You work too hard―You overwork yourself.
あまり働くと死ぬぞ
If you work too hard, you will die―(単文にすれば)―You will work yourself to death.
あまり勉強すると病気になるぞ
If you overwork yourself, you will make yourself ill―(単文にすれば)―You will work yourself ill.
あまり勉強して肺病にでもなってくれるな
You must not work yourself into consumption.
僕にあまり望みを嘱しては困る、失望するから
You must not expect too much of me, lest you should be disappointed.
あまりといえば人を馬鹿にしている
He shall know that I am not to be trifled with.

content: 3. (打ち消しが続けば) so...that...can not...; too...to...

content.content: この本はあまりむつかしくて読めない
This book is so difficult that I can not read it―It is too difficult for me to read.
彼はあまりふっとていて走れない
He is so stout that he can not run―He is too stout to run.
彼はあまり正直で嘘も吐けない
He is so honest that he can not tell a lie―He is too honest to tell a lie.
日中はあまり暑くて出られぬ
The days are so hot that one can not go out―The days are too hot to go out.
その光景あまり恐ろしくて二た目と見られぬ
The sight is so dreadful that it can not be seen twice―The sight is too dreadful to be seen twice.
あまり嬉しくて黙っていられなかった
I was so glad that I could not contain myself―I was too glad to contain myself―I could not contain myself for joy.
あまり悲しくて泣かずにいられなかった
I felt so sad that I could not but cry―I felt too sad not to cry.
あまり悲しくてかえって泣けなかった
I was so sad that I could not cry―I was too sad to cry―My sorrow was too deep for tears.
あまりおかしくて笑わずにいられなかった
I was so tickled that I could not but laugh―I was too much tickled not to laugh.

content: 4. (属文が続けば) so...that...

content.content: 彼はあまり勉強して病気になった
He worked so hard that he made himself ill―He worked himself ill.
あまり悲しいから泣いた
I felt so sad that I cried.
あまりおかしいから笑った
I felt so tickled that I laughed.
あまり悔しいから死んでしまおうかと思った
I felt so vexed that I thought of dying.
あまり笑って涙が出た
I laughed till the tears came―I laughed till I cried.
あまり笑ってげんなりする
to laugh oneself limp and helpless
あまりのことに立腹した
I lost my patience―My patience was exhausted.

content: 5. (打ち消しに伴えば)(not) much; (not) very; (not) over

content.content: 彼はあまり勉強しない
He does not work very hard―He is not over-diligent.
あまり才子でない
He is not very clear―not over-clever.
あまり学問ができない
He is not much of a scholar.
成功の見込みはあまり無い
There is not much hope of success―little hope of success.
あの人の文章はあまり感心しない
I don't care much for his style.
彼にはあまり会わない
I don't see much of him―I see little of him.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. Above; beyond; more than

content.content: 彼の処置は賞讃するに余りあり
His conduct is above praise.
その熱心感ずるに余りあり
His zeal is above commendation.
その苦心察するに余りあり
His labour is above my comprehension―beyond my comprehension―It passes comprehension.
想像するに余りあり
There are ample grounds for the supposition.
道具は荷車に積んでなお余りある
The furniture more than fills a cart―There is more than a cartload of furniture.
収支償ってなお余りあり
The profits more than cover the expenses.

content: 2. (数詞に前置すれば)over; more than; upwards of

content.content: 生徒は五千人余りある
There are over five thousand students.
五十余り
over fifty―more than fifty―fifty odd
五十余りの男
a man over fifty years old―fifty odd years old―in his fifties
十年余りも洋行しておった
He has been abroad over ten years―for upwards of ten years.

content:
あまりもの〔余り物〕
〈名〉
1. (=残品)remnants (of food); leavings (from the table); scraps (left on the table)

content.content: 乞食のように余り物を食っている
He lives, like a beggar, on scraps and leavings.
余りものを貰って食っている
He lives on people's leavings―subsists on the scraps from the table.

content: 2. (=人が取って後に残ったもの) the last one left

content.content: 余りものに福あり
The last one is lucky―(英国では)―The last one brings “a beautiful wife and ten thousand pounds a year.”

content:
あまる〔余る〕
〈自動〉
1. To be left over

content.content: 一つ余る
There is one left over―one too many.
金がいくら余るか
How much money is there left over?―What is the surplus sum?
いくつ余るか
How many are there left over?

content: 2. (=あり余る)(人を主格とすれば)to have too much, have too many, have more than enough:(物を主格とすれば) to be more than enough, be in excess, be superabundant; to superabound

content.content: あの人は金が余っている
He has more than enough money―more money than he can spend―(綺麗に言えば)―enough money and to spare.
米国には金が余っている
In America, there is more than enough money―more money than is needed―enough money and to spare.
可愛さあまって憎さ百倍
The deepest love turns into the deepest hatred.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. Over

content.content: 年齢は五十に余る
He is over fifty―past fifty―gone fifty―turned of fifty―on the wrong side of fifty―on the dark side of fifty―on the shady side of fifty.

content: 2. Beyond

content.content: 力に余る
It is beyond my power to do so.
仕事は力に余る
The task is beyond my strength.
力に余る仕事はするな
Do not attempt a task beyond your strength.
子どもらが手に余る
The children are getting out of hand―getting beyond control―too much for me.

content: 3. Above; more than

content.content: 道具は荷車に積んで余る
The furniture more than fills the cart―There is more than a cartload of furniture.
収支償って余る
The profits more than cover the expenses.
そのお賞めは身に余ります
I do not deserve your praise―Your praise is more than I deserve―Your praise is above my deserts―It is undeserved praise.
これは身に余る光栄です
This is undeserved honour―The honour is more than I deserve―The honour is above my deserts.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 思案に余った
I am at the end of my resources―at my wits' end.
冥加に余ります
I am very fortunate―It is a great blessing.
冥加に余った奴だ
You are a lucky dog―a made man.
冥加に余って増長する
to be spoiled by good fortune

content:
あまんじて〔甘んじて〕
〈副〉Contentedly

content.content: 武士は甘んじて貧しい暮らしをした
The samurai lived in contented poverty.
甘んじて虐待を受ける
to submit to ill-treatment
甘んじて罰を受ける
to submit to punishment―“kiss the rod”

content:
あまんずる〔甘んずる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=満足する)to content oneself (with anything)

content.content: 彼は地位に甘んじている
He is contented with his position.
僕は決して今日の地位に甘んじているわけではない
I am by no means contented with my present position.
君はどうしてこんな待遇に甘んじているか
How can you content yourself with such a small salary?
武士は貧に甘んじていた
The samurai lived in contented poverty.
無智に甘んずる
to repose in the lap of ignorance

content: 2. (=服従する)to submit to (some treatment)

content.content: 彼はそんな虐待を甘んじて受けるような人じゃない
He is not the man to (tamely) submit to such treatment.
甘んじて罰を受ける
to submit to punishment―“kiss the rod.”

content:
あみ〔網〕
〈名〉
1. A net:(集合的に言えば)netting

content.content: 網を張る
to spread a net―stretch a net―(テニスの網なら)―put up a net
網を張って待つ
to spread one's net for one's victim
網を掛ける
to set a net
網を掛けて待つ
to set one's net for game
網に掛かる
to be caught in a net
犯人は刑事の張った網に掛かった
The culprit was caught in the net the detective had spread for him.
網を引く
to haul a net―haul a seine
地引網
a seine―a drag-net
ひと網の魚
a haul of fish―a draught of fish
網を打つ
to cast a net
投網{とあみ}
a casting net
網をおろす
to lower a net―let out a net―dip a net
網を上げる
to raise a net―haul up a net―haul in a net
四つ手網
a dipping net
網ですくう
to scoop with a net
手網{てあみ}
a scoop-net
網で魚を取る
to net fish
網を引いて死体を捜索する
to drag the sea or river for bodies
網を引いて死骸を探した
We dragged (the sea) for the body―The sea was dragged for the body.
網をすく
to make a net
網を繕う
to mend a net
網の目
the meshes of a net
法律の網に掛かる
to fall into the meshes of the law―fall into the clutches of the law
法律の網を脱する
to get out of the clutches of the law
法律の網を潜る
to avoid the meshes of the law―elude the law―evade the law

content:
3. (=網細工)network, netting (of any kind)
4. (=網猟)net-fishing; netting

content.content: 網に行く
to go netting

あみあう〔編み合う〕
〈自動〉To intertwine

あみあげぐつ〔編み上げ靴〕
〈名〉Lace-shoes:(英国では)laced boots

あみあわせる〔編み合わせる〕
〈他動〉To intertwine; to interweave

content:
あみうち〔網打ち〕
〈名〉Casting the net; net-fishing; netting

content.content: 網打ちに行く
to go netting

content:
あみがさ〔編み笠〕
〈名〉A straw head-gear (often used in former times for veiling the face)

content.content: 深編み笠
a straw head-gear for veiling the face

あみがた〔網形〕
〈形〉Reticulate; reticular; netted

あみざいく〔網細工〕
〈名〉A network

あみじゃくし〔網杓子〕
〈名〉A wire-net ladle

あみじゅばん〔網襦袢〕
〈名〉A network shirt, a netted shirt (for hot weather)

あみすき〔網すき〕
〈名〉Net-making; netting

content:
あみだくじ〔阿弥陀籤〕
〈名〉Clubbing money in different amounts fixed by drawing lots

content.content: あみだ籤を引く
to draw lots for the amount to be clubbed by each

content:
あみだす〔編み出す〕
〈他動〉To devise, contrive, frame, work out, study out (rules, etc.)

content.content: 一流を編み出す
to frame a system―work out a system

あみだな〔網棚〕
〈名〉A basket rack

content:
あみだぶつ〔阿弥陀仏〕
〈名〉The Eternal Buddha

content.content: 帽子をあみだにかぶる
to wear one's hat on the back of one's head

あみばり〔編み針〕
〈名〉A knitting-needle

あみひき〔網引き〕
〈名〉Hauling the net:(=する) to haul the net

content:
あみめ〔網目〕
〈名〉The meshes of a net

content.content: 網目細工、網目組織
network
網目版
the half-tone process

content:
あみもの〔編み物〕
〈名〉Knitting

content.content: 編み物をする
to knit
フランスの女は終始編み物をしている
A Frenchwoman is always knitting.

content:
あみりょう〔網猟〕
〈名〉Net-fishing; netting

content.content: 網猟に行く
to go netting

content:
あむ〔編む〕
〈他動〉
1. To knit (stockings); to net (a hammock); to braid (the hair); to plait (straw); to weave (a mat); to twist (garlands―flowers into garlands)

content.content: 靴下を編んであげましょう
I will knit you a pair of socks.

content: 2. (=編み出す)to weave (facts into a narrative); to compile (a history); to compose (an essay); to devise (a method); to contrive (a plan); to work out (a system); to frame (rules, etc.)

content.content: 憲法を編む
to frame a constitution

content:
あめ〔飴〕
〈名〉Rice-sugar; rice-jelly

content.content: 飴をしゃぶる
to chew ame―(に相当するは)―suck candy.
飴を食わせる、飴をねぶらせる
to cajole one―wheedle one―give one line
始めは飴を食わしておく
It is good policy to give them line at first.
飴をねぶらせられた
I have been consoled―been wheedled―(into doing something foolish).
飴色
amber-colour

content:
あめ〔雨〕
〈名〉
1. Rain:(一回の雨)a rain; a rainfall:(にわか雨) a shower

content.content: 雨が降る
Rain falls―It rains.
雨が降っている
It is raining.
雨が今日で六日降っている
It has been raining for six days today.
雨が明日まで降ると一週間降る
It will have been raining for a week tomorrow.
雨の降る日に
on a rainy day
雨が降りしきっている
It is raining hard.
入梅には雨がたくさん降る
Much rain falls in the rainy season.
砂漠は雨が降らぬ
No rain falls in desert.
雨が少しも降らぬ
Not a drop of rain falls.
日本は雨が多い
Much rain falls―There is much rainfall―in Japan.
今年は雨が多い
Much rain has fallen―It has rained much―There has been much rain―We have had much rain―this year.
近頃は雨が少ない
Little rain has fallen―It has rained little―There has been little rain―We have had little rain―lately.
大雨が降る
There is a heavy rain.
大雨が降って河が溢れた
There was a heavy rainfall, and the rivers overflowed―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The heavy rainfall made the rivers overflow.
雨がびしょびしょ降る
It drizzles.
雨がざーざー降る
The rain pours down.
雨がぱらぱら降る
The rain pelts.
篠衝く雨
a pelting rain
盆を覆すような雨、雨は車軸を流すよう
There is a downpour―The rain falls in torrents―“It rains cats and dogs.”
今日は雨らしいぜ
It looks as if it would rain―(を縮めて通例)―It looks like rain.
雨が降りそうだ
It threatens to rain―(雨を望む場合なら)―It promises to rain.
今にも雨が降り出しそうだ
It threatens to rain every moment.
雨が降りだした、雨が降ってきた
It is beginning to rain―(長雨なら)―Rain has set in―Rainy weather has set in.
明日は雨だ
It is going to rain tomorrow.
雨が降り続く
It continues to rain―(と言うよりも通例)―It goes on raining.
この雨が続くと洪水になる
If it goes on raining, there will be a flood.
雨が止んだか
Has it stopped raining?
まだ雨が降っている
It is still raining―It goes on raining.
あの雨の音が聞こえないか
Hark! Don't you hear the rain?
雨蛙が鳴くと雨が降る
When the tree-frog croaks, it is a sign of rain.
朝焼けがすると雨が降る
The morning-glow is a sign of rain.
曇天必ずしも雨ならず
A cloudy sky is not always a sign of rain.
そこは雨が降る
You are standing in the rain.
そこは雨が降るから早くこっちへお入り
Come in out of the rain―Make haste in out of the wet.
雨が降って空中の塵を払う
The rain clears the air from dust.
雨が降ると埃が立たぬ
The rain lays the dust.
雨降って地固まる
“Good comes out of evil.”
雨に降られる
to have it rain
昨日は一日雨に降られてとうとう出かけずにおわった
It rained yesterday, and I kept indoors all day.
雨に降り込められる
to be kept indoors by the rain
あいにくの雨です
It is a pity it is raining.
この雨に行くのか
Are you going in this rain?
雨を冒して行く
I will go notwithstanding the rain―in spite of the rain―(他動詞構文にすれば)The rain shall not prevent my going.
雨が止む、雨が上がる、雨が晴れる
It ceases raining―It stops raining―The rain holds up―(米国では)―The rain lets up―(一般に)―The weather clears up.
雨が晴れそうだ
The weather promises to clear.
晴れない雨は降ったことがない
“It is a long lane that has no turning.”
雨の晴れ間に
during a lull in the rain
雨の晴れ間に帰ろう
I must leave when there is a lull in the rain.
雨が風になる
Rain gives place to wind.
雨になるか風になるか
Will it be a fall or a blow?
雨に逢う
to be caught in a shower
途中で雨に逢って、路傍の神社に雨宿りした
I was caught in a shower, and took shelter in a wayside shrine.
雨に濡れる
to get wet with rain
雨にびしょ濡れ
I am drenched with rain.
張り子でないから雨に濡れても平気だ
I am not made of sugar―not made of salt.
着物を雨に当てる
to expose one's clothes to the rain
雨に当たる
to expose oneself to the rain―be exposed to the rain
材木を雨に当てて腐らした
The timbers are rotten through exposure to the rain.
この家は雨が漏る
The roof leaks.
ひと雨ごとに殖える
to increase with every rainfall
血の雨が降る
There is bloodshed.
血の雨を降らす
to shed blood
拳骨の雨が降った
It rained blows―There was a rain of blows―He received a shower of blows.
涙の雨を降らした
She burst into a flood of tears.
盃の雨が降るようだ
It rains cups.
彼は恵みの雨を降らせる
He showers benefits upon us.

あめ〔天〕
〈名〉The heavens:(天国) Heaven

あめいろ〔飴色〕
〈名〉A transparent brown colour; amber-colour

あめうり〔飴売り〕
〈名〉An ame vendor

あめがち〔雨勝ち〕
〈形〉Rainy (weather or season or place)

あめざいく〔飴細工〕
〈名〉Fancy work in ame:(より)something unsubstantial

あめつち〔天地〕
〈名〉Heaven and earth

content:
あめふり〔雨降り〕
〈名〉
1. (=雨の降る時、雨天)(in) rainy weather; (in) wet weather

content.content: 雨降りには何をして遊ぶか
How do you amuse yourself in rainy weather?
雨降りには読書
I amuse myself reading in wet weather.

content: 2. (=雨の降る所)(in) the rain; (in) the wet

content.content: 雨降りに歩く
to walk (out) in the rain―in the wet
雨降りに歩いてびしょ濡れになった
I have been walking out in the wet, and am drenched with rain.
雨降りに出かける
to go out into the rain
この雨降りにお出かけか
Are you going out into the wet?―going out in this rain?

content:
あめふりあがり〔雨降り上がり〕
〈副〉After a rain

content.content: 雨降り上がりは晴れ晴れする
It is bright and clear after a rain.
雨降り上がりの葺の様
to increase with every rainfall―grow with the rapidity of the prophet's gourd

あめます〔あめ鱒〕
〈名〉The great lake trout; the ferox

あめや〔飴屋〕
〈名〉
1. An ame vendor
2. (=駄菓子屋)A coarse-confectionary shop

content:
あめりか〔亜米利加<アメリカ>〕
〈固名〉America:(=の) American

content.content: その船はアメリカへ行っている
The ship is now in American waters.
北アメリカ、南アメリカ
North America―South America.
アメリカ州
the Continent of America―the Americas
アメリカ合衆国
the United States of America(U. S. A.―と略す)―Uncle Sam―(は U. S.に掛けての洒落)
アメリカ人
an American―a Yankee
アメリカ英語
an Americanism
アメリカの俗語
an American slang―a Yankee slang
アメリカ化する
to Americanize―be Americanized

content:
あめりか〔亜米利加<アメリカ>〕
〈固名〉America:(=の) American

content.content: その船はアメリカへ行っている
The ship is now in American waters.
北アメリカ、南アメリカ
North America―South America.
アメリカ州
the Continent of America―the Americas
アメリカ合衆国
the United States of America(U. S. A.―と略す)―Uncle Sam―(は U. S.に掛けての洒落)
アメリカ人
an American―a Yankee
アメリカ英語
an Americanism
アメリカの俗語
an American slang―a Yankee slang
アメリカ化する
to Americanize―be Americanized

あめんど〔巴旦杏〕
〈名〉The almond

content:
アーモンド
〈名〉→『

content.content: あめんど〔巴旦杏〕

content:
あや〔綾〕
〈名〉
1. (=織物の綾)figures (on silk)
2. (=綾織)figured silk
3. (=綾羅紗の綾)twill
4. (=世の綾)the web of the world; the web of destiny
5.

content.content: 綾を取る
to play (at) cat's cradle

あや〔文〕
〈名〉
1. (=言葉の文) a figure of speech
2. (=巧みの文)the intricacies (of a plot):(より)a plot; a plan

content:
あやううする〔危ううする〕
〈他動〉To endanger (one's life); to imperil (one's soul); to compromise, commit (one's honour); to menace (peace, etc.)

content.content: 生命を危ううする
to endanger one's life
そんな条約をされては東洋の平和を危ううする
Such a treaty would menace the peace of the East―be a menace to the peace of the East.

content:
あやうき〔危うき〕
〈形〉Dangerous (illness); perilous (adventure); precarious (life of a fisherman); critical (period or state)

content.content: 危うい冒険だ
It is a dangerous adventure―a perilous adventure.
危うい命
a life in danger
生命危うし
His life is in danger.
危うい命が助かった(生命に別条なし)
His life is out of danger.
今日明日にも危うい命だ
His life hangs by a thread.
病気危うし
He is dangerously ill.
彼は危うい病気にかかって助かった
He has recovered from a dangerous illness.
病人が危うい
The invalid is in a critical state.
病人は今日が危うい(今日峠を越す)
The invalid passes the crisis today.
彼は危ういところを助かった
He is delivered from danger―snatched from the jaws of death―He has escaped a danger―had a narrow escape―had a close call.
実に危ういところだった
I had a narrow escape―It was a close shave.
あの銀行は危うい(破産に瀕している)
That bank is on the point of failing―on the brink of bankruptcy.
あの家は危うい(破滅に瀕している、倒れかけている)
That house is on the verge of ruin―on the point of falling―nodding to its fall―tottering to its fall.
彼の地位が危うい(いつ免職になるかも知れぬ)
He may lose his position at any moment―He holds his office on a precarious tenure.
君子は危うきに近寄らず
The wise man does not court danger―The wise man does not tempt Providence.

content:
あやうく〔危うく〕
〈副〉Narrowly; very nearly

content.content: 危うく死ぬところだった
I narrowly escaped death―I very nearly died―I came near dying.
危うくこの崖から落ちるところだった
I very nearly fell over this precipice―I came near falling over this precipice.

あやおり〔綾織〕
〈名〉
1. Figured silk
2. Diagonal cloth; twill

content:
あやかりもの〔肖り者〕
〈名〉A lucky dog; a lucky beggar; a made man

content.content: あの主人のお気に入ったらお前はあやかり者だ
If you are in favour with your present master, you are a made man.

content:
あやかる〔肖る〕
〈他動〉To resemble, take after (a lucky person)

content.content: 君にあやかりたいものだ
I should like to take after your luck―tread in your lucky steps.

content:
あやしい〔怪しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=胡散{うさん}な)suspicious (person or behaviour); ugly (look or conduct)

content.content: (無職業でぜいたくをしている)あやしい人物だ
He is a suspicious character.
あやしい男が家の廻りを徘徊している
A suspicious fellow is prowling about the house.
あの男は挙動があやしいから注意しろ
Keep an eye on that man: his movements are suspicious.
あの家にはあやしい外人が出没する
That house is frequented by a suspicious foreigner.
ある日のことあやしい船が沖合いに現れた
One day a suspicious-looking craft appeared in the offing.
(彼がその金を取ったとすると)行動があやしい
His conduct looks ugly―His conduct has an ugly look―Appearances are against him.
男女二人が同席しているところを見つかったとするとあやしい
If the two were found together, it looks ugly―appearances are against them.
人をあやしいと思う
to suspect a person
なるほどあやしいと思われるのもごもっともだが身に覚えはありません
You have good reason to suspect us,―It is true appearances are against us,―but we are innocent.
(菓子を食ったのは)君じゃないか、あやしいぜ
Are you not the man? It looks like you―Appearances are against you.
(相手が裏切などしやしないか)こいつあやしいと思った(勘づいた、けどった)
I suspected treachery―smoked foul play―smelled a rat.
それでは僕があやしいとおっしゃるのですか
Do you mean to say that I am suspicious?―that you suspect me?―that you think me guilty?
二人はあやしい仲だ
They have suspicious relations with each other.
彼は女将とあやしい
He has suspicious relations with the landlady.
(近頃よく物が無くなるが)どうもあの男があやしいと思われる
I have reason to suspect that man―have every reason to suspect him.
(あの人につき悪い評判があるが)煙あれば火ありで、何だかあやしい
Matters look suspicious―Things look ugly. There is no smoke without fire, you know.

content: 2. (=如何わしき、いかさまな)questionable (transaction); dubious (business); underhand (doings)

content.content: (素性のわからない)あやしい人物だ
He is a questionable character.
あの男が怪しい取引に関係するのは常だ
He is always mixed up in questionable dealings―dubious transactions―shady transactions―loose transactions―underhand transactions―hole-and-corner transactions.
よくあやしい会社を起こす
He is a promoter of questionable companies―bogus companies.
彼はよくあやしい者(芸者か何か)を連れて箱根や日光へ行く
He often goes to Hakone or Nikko in questionable company―in dubious company.
彼は(詐欺と言ってもよいような)あやしい手段を用いる
He resorts to questionable means―dubious means―bordering on fraud.
あれはあやしい儲けでこしらえた身代だ
He has built up his fortune by questionable gains―by dubious gains.

content: 3. (=信じ難き)incredible, doubtful (story, etc.)

content.content: (金を落としたとは)あやしい話だ
It is an incredible story―It is a doubtful story―His story won't wash.
(今にも降り出しそうな)あやしい空
It is doubtful weather―threatening weather―The sky looks threatening.
彼は成功はあやしいものだ
His success is doubtful―It is doubtful if he will succeed―It is a question whether he will succeed or not.

content: 4. (=信頼し難き)unreliable, untrustworthy (promise, etc.)

content.content: あの人の英語はあやしいもんだ
His English is not to be trusted―He is no English scholar.
僕の法律はあやしいもんだ
I am no lawyer.
あの人の約束はあやしいもんだ
His promises are not to be relied upon―He is no man of his word.

content: 5. (=不思議な)wonderful (event); mysterious (fate); portentous (signs); weird (tale); unearthly (look); uncanny (voice in the air, etc.)

content.content: 近頃はよくあやしい事がある
There have been many portents―signs and wonders―of late.
ああらあやしやな
O wonder of wonders!―Heaven protect us!―“Angels and ministers of grace defend us!”

content:
あやしげな〔怪しげな〕
〈形〉Questionable (transaction); dubious (business)

content.content: 門にあやしげな看板が掛かっている
There is a questionable-looking signboard over the door.
あの男はよくあやしげな会社を起こす
He is a floater of questionable companies―bogus companies.

content:
あやしみ〔怪しみ〕
〈名〉
1. (=怪しむこと)Suspicion

content.content: あやしみを受ける
to incur suspicion―fall under suspicion
彼は急に金持ちになったので人のあやしみを受けた
He incurred suspicion by suddenly growing rich―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His sudden acquisition of wealth gave rise to suspicion―excited suspicions―aroused suspicions.
君はあまり金を使うとあやしみを受けるぞ
If you spend too much money, you will incur suspicion―fall under suspicion―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your extravagance will excite suspicions―arouse suspicions.
僕はあやしみを受けるような者ではない
I am above suspicion.
あやしみを避ける
to disarm suspicion
(悪い事を企てて)人のあやしみを避ける為に早く寝た
I went to bed early to disarm suspicion―to dispel suspicion.

content:
2. (=いぶかり)wonder
3. (=あやぶみ)distrust; mistrust

あやしむ〔怪しむ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=疑る)to suspect (a man to be a spy―one of treachery); to regard (one) with suspicion

content.content: こいつスパイだろうとあやしんだ
I suspected him to be a spy.
こいつ裏切りをしはしないかとあやしんだ
I suspected the man of treachery.
あまり見すぼらしい身なりをしていたものだから車屋まであやしんですぐ乗せてくれなかった
I was so shabbily dressed that the very jinrikishaman looked on me with suspicion―looked on me with dark eyes―looked twice at me.
あやしまれる
to be suspected―incur suspicion―fall under suspicion
彼は急に金持ちになったので人にあやしまれた
He incurred suspicion by suddenly growing rich―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His sudden acquisition of wealth gave rise to suspicion―excited suspicions―aroused suspicions.
君はあまり金を使うとあやしまれるぞ
If you spend too much money, you will incur suspicion―fall under suspicion―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your extravagance will excite suspicions―arouse suspicions.
(悪い事を企てて)人にあやしまれないように早く寝た
I went to bed early to disarm suspicion―to dispel suspicion.
(男女同席して)あやしまれるのもごもっともだが身に覚えはない
You have good reason to suspect us,―Appearances are against us,―but we are innocent.

content: 2. (=そうかしらとあやしむ、いぶかる)to wonder (if it can be so―who or what or where or how it can be)

content.content: 聞く人は本当かしらとあやしむだろう
People will wonder if it can be true.
僕の処置が(悪いと人が言うが)どこが悪いかしらとあやしんだ
I wondered how I could have done wrong.
彼はどうしてあんな身代をこしらえたかとあやしまざるを得ない
I can not but wonder how he can have amassed such a fortune.
あの勉強家が成功したのはあやしむに足らぬ(当然だ)
It is no wonder―quite natural―that such a hard-working man should have succeeded.
あえてあやしむに足らず(さもあるべし)
It is no great wonder that it should be so―What wonder that it should be so?

content: 3. (=危ぶむ)to distrust, mistrust (a man or his powers)

content.content: (僕は若いもんだから)人はあやしんで大事な仕事をまかしてくれない
People mistrust me and will not entrust me with any important business―(を単文にすれば)―People will not trust me with any important business.

content:
あやしむべき〔怪しむべき〕
〈形〉Suspicious

content.content: 陳述中にあやしむべき点がある
There are some suspicious points in his statement.

content:
あやす
〈他動〉To caress, dandle, dance, fondle, pet (a child)

content.content: 子どもをあやす
to caress a child
膝の上で子どもをあやす
(男なら)He dances the baby on his knees―(女なら)―She dandles the baby in her lap.

あやつりにんぎょう〔綾操り人形〕
〈名〉A puppet; a marionette:(の見世物)A puppet-show

content:
あやつる〔操る〕
〈他動〉To pull the strings, pull the wires (originally, of puppets); to make a puppet of (a man); to handle, manipulate, manage, manoeuvre (anything with skill)

content.content: 人を操る
to make a puppet of a man
人を上手に操る
to manage a man with skill―manoeuvre a man with tact
黒幕となって人を操る
to pull the wires―pull the strings
舟を操る
to manage a boat
帆を操る
to manage a sail
櫓を操る
to handle a scull
英語を操る
to speak English
彼は英語を自在に操る
He has a perfect command of English―He is at home in English.

あやとり〔綾取り〕
〈名〉Cat's cradle:(=する) to play (at) cat's cradle

content:
あやどる〔綾取る〕
〈他動〉To twill

content.content: たすき十字に綾取る(に相当するは)
to gird up one's loins

あやなす〔操なす〕
〈他動〉To manage (a man) with tact

あやに〔奇に〕
〈副〉
1. Strangely; mysteriously
2. Very; most

content:
あやにく〔生憎〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: あいにく〔生憎〕

あやにしき〔綾錦〕
〈名〉Figured brocade

content:
あやぶむ〔危ぶむ〕
〈他動〉To distrust, mistrust (a person); to doubt of (success); to doubt of the success of (an undertaking); to think (an enterprise) risky; to look with cold eyes on, look with dark eyes on (a project)

content.content: 人は若い者を危ぶむ
People will mistrust a young man.
若い者を危ぶんで大事な事を託さない
People will not trust a young man with important business.
事業を危ぶんで資本を投ずる者が無い
People are doubtful of the success of the enterprise, and nobody will invest his money in it.
当局者は新計画を危ぶんでいる
The authorities look with cold eyes on the new project.

content:
あやふや
〈形〉
1. (=不確か)uncertain (purpose); dubious (attitude, etc.)

content.content: 賞められるのだかけなされるのだかあやふやだ
I am not quite sure whether I am being praised or dispraised.
だからあやふやな笑い顔をした
So I smiled a dubious smile.
あやふやな返事をした
I made a dubious reply to his remark.

content: 2. (=曖昧)ambiguous (meaning); equivocal (answer); non-committal (reply)

content.content: (言質を取られないように)あやふやな返事をした
I gave an equivocal answer―made a non-committal reply―to his question.

content:
あやまち〔過ち〕
〈名〉
1. (=過失)a fault; an error:(ばかげた過ち)a folly:(うかつな過ち)an imprudence:(男女間の過ち)an indiscretion

content.content: 過ちをする
to commit a fault―(男女間なら)―commit an indiscretion
男女間の過ちは若い時はありがちだ
Young people will be indiscreet.
過ちを改める
to correct a fault―amend one's fault
過ちを改むるにはばかるなかれ
Be not afraid to amend your fault―(に相当する格言は)―“It is never too late to mend.”
過ちをわびる
to acknowledge one's fault
過ちの無い人は無い
No man is free from faults―No man is without his faults―Every man has his faults―(に相当するは)―“To err is human.”
天に過ち無し
“Whatever is, is right.”
天をうらみ人を咎むる
Never be wroth with Providence,
事はあらじ
Nor blame thy fellow-man;
我が過ちと
But well reflect on thine own fault
思い返さば
Committed 'yond thy ken!

content: 2. (=けが)an accident

content.content: 過ちをした
I have had an accident―met with an accident.
過ちは仕方が無い
Accidents will happen.
過ちの功名だ
It was an accidental hit―a chance hit―(球突きなら)―a fluke.

content:
あやまつ〔過つ〕
〈自動〉
1. (=過ちをする)to err; to commit a fault

content.content: 過って改むるにはばかるなかれ
Do not be afraid to amend your fault―(に相当する格言は)―“It is never too late to mend.”

content: 2. (=仕損じる)to fail; to miss one's aim

あやまった〔誤った〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: あやまれる〔誤れる〕

content:
あやまって〔過って〕
〈副〉Accidentally; by accident

content.content: 彼は人と銃猟に行ってあやまって撃たれた
He went shooting with a companion, and got shot by accident.

content:
あやまって〔誤って〕
〈副〉By mistake; by oversight

content.content: 誤って汽車を乗り違えた
I took the wrong train by mistake.
誤って君の名を書き落とした
By an oversight, your name was left out.

content:
あやまらせる〔誤らせる〕
〈他動〉To mislead (one); to lead (one) astray; to debauch (one's mind); to vitiate (judgment)

content.content: 後進を誤らせる
to mislead the students
青年を誤らせる
to lead youths astray
未熟な批評は著作者を誤らせるばかりだ
Immature criticism only serves to debauch the mind of the writer.

content:
あやまり〔誤り〕
〈名〉A mistake; an error

content.content: 人には誤りあり
Man is liable to error―“To err is human.”
誤りの無い人
a man who never made a mistake―an infallible man
私の誤りでした
I have made a mistake―committed an error―(思い違いなら)―I am mistaken.
誤りを直す、誤りを正す
to correct a mistake―rectify an error―unlearn what one has learned amiss
彼は強情にも誤りを直さぬ
He persists in his error.
誤りを悟りましたから改めます
I am convinced of my error, so I will amend.
お話を承って誤りを悟りました
You have convinced me of my error―You have opened my eyes―My eyes are opened―The scales have fallen from my eyes.
彼の講義を聞いてこれまでの誤りを悟った
His lecture has convinced me of my error―His lecture was an eye-opener.
誤りを悟らせる
to convince one of one's error―undeceive one
この本は誤りが無い
This books is free from mistakes.
この本を通読してご覧、誤りが一つも無いから
Read through the book, and you shall not find a single mistake in it.
私の作文に誤りはありませんか
Are there any mistakes in my composition?
誤りは一つも無い
There is not a single mistake in it.
一つ二つの誤りは仕方が無い
One or two mistakes―A mistake or two―can not be helped.
甚しい誤りだ、ひどい誤りだ
It is a gross mistake.
こんなわかりきった誤りを見落すとは君も抜かったね
How stupid of you to overlook such an obvious mistake!
こんな明白な誤りを直さずにおいたのは不注意極まる
It is careless of you to leave such glaring errors.
あんな人を信用したのは重々の誤りです
I made a great mistake in trusting such a man.
文法の誤り
a grammatical mistake―a grammatical error―a solecism―false syntax
論法の誤り
an error in reasoning―a fallacy
計算の誤り
an error in calculation―a miscalculation
翻訳の誤り
an error in translation―a mistranslation
解釈の誤り
an error in interpretation―a misinterpretation―a misconstruction
発言の誤り
an error in pronunciation―a mispronunciation
綴りの誤り
an error in spelling―a misspelling
読み方の誤り
an error in reading―a misreading
応用の誤り
an error in application―a misapplication
年代の誤り
an error in dates―an anachronism
筆者の誤り
a clerical error
活字の誤り
a misprint―a typographical error
校正の誤り
the proof-reader's error

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: こう言っては誤りではありませんか(と英語の使い方を西洋人に尋ねるには)
Is it right to say so?―Is it good English to say so?
そう言っては誤りです
It is wrong to say so―It is not good English to say so.
筆の誤り
a slip of the pen
弘法も筆の誤り
“It is a wise man who never makes mistakes”―“The best marksman may miss”―“Even Homer nods sometimes.”
一毫の誤り千里の差
An inch here will make a mile there.

content:
あやまり〔謝り〕
〈名〉An apology

content.content: 謝りを言う
to apologize―beg one's pardon

content:
あやまりしょうもん〔謝り証文〕
〈名〉A written apology

content.content: 謝り証文を出せ
You must give a written apology.

content:
あやまる〔誤る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=失錯する)to make a mistake; to make an error; to commit an error; to do wrong; to do amiss

content.content: 人は誤りがち
Man is liable to error―“To err is human.”
我誤れり
I have made a mistake―I have done wrong―I have erred.
知らざるは誤るに勝る
“Better untaught than ill-taught.”
計算を誤る
to make an error in calculation―miscalculate
処置を誤る
to do wrong―mismanage
解釈を誤る
to make an error in interpretation―misinterpret―misconstrue
発音を誤る
to make an error in pronunciation―mispronounce a word
綴りを誤る
to make an error in spelling―spell a word incorrectly―misspell a word
読み方を誤る
to make an error in reading―misread a passage
翻訳を誤る
to make an error in translation―mistranslate a word
応用を誤る
to make an error in application―misapply a rule
年代を誤る
to make an error in dates―misdate an event―commit an anachronism
用方を誤る
to misuse a preposition
置きどころを誤る
to misplace anything
判断を誤る
to make an error in judgment―misjudge
方法を誤る
to proceed in the wrong way―go about it in wrong way
方針を誤る
to take a wrong course
方向を誤る
to err from the right course―fall into error
進退を誤る、去就を誤る
to take a wrong course of action
身を誤る、一身を誤る、一生を誤る
to fall into error―drift into error―go astray―ruin oneself―be ruined
私は一生を誤るところをお蔭で助かりました
You have saved me from ruin.
国事を誤る
to commit a political blunder―commit a political offence
外交を誤る
to make a mistake in diplomacy―commit a diplomatic blunder
立場を誤る
to stand in a false position
議論の前提を誤る
to argue from false premises
結論を誤る
to draw a wrong conclusion
人生観を誤る
to take a wrong view of life
見誤る
to see amiss
聞き誤る
to hear amiss―mishear
言い誤る
to say amiss―missay

content: 2. (=何を何と誤る)to mistake, take (one thing for another); to confound (one thing with another)

content.content: 手段と目的を誤る
to mistake the means for the end
金そのものを愛するは手段と目的を誤るのである
To love money for itself is mistaking the means for the end―confounding the means with the end.
本末を誤る
to mistake the means for the end―take the shadow for the substance―confound the essential with the unessential
一歩を誤る
to take a false step

content: 3. (=思い違いする)to be mistaken; to be wrong

content.content: 我誤れり
I am mistaken.
君誤れり
You are wrong.

content: 4. (=食い違う)to go wrong; to fail; to err

content.content: 事誤れり
The project has failed―The matter has gone wrong.
理性は誤る事あれども本能は誤る事無し
Reason may err, but instinct never errs.

content:
あやまる〔謝まる〕
〈自動〉To beg pardon (of a person―for a fault); to apologize (to a person―for a fault); to acknowledge one's fault

content.content: 謝まるなら許してやる
If you will acknowledge your fault, I will pardon you.
悪い事を致しました謝まります
I acknowledge my fault―I am sorry for what I have done.
彼は自分が悪かったと言って謝まった
He has acknowledged himself in the wrong.
彼は自分の間違いだと言って謝った
He has acknowledged his error.
彼は強情でどうしても謝まらない
He persists in refusing to acknowledge his fault.
君に謝まらなければならないことがある
I must apologize to you―I owe you an apology.
先生に謝まったか
Have you begged pardon of your teacher?
手をついて謝まれ(に相当するは)
Beg pardon on your knees!―Down on your knees!
すると彼は傲慢な態度を一変して平謝りに謝まったからゆるしてやった
Then he changed his tune and humbly begged my pardon―ate humble pie―so I let him off.

content:
あやまれる〔誤れる〕
〈形〉Mistaken (idea); erroneous (view); incorrect (estimate); wrong (construction); false (pride)

content.content: 貧を恥じるは誤れる名誉心である
It is false pride to be ashamed of poverty.

content:
あやめ〔菖蒲〕
〈名〉The iris

content.content: 六日の菖蒲十日の菊
It is too late―“a day after the fair.”

content:
あやめ〔文目〕
〈名〉Lines; figures; distinction

content.content: あや目も分からぬ真の闇
The night is pitch-dark―too dark to see an inch before one.

あやめぐさ〔菖蒲草〕
〈名〉(A poetical name for) the iris

あやめる

あやらしゃ〔綾羅紗〕

あやりんず〔綾綸子〕

content.content: 阿諛苟合{あゆこうごう}の徒
sycophants

〈自動〉To walk:(二三歩なら)to step

content.content: 歩む姿は柳腰
She walks a graceful willow.

content:
あーら
〈間投詞〉O...!; Oh!

content.content: あーら我君
O Lord!
あーら不思議や
Oh, wonder of wonders!―Lo and behold!
あーら怪しやな
Heaven protect us!―“Angels and ministers of grace defend us!”
あーらあさましや
What a shame!

content:
あら
〈名〉
1. (=魚のあら)the head and bones, the bony parts (of a fish used for special dishes)

content.content: あらをしゃぶる
to pick bones
あら煮
boiled bones

content: 2. (=人や物のあら)faults; defects; flaws

content.content: あらを拾う
to carp at faults―cavil at faults―peck at flaws
人のあらを拾う
to find faults in one―pick holes in one's coat
人の作などのあらを拾う
to find faults in―pick holes in―criticize―one's work
貰い物のあらを拾うな
Do not criticize a free gift―“Do not look a gift-horse in the mouth.”
あらを拾いたがる人だ
He is a captions man―a fault-finder―a caviller.
夜はあらが見えぬ
Personal defects are not seen by lamplight.
あらを見られるな
Do not expose your defects!
話し家は
The story-teller lives upon
世間のあらで飯を食い
The faults of men beneath the sun.

content:
あら
〈間投詞〉Oh!

content.content: あらまあ
Well, I never!―La!

content:
あら〔新〕
〈形〉New

content.content: 新で買う
to buy anything new
この本は新で買うよりは古手で買った方が得だ
It would pay better to buy the book second-hand than new.
(古手は古手でも)新も同然だ
It is as good as new.

あらあら〔粗々〕
〈副〉Roughly; briefly; in brief

あらあらかしく〔荒々かしく〕
〈婦人書簡文の結句〉Yours affectionately,...

content:
あらあらしい〔荒々しい〕
〈形〉Rough (handling); violent (temper); gruff (voice); harsh (tone); wild (wind); savage (disposition, etc.)

content.content: 荒々しい気性の人だ
He is a man of violent temper.
そんなに荒々しく扱ってはこわれます
It won't stand such rough handling.
「そのままそこにおれ」と言葉さえ荒々しく言った
“Stay where you are!” said he, roughly―gruffly―in a gruff tone.

content:
あらい〔荒い〕
〈形〉Rough (treatment); rude (behaviour); rugged (appearance); gruff(voice); harsh (tone); violent (temper); vehement (language); wild (life); savage (disposition); fierce (warrior); troubled (sea); unbroken (horse)

content.content: 今日は波が荒い
The sea is troubled―The waters are raging―today.
日本海は荒い
The Japan Sea is a rough sea.
九州人は気が荒い
The Kyushu people are of a violent temper―of a fiery temper―of a fierce disposition.
海も荒けりゃ気も荒い
The sea is wild, and so is my temper.
あの人は荒い気性だ
He is a man of violent temper.
九州の馬は荒い
Kyushu ponies are wild―intractable.
船着きは人気が荒い
The people of a seaport town are excitable―feverish―restless―lively.
小樽は人気の荒い所だ
Otaru is a lively place.
烈しい活動家は語気が荒い
Men of intense activity will use vehement language―violent language.
うちの人は荒い事なら一つ言ったことはありません
My husband never used violent language towards me.
金使いが荒い
He is extravagant―wasteful of money―prodigal of expense.
人使いが荒い
He works his men too hard―holds their noses to the grindstone.
筆づかいが荒い
His touches are careless and bold―His paintings are carelessly executed.
息が荒い
to breathe hard―blow like a grampus
(景気が好いと売手の)鼻息が荒い
The sellers stand firm―They will not come to terms―They are unapproachable.
あの医者の療治はちと荒い
His treatment is rather rough.
荒い療治をする
to resort to desperate remedies―(非常手段の意味なら)―take drastic measures
台湾は海岸線が荒い
Formosa has a rugged coast.
女の子に荒いことをするものじゃない
You should not be rude to girls.
一人っ子を荒い風にも当てないように育てた
They kept their only child as the apple of their eye.

content:
あらい〔洗い〕
〈名〉
1. Washing

content.content: この地は洗いが利くか
Does this material wash?―stand washing?
よく洗いが利きます
It washes very well.

content: 2. (=魚の洗い)slices cut from a live fish and crimped in cold water; crimped fish (a summer dish)

あらい〔粗い〕
〈形〉Coarse (grain, hair, texture); loose (fabric); gross (material); rough (skin); large (meshes)

content.content: この織物は織り目が粗い
The cloth is of course texture―of loose texture―a loose fabric.
この木は木目が粗い
The wood is coarse-grained.
この紙はきめが粗い
The paper is coarse-grained.
男はきめが粗い
Men have a coarse-grained skin―a rough skin.
この櫛は歯が粗い
This comb has coarse teeth.
この網は目が粗い
The net has large meshes.
肥後米は粒が粗い
The Higo rice is of large grains.
粗い縞
large stripes
粗い蛤
large clams

〈他動〉To wash off, wash out (stains, etc.)

content:
あらいがみ〔洗い髪〕
〈名〉(A woman's) hair newly washed and let down

content.content: 油気の無い洗い髪
newly-washed hair innocent of oil

あらいぐすり〔洗い薬〕
〈名〉A lotion; a wash; a detergent; a detersive

あらいぐま〔浣熊〕

content:
あらいざらい〔洗い浚い〕
〈副〉All; wholly; entirely; thoroughly; exhaustively

content.content: 洗いざらい持ってゆく
to make a clean sweep of everything
洗いざらい持って行かれた
They have made a clean sweep of my possessions.
ご馳走を洗いざらい平らげた
We have made a clean sweep of the table.
洗いざらい取られた
I was fleeced of all my possessions―stript to the skin.
洗いざらい無くした
I have lost my all―I am reduced to utter destitution―reduced to sheer beggary.
洗いざらい言ってしまった
I have left nothing unsaid―left no word unspoken.
洗いざらいの芸尽くしをする
to exhaust one's skill
洗いざらい研究する
to make an exhaustive study of a subject
洗いざらい取り調べる
to investigate a matter thoroughly―probe a matter to the bottom
洗いざらい釜の下の灰まで持って行かなきゃならない
I must take everything to the least tittle―everything to the last particle.

content:
あらいざらし〔洗い晒し〕
〈形〉Worn out from too much washing

content.content: 洗いざらしのシャツ
a worn-out shirt―a shirt which has seen much service

〈名〉A rough beach

content:
あらいだて〔洗い立て〕
〈名〉Close investigation; close examination; scrutiny; analysis:(=する) to investigate closely, examine closely, scrutinize, scan, analyze (one's motives); to ascertain (one's origin); to clear up (a mystery, etc.)

content.content: いまさら彼の所業を洗いだてするまでもあるまい
There is no need of scrutinizing his actions at this time of day.
折りに触れて彼の素性を洗いだてするのであった
They would, on occasion, allude to his low origin.

あらいたてる〔洗い立てる〕

〈他動〉To wash away (the sweat, etc.)

〈名〉Washing and stretching (cloth on a board); renovation (of old cloth):(=する) to wash and stretch (cloth on a board); to renovate (old cloth)

content:
あらう〔洗う〕
〈他動〉
1. To wash:(雅言にては)to lave

content.content: (朝)顔を洗う
to wash oneself
顔を洗って出直して来い
I will have nothing to do with you―I wish to see the last of you―I will stand no nonsense.
湯に入って身体をよくお洗いなさい
Take a bath and have a good wash.
手を洗う水が欲しい
I want some water to wash my hands with.
せっけんで手をお洗いなさい
Wash your hands with soap and water.
足を洗う
to wash one's feet―(乞食なら)―quit a beggar's life―(泥水商売なら)―quit a life of shame
河が岸を洗う
A river washes its shores.
洗い流す
to wash away sweat
洗い落とす
to wash off―wash out―stains
この色は洗っても落ちない
This colour will wash―stand washing.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 血で血を洗う
to cause a strife among the same flesh and blood
波が甲板を洗う
The sea sweeps the deck.
赤貧洗うが如し
He is in abject poverty―in utter destitution―in the direst want―“as poor as a church-mouse.”
もとを洗う
to inquire into the origin―ascertain the source
もとを洗えば皆作り事
When you go to the root of the matter, it is all fiction.
もとを洗えば(事実を洗って見れば)繁殖本能に過ぎぬ
When you come down to the cold fact, it is nothing but the instinct of propagation.
(泥棒の身代を表して)もとを洗えばただ取った金だ
It is originally no fruit of labour―It originally cost him no labour.
素性を洗う、戸籍を洗う
to inquire into one's origin―ascertain one's birth and parentage
素性を洗えば賤い身だ
He is a man of base origin.

content:
あらうま〔荒馬〕
〈名〉An unbroken horse; an unbroken colt

content.content: 荒馬を馴らす
to break in a colt―rough a horse―enter a horse
荒馬を乗り馴らす
to break a horse to the rein
荒馬を乗りこなす
to manage an unbroken horse

content:
あらうみ〔荒海〕
〈名〉(平常なら)a rough sea:(一時なら)a troubled sea; the raging waters

content.content: 荒海を渡る
to sail rough seas
こんな船で荒海は渡れぬ
The ship is not fit for a rough sea.

あらえびす〔荒夷〕
〈名〉Unsubdued barbarians

content:
あらおとこ〔荒男〕
〈名〉A rough fellow; a burly fellow; a strong man

content.content: 荒男三人がかりでできなかった
Three strong men could not do it among them.

content:
あらかじめ〔予め〕
〈副〉Beforehand; previously; in advance

content.content: あらかじめ知らしておく必要がある
We must inform beforehand―give previous notice.
(後から苦情の出ないように)あらかじめ断っておく、あらかじめ注意しておく、あらかじめ警告する、あらかじめご承知を乞う
I give you due warning―give you fair warning.
あらかじめ用意してあるらしい
It seems to be prepared beforehand―prepared in advance―all arranged―cut and dried―a got-up affair.

あらかせぎ〔荒稼ぎ〕
〈名〉
1. Rough work
2. (=泥棒)burglary; robbery

content:
あらかた〔荒方〕
〈副〉
1. (=ざっと)roughly; mostly; almost; all but (finished, etc.)

content.content: 仕事はあらかた片づいた
The work is almost finished―all but completed.
品物はあらかた片づいた
The goods are mostly sold―mostly disposed of.
今日の仕事はあらかた片づいた
I have broken the back of my day's work.

content: 2. (=概して)for the most part; on the whole; in the main; in substance; in sum and substance

content.content: 僕はあらかた君と同意だ
I agree with you in substance―in the main.
あらかた合っている
The accounts agree in the main―in substance.
あらかたお話しの通りです
You are, in the main, right―You are, on the whole, right―You are right in sum and substance.

あらかべ〔粗壁〕

content.content: 粗壁を塗る

content:

content.content: 荒肝を抜く
to tame a wild nature―break one's spirit

content:
あらぎょう〔荒業〕

content.content: 荒業を営む
to do penance―practise asceticism―practise austerities―mortify the flesh

あらくれおとこ〔荒くれ男〕

content:
あらけずり〔荒削り〕

content.content: 荒削りの木材
rohgh-hewn timber

あらごと〔荒事〕

content.content: 荒事師
an actor who plays the ruffian

あらさがし〔あら探し〕

content.content: あなさがし〔穴探し〕

content:
あらし〔荒し〕
〈名〉Devastation; desolation

content.content: 商船荒らし
preying on commerce
巡洋艦はもと商船荒らしの為に造ったものだ
Cruisers were originally intended to prey on commerce.
待合荒らし
assignation-house burglary

content:
あらし〔嵐〕
〈名〉A storm; a tempest; a war of the elements; a strife or the elements:(=の) stormy; tempestuous

content.content: 近年珍しい大嵐だった
It was such a storm as had not been seen for many a year.
嵐が起こる
A storm rises―A storm comes on.
嵐が猛威をきわめて襲いきた
A storm burst upon us in all its fury.
嵐が吹きすさむ
A storm rages.
今嵐の最中
A storm is raging.
嵐がだんだん烈しくなる
The storm gathers strength.
嵐が絶頂に達した
The storm is at its height.
嵐が鎮まる
The storm calms down―The storm dies away.
嵐が吹き止む
A storm blows itself out.
海上の嵐
a storm at sea
(海上で)嵐に逢う
to be overtaken by a storm―encounter a storm
船が嵐に逢って難破した
The ship was wrecked in a gale.
ある嵐の夜
one stormy night―one wild night
(月に叢雲)*花には嵐
“Roses have thorns.”

あらしごと〔荒仕事〕
〈名〉
1. Rough work
2. (=泥棒)burglary; robbery

content:
あらしょたい〔新世帯〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あらじょたい〔新世帯〕

content:
あらじょたい〔新世帯〕
〈名〉New housekeeping; a new home

content.content: 新世帯を持つ
to begin housekeeping
新世帯だから不自由な物だけらだ
Ours is a new home, and we want for everything.

あらじる〔あら汁〕
〈名〉A soup made from the bony parts of fish

content:
あらす〔荒らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=荒れさす)to waste, lay waste (a farm); to lay waste, devastate, desolate, ravage, overrun (a country); to ravage, make havoc of, work havoc with, play havoc among (the people); to harm, damage, do damage to, do harm to (the crops); to neglect (a garden); to dilapidate (a house); to roughen, fret, chafe (the skin); to ruffle (the lawn); to disturb (the ground, etc.)

content.content: 敵が国を荒らす
The enemy lay waste the country―devastate the country―desolate the country―overrun the country.
ベルギーはドイツ軍のために荒らされた
Belgium was laid waste―devastated―desolated―by the Germans.
野獣が田畑を荒らす
Wild beasts waste the fields―ravage the fields.
暴風雨が作物を荒らす
Storms harm the crops―damage the crops―do damage to the crops―do harm to the crops―make havoc of the crops.
これが暴風雨が荒らした跡だ
These are the ravages of the storm.
演習で百姓が田畑を荒らされる
When there is a manoeuvre, the peasants have their fields laid waste by the troops.
インドはしばしば蛮軍の荒らすところとなった
India was frequently overrun by savage hordes.
疫病が町を荒らした
The epidemic ravaged the town.
悪疫が市民を荒らした
The pestilence made havoc of―worked havoc with―played havoc among―the townspeople.
あれは婦人界を荒らす色魔だ
He is a libertine who makes havoc of―works havoc with―plays havoc among―the ladies.
庭が荒らしてある
The garden is neglected―ill-kept.
家が荒らしてある
The house is dilapidated―out of repair.
芝生が荒らしてある
The lawn is ruffled.
地面が荒らしてある
The ground is disturbed.
土をいじって手を荒らした
I have fretted the skin of my hands by handling earth.

content: 2. (=騒がす)to infest, haunt (a place)

content.content: あの森は追いはぎが荒らしている
Those woods are infested with footpads.
家は鼠の荒らすにまかしてある
The house is infested with vermin―abandoned to the rats.
あれは界隈を荒らした大賊だ
He is a notorious burglar who has been infesting the neighbourhood―the terror of the neighbourhood―a terror to the people of the neighbourhood.
あれは近海を荒らした海賊だ
He is a pirate who has been infesting these waters―the terror of these waters―a terror to the mariners who sail these waters.
この強盗は一時東京近在を荒らした
This robber was once the terror of the country about Tokyo―a terror to the people of the country about Tokyo.
彼は花柳界を荒らしている
He is a terror to the demi-monde―(反語に用いれば)―an idol of the frivolous community.
茶屋を荒らしている
He haunts the tea-house―frequents the tea-houses.
彼は東京へ出て私立学校を荒らして歩いた
He came upon the town, and overran the private schools.

content: 3. (=侵す)to encroach on, trespass on (a place)

content.content: 人の縄張りを荒らす
to trespass on one's sphere of influence―encroach on one's domain
猟場を荒らす(密猟する)
to poach on a preserve

content:
あらず〔非ず〕
〈打消動詞〉Not to be

content.content: 鯨は魚に非ず
The whale is not a fish.
彼は一書生にあらずして何ぞや
What is he but a student?
なかなかもってさにあらず
No such thing!―Nothing of the kind!

あらすじ〔粗筋〕
〈名〉The outline, the summary, the epitome (of a drama, etc.)

content:
あらずもがな
〈形〉Superfluous; not wanted; de trop

content.content: あんな奴はあらずもがなだ
I prefer his room to his company.

content:
あらずんば〔非ずんば〕
〈接続詞〉Unless; if not

content.content: 外国語を修むるにあらずんば自国語を知る能わず
Unless one studies a foreign language, one can not know one's own tongue.

content:
あらそい〔争い〕
〈名〉A dispute; a strife; a contention; a contest; a quarrel; a dissension; a difference; an issue

content.content: 争いが起こった
A dispute arose―Differences arose.
争いの種
the seeds of strife―the cause of strife―the bone of contention―the apple of discord
争いの種を蒔く
to sow the seeds of strife―sow the seeds of dissension
争いを調停する
to settle the dispute
争いを止める
to cease from strife
世の争いは止まらぬ
Man will never cease from strife.
世の争いは絶えぬ
There is everlasting strife in the world.
内輪に争いがある
There are family dissensions.
火元争い
a quarrel about the origin of fire
火元争いをする
to quarrel about the origin of the fire―try to throw the responsibility for the fire on each other
言葉の争いに過ぎぬ
It is only logomachy.

content:
あらそう〔争う〕
〈自他動〉
1. To dispute, quarrel, brawl, squabble, jangle, brangle, wrangle (with some one about or over something); to contend (with a rival for the prize); to compete (with each other for custom); to haggle, higgle (with one about or over the price); to strive for, struggle for (victory); to scramble for (places); to contest, dispute (a point); to claim (a right); to lay claim to (the property); pretend to (the crown); to have words (with any one)

content.content: 彼は人と争ったことが無い
He never had words with any one.
君達は何を争っているのか
What are you disputing about?―quarrelling about?
ここの意味について先生と争ったことがある
I once disputed with my teacher about the meaning of this passage.
獲物を争う
to contend for the prize
獲物が獲物だから争う価値がある
The prize is worth contending for.
こんなものは争う価値が無い
The prize is not worth contending for.
賞品を争う
to contend for the prize―try for the prize
地位を争う
to contend for a position―try for a position
兄弟が財産を争う
The brothers quarrel about the property―quarrel over the property―(法廷でなら)―claim the property―lay claim to the properly.
両犬骨を争えば第三犬これを奪い去る
When two dogs quarrel over a bone,―fight over a bone,―a third dog carries it off.
商人は得意を争う
Tradesmen compete for custom.
両軍雌雄を争う
The contending armies strive for mastery.
勝を争う
(勝敗決せぬうちなら)to strive for victory―contest the victory―dispute the victory―(勝敗決してからなら)―claim the victory
権利を争う
to claim a right―(法廷でなら)―contest a claim―dispute a claim
(医者などが)功を争う
to claim the honour of the affair―claim the credit of the affair
兄弟が王位を争った
The brothers laid claim to the crown―pretended to the crown―(戦場でなら)―fought for the crown.
二人が縄張りを争った
They disputed about their sphere of influence.
論点を争う
to contest a point―dispute a point
(敵は)通ろうと争う、(味方は)通すまいと争う
to contest the passage―dispute the passage
(敵は)一歩でも進もうと争う
They fight every inch of the ground.
(味方は)一歩でも退くまいと争う
We contest every inch of the ground―dispute every inch of the ground.
席を争う
to scramble for places
首席を争う
to contend for the top-seat
先を争う
to contend for the first place―strive to be the first―It is who shall be the first to do it
火元を争う
to quarrel about the origin of fire―throw the responsibility for the fire on each other―lay the blame on each other
値段を争う
to haggle about the price―higgle over the price
年は争われぬ
There is no contending against age―Age will tell.
事実は争われぬ
We can not deny the fact―It is impossible to deny the fact―There is no denying the fact―There is no gainsaying the fact.
事実を争うべからず
The fact is not to be denied―undeniable―indisputable―incontestable.
争うべからざる事実
an undeniable fact―an incontestable fact―an indisputable fact
争うべからざる道理
an incontrovertible truth
争うべからざる証拠
a positive proof

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 人情は争われぬ
Nature will assert herself.
一刻を争う
Time is precious―There is no time to lose.
消防隊の出動は分秒を争う
When a fire-brigade goes into action, every moment is precious―there is not a moment to be lost.

content:
あらそうべからざる〔争うべからざる〕
〈形〉Undeniable, indisputable, incontestable (fact); incontrovertible (truth); positive (proof)

content.content: 試験が勉強の刺激となることは争うべからざる事実である
It is an indisputable fact that examinations give an impetus to study.

content:
あらそって〔争って〕
〈副〉(動詞に訳して)to vie with one another, strive with one another (in doing something)

content.content: 人々が争って彼に敬意を表した
People vied with one another in doing him honour.
学生が争ってその学校へ入学した
Students strove with one another in entering the school―It was who should enter the school.
そんな本が出たら争って買うだろう
If such a book comes out, people will strive with one another in buying it―It will be who shall be the first to buy it.
門が開くと先を争って入る
When the door opens, they strive to be the first to enter―It is who shall be the first to enter.

content:
あらた〔新た〕
〈形〉New; fresh:(=に) newly; anew; afresh

content.content: また新たに始める
to begin anew―start afresh
これが新たに建った家です
This is the newly-built house―the new house.
これは新たに出来た学校です
This is a newly-opened school―a new school.
あれが新たに任命になった先生だ
That is the newly-appointed teacher―the new teacher.
新たに事業を起こすには時機が悪い
The times are unfavourable for a new enterprise.
年が改まると人心が新たになる
When the year changes, the people's minds undergo a change.

content:
あらたか〔顕然〕
〈形〉Wonderful; marvellous; miraculous

content.content: この神様は霊験あらたかな神様だ
The deity possesses miraculous powers.

あらだつ〔荒立つ〕
〈自動〉To be irritated; to be incensed; to be exasperated

あらだてる〔荒立てる〕
〈他動〉To irritate, incense, exasperate (a person)

あらたま〔璞〕
〈名〉
1. A precious stone in the rough; a rough stone; an uncut gem
2. (=新年)the New Year

content:
あらたまる〔改まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=新たになる)to become new; to become different; to change; to be changed; to be altered; to be renewed; to be revised

content.content: 年が改まる
The year changes―the year begins.
年が改まると人心も自ら改まる
When the year changes, the people's minds naturally undergo a change.
契約が改まる
The contract is renewed.
規制が改まる
The rule is altered―The regulations are revised.
御一新で万事改まった
The Restoration changed everything.
一歩都門を出れば風物自ら改まる
Once outside the city, nature wears a different aspect.

content: 2. (=直る)to be corrected; to be rectified

content.content: 誤りが改まった
The mistakes are corrected―The errors are rectified.

content: 3. (=真面目になる)to become earnest

content.content: 改まってことをする
to go about anything in earnest
君はあまり改まるからかえってよく書けないのだ
You are too much in earnest to write well.

content: 4. (=儀式張る)to stand on ceremony; to become ceremonious; to become formal

content.content: そう改まっては困る
You stand too much on ceremony with me.
いやに改まっているじゃないか
How ceremonious you are!
そう改まるなよ
Don't stand on ceremony with me!―Don't be so formal!
そんな改まったところは真平だ
I can't stand such a formal company.
改まった口上
a formal speech―a set speech
病いが改まる
One's illness takes a turn for the worse―takes an unfavourable turn.

content:
あらため〔改め〕
〈名〉Examination; inspection

content.content: 金をさし上げますからお改めを願います
Please count the money.

content:
あらためて〔改めて〕
〈副〉
1. (=新たに)anew; afresh; again

content.content: いずれ改めてお礼に出ます
I shall call again to return my thanks.
いずれ改めてご相談しましょう
We will talk the matter over at our leisure.
改めて言う
to repeat anything
皆ご承知の事だから改めて言うには及ばぬ
The fact is too well known to justify repetition.

content: 2. (=正式に)formally

content.content: 改めて初対面のあいさつをする
to introduce oneself formally (to a person)
改めてお頼み申す
I formally call upon you to do it.
別に改めて申上げるほどの事もありませんが
I have nothing particular to say.
それでは改めて伺いますがなにゆえあって偽名をしておらるるか
Then I put it to you―What is your reason for assuming a false name?

content:
あらためる〔改める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=新たにする)to renew (a contract); to revise (the regulations); to change (one's name); to alter (one's appearance, etc.)

content.content: 校名を正則大学と改める
The name of the school will be changed to the S. E. G. College―The school will be renamed the S. E. G. College.
契約を改める
to renew the contract
規則を改める
to alter the rule―revise the regulations
版を改める
to publish a new edition (of a book)
面目を改める
to undergo a transformation―find it brick and leave it marble
鉄道が通じてから市は面目を改めた
Since the railway communication was opened, the city has undergone a complete transformation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The railway has transformed the city.
学校は面目を改めた
It is quite a new school.
彼が校長になって学校は面目を改めた
He found the school brick and left it marble.

content: 2. (=直す、正す)to correct (a mistake); to rectify (an error); to mend (one's ways); to amend (one's conduct); to reform (one's life); to turn over a new leaf

content.content: 身の行いを改める
to mend one's ways―amend (one's conduct)―reform (one's life)―do better―lead a new life―turn over a new leaf
これから改めます
I will amend―reform―do better―turn over a new leaf―in future.
前非を悟ったから改めます
I will amend my past error.
過ちを改める
to amend one's fault
誤って改むるに憚る勿れ
Be not afraid to amend your fault―(に相当するは)―“It is never too late to mend.”
容{かたち}を改める、威容を改める
to draw oneself up―sit up straight―assume a dignified attitude
威容を改めて控えていた
He was seated in a dignified attitude.
行儀を改める
to correct one's manners
言葉を改める
to become formal in speech
言葉を改めて説き出した
He began to explain in a formal speech.
言葉を改めて頼んだ
I formally called upon him to do it.
悪弊を改める
to put down abuses―suppress evils
弊風を改める
to suppress evil practices―reform evil practices

content: 3. (=改め見る、検査する)to look over, examine, inspect (anything)

content.content: 品物を一々手に取って改めたわけではない
I did not look over the goods one by one.
切符を改める
to examine the tickets
財布を改めて見ると空
I examined the purse, and found it empty.
金を改める
to count the money
金を改めて受取れ
Count the money when you receive it.

あらづくろい〔粗繕い〕
〈名〉Rough repair:(=する) to repair roughly

content:
あらっぽい〔荒っぽい〕
〈形〉Rough (handling); rough-mannered (man); rude (behaviour); rugged (ways, etc.)

content.content: そんな荒っぽい扱いようをしてはこわれてしまう
It won't stand such rough handling.

あらづもり〔粗積り〕
〈名〉A rough estimate:(=する) to estimate roughly

content:
あらて〔新手〕
〈名〉
1. A fresh hand; a reserve hand

content.content: ここに新手が控えている
Here are fresh hands―reserve hands―awaiting their turn.

content: 2. (=軍隊の新手)a fresh force; fresh troops

content.content: 新手を繰出す
to send out fresh troops

あらと〔粗砥〕
〈名〉A coarse whetstone; a grindstone

content:
あらなみ〔荒浪〕
〈名〉Rough waves; a troubled sea; the raging waters; the seething waters

content.content: 荒浪にもまれる
to be buffeted by the waves
世の荒浪にもまれる
to be buffeted by the world
世の荒浪に耐える
to stand the wear and tear of life

あらなわ〔荒縄〕
〈名〉A rope made of rice-straw; a straw-rope

あらに〔あら煮〕
〈名〉(A dish of) boiled bones of fish

content:
あらば〔有らば〕
〈接続動詞〉If there be

content.content: そんな品があらばいくら出しても買う
If there is such an article, I will buy it at any price.
成功するものが一人あらば失敗する者は千人ある
For one man who succeeds, there are a thousand who fail.

content:
あらばこそ〔有らばこそ〕
〈熟語〉(There is) not a, never a, devil a (person or thing)

content.content: 門を打てども叩けども応ずる者のあらばこそ
I might knock and knock at the door, but never a man―devil a soul―answered my knock.

content:
あらびあ〔亜拉比亜<アラビア>〕
〈固名〉Arabia:(=の) Arabian; Arabic

content.content: アラビア人
an Arabian―an Arab
アラビア語
Arabic
アラビア数字
the Arabic numerals
アラビア馬
an Arabian horse―an Arab
アラビアゴム
gum arabic
アラビア物語
the Arabian Nights' Entertainments

content:
あらびあ〔亜拉比亜<アラビア>〕
〈固名〉Arabia:(=の) Arabian; Arabic

content.content: アラビア人
an Arabian―an Arab
アラビア語
Arabic
アラビア数字
the Arabic numerals
アラビア馬
an Arabian horse―an Arab
アラビアゴム
gum arabic
アラビア物語
the Arabian Nights' Entertainments

content:
あらびる〔荒びる〕
〈自動〉To become rough; to roughen

content.content: 肌が荒びる
The skin becomes rough―becomes callous.
馬が荒びる
A horse turns restive.

あらまき〔荒捲き〕
〈名〉Salted salmon of superior quality

content:
あらまし〔荒増し〕
〈名〉(=概略)an outline; the substance; the sum and substance (of the case); the gist, the pith (of the matter)

content.content: 事のあらましを述べよう
I will give you an outline of the matter―the substance of the case.
事のあらましはこんなものだ
This is the sum and substance of the case―the gist of the matter―the pith of the matter.
これはほんのあらましだ
It is a rough outline―a mere outline―a bare outline.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=ざっと)roughly; mostly; almost; all but (finished, etc.)

content.content: 仕事はあらまし片づいた
The work is almost finished―all but completed.
品物はあらまし片づいた
The goods are mostly sold―mostly disposed of.
今日の仕事はあらまし片づいた
I have broken the back of my day's work.
あらましこんなわけさ
Roughly speaking, that is the state of the case.

content: 2. (=概して)for the most part; on the whole; in the main; in substance; in sum and substance

content.content: 僕はあらまし君と同意だ
I agree with you in substance―in the main.
話があらまし一致している
The accounts agree in the main―in substance.
あらましお話の通りです
You are, on the whole, right―You are, in the main, right―You are right in sum and substance.
相談の結果はあらまし左の如くに御座候
The result of the conference is, in substance, as follows:―

content:
あらまほし
〈祈願法助動詞〉May...!

content.content: 人は皆斯くあらまほし
Such may all men be!―I wish all man may be such.

content:
あらみ〔新身〕
〈名〉A virgin blade (that never tasted blood)

content.content: 新身を試す
to try a virgin blade on some one

content:
あらむしゃ〔荒武者〕
〈名〉A fierce warrior:(より) a violent man; a savage

content.content: 荒武者で手がつけられない
I can do nothing with such a savage.

あらめ〔荒布〕
〈名〉A dried seaweed (ecklonia bicyclis used for food)

content:
あらもの〔荒物〕
〈名〉Chandlery

content.content: 荒物屋
a chandler
それは荒物屋にある
It is to be had at the chandler's.

あらやく〔荒役〕
〈名〉The ruffian (of a play)

content:
あらゆる
〈形〉All (possible, imaginable, conceivable, that one can think of); every (in one's power, that one can)

content.content: あらゆる事を仕尽した
I have done everything that I can―everything in my power―(最も強く言えば)―left nothing undone.
あらゆる手段を尽した
I have tried every means in my power―left no means untried―“left no stones unturned.”
あらゆる方法を試みた
I have tried all the methods I can think of―tried all conceivable methods―left no method untried.
あらゆる機会を利用した
I availed myself of every opportunity that occurred―missed no opportunity.
この問題についてはあらゆることを言い尽した
I have said everything that can be said―left nothing unsaid―on the subject.
彼らはあらゆる悪口を言い尽した
They have left no calumny unspoken.
彼はあらゆる悪い事を仕尽した

He has done every evil deed in his power―left no evil deed undone―completed the list of crimes―filled up the measure of crimes―run through the catalogue of crimes―ranged over the whole gamut of crime.
あらゆるばかをしつくした

He has committed all possible follies―left no folly uncommitted―completed the catalogue of follies―filled up the sum of follies―run through the catalogue of follies―ranged over the whole gamut of folly.
あらゆる種類の人
all sorts of men―all manner of men

content:
あららげる〔荒らげる〕
〈他動〉To roughen

content.content: 声を荒らげる
to raise one's voice in anger
声を荒らげて言った
He said so in an angry voice―in a vehement tone.
言葉を荒らげて言った
He said so with vehemence.

content:
あらりょうじ〔荒療治〕
〈名〉
1. A rough treatment; a desperate remedy:(非常手段の意味なら) a drastic measure

content.content: 荒療治をする
to resort to desperate remedies―take drastic measures
この悪弊は根深いから荒療治をしなければならぬ
These deep-rooted abuses require drastic measures.

content: 2. (=人殺し)murder

content.content: 荒療治をして邪魔になる者を片づけた
Those who stood in the way were made away with―put out of the way.

content:
あられ〔霰〕
〈名〉Hail; hailstone

content.content: 霰が降る
It hails.
霰が降っている
There is a hail-storm.
雷が鳴って霰が降った
The thunder was accompanied with a hail-storm.
弾は霰と降る
It hailed bullets.
兵は弾の霰と降る下に冷静沈着に働いた
The men were cool and steady under a hail of bullets.

content:
あられもない〔有られもない〕
〈形〉
1. (=ありそうも無い)impossible, improbable (occurrence)
2. (=あるべからざる)improper (for some one); unbecoming (in some one)

content.content: 姫御前にあられもない行い
Such conduct is unbecoming in a lady.

content:
あらわす〔表す、現す、顕す、露す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=有るものを現す)to show (signs of fear); to display, exhibit (one's ability); to evince, manifest (one's feelings, etc.)

content.content: 姿を現す
to show oneself―appear
霊が仮に姿を顕す
A spirit appears in a vision.
手並を現す
to show one's skill―display one's skill―exhibit one's skill
君はこれまでに無い手並を現した
You have outdone yourself―eclipsed yourself.
腕前を現す
to show one's abilities―display one's talents―exhibit one's talents
力を現す、能を現す
to show one's powers―display one's powers―exhibit one's powers
彼は内気で能を現すことができぬ
He is so timid that he can not show his powers―He stands in his own light through timidity.
天才を現す、鋒鋩を現す
to show one's genius―One's genius asserts itself
名を現す
to make a name for oneself―make a noise in the world―win fame―win renown
手柄を現す
to distinguish oneself―win distinction―reap laurels―win laurels―win one's spurs
社会に頭角を現す
to make a figure―cut a figure―in society
巍然として頭角を現す
to cut a conspicuous figure―cut a prominent figure
悦び悲しみなどを色に現す
to show signs of―evince signs of―manifest signs of―joy or sorrow
旗色を現す(向背を発表する)
to show one's attitude
自由党はいよいよ旗色を現した
The Liberals have shown their attitude―declared themselves.
政府党たる旗色を現した、政府反対の旗色を現した
They have declared for the government―declared against the government.

content: 2. (=隠すべきものを顕す、露す)to show, expose, betray, disclose, reveal (something hidden)

content.content: 醜体を露す
to expose one's nakedness
肌を露す
to expose one's skin―expose one's person
西洋婦人は肌を露すことを何とも思わない
Foreign ladies make nothing of exposing theier skins.
子どもが面を取って顕れた顔は真黒な顔
The child took off the mask, and disclosed a jet-black face.
喜怒哀楽を色に顕す
to betray one's emotions
喜怒哀楽を色に顕さず
He betrays no emotions―He has a perfect self-command―He is stoical.
化物が正体を顕す
An apparition shows itself in its natural shape―unmasks itself.
化け物の正体を顕す
to expose an apparition―unmask a ghost
正体を顕す、本性を顕す、地金を顕す
to show oneself in one's true colours―show one's true colours―throw off the mask
悪魔の本性を顕す
to show one's horns―shoot one's horns
酔って本性を顕す
“Wine reveals the true man”―“The heart is seen in wine”―“There is truth in wine.”
馬脚を顕す
to show the cloven hoof―betray the cloven foot
木葉涸落して山骨を露す
The trees are bare of leaves, and the hills are left in their naked glory.
思想を言葉に現す
to express one's thoughts in words―clothe one's ideas in words
思想は言葉をもって表す
Thoughts are expressed by means of words.
思う事があっても言葉に表せない
I feel something, but I can not put it in words.
姿を絵に表す
to represent a figure in a picture
(この絵は何の絵ですかと言うのを英語では)この絵は何を表すか
What does this picture represent?
本を著す、書を著す
to publish a book―write a book

content:
あらわす〔表す、現す、顕す、露す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=有るものを現す)to show (signs of fear); to display, exhibit (one's ability); to evince, manifest (one's feelings, etc.)

content.content: 姿を現す
to show oneself―appear
霊が仮に姿を顕す
A spirit appears in a vision.
手並を現す
to show one's skill―display one's skill―exhibit one's skill
君はこれまでに無い手並を現した
You have outdone yourself―eclipsed yourself.
腕前を現す
to show one's abilities―display one's talents―exhibit one's talents
力を現す、能を現す
to show one's powers―display one's powers―exhibit one's powers
彼は内気で能を現すことができぬ
He is so timid that he can not show his powers―He stands in his own light through timidity.
天才を現す、鋒鋩を現す
to show one's genius―One's genius asserts itself
名を現す
to make a name for oneself―make a noise in the world―win fame―win renown
手柄を現す
to distinguish oneself―win distinction―reap laurels―win laurels―win one's spurs
社会に頭角を現す
to make a figure―cut a figure―in society
巍然として頭角を現す
to cut a conspicuous figure―cut a prominent figure
悦び悲しみなどを色に現す
to show signs of―evince signs of―manifest signs of―joy or sorrow
旗色を現す(向背を発表する)
to show one's attitude
自由党はいよいよ旗色を現した
The Liberals have shown their attitude―declared themselves.
政府党たる旗色を現した、政府反対の旗色を現した
They have declared for the government―declared against the government.

content: 2. (=隠すべきものを顕す、露す)to show, expose, betray, disclose, reveal (something hidden)

content.content: 醜体を露す
to expose one's nakedness
肌を露す
to expose one's skin―expose one's person
西洋婦人は肌を露すことを何とも思わない
Foreign ladies make nothing of exposing theier skins.
子どもが面を取って顕れた顔は真黒な顔
The child took off the mask, and disclosed a jet-black face.
喜怒哀楽を色に顕す
to betray one's emotions
喜怒哀楽を色に顕さず
He betrays no emotions―He has a perfect self-command―He is stoical.
化物が正体を顕す
An apparition shows itself in its natural shape―unmasks itself.
化け物の正体を顕す
to expose an apparition―unmask a ghost
正体を顕す、本性を顕す、地金を顕す
to show oneself in one's true colours―show one's true colours―throw off the mask
悪魔の本性を顕す
to show one's horns―shoot one's horns
酔って本性を顕す
“Wine reveals the true man”―“The heart is seen in wine”―“There is truth in wine.”
馬脚を顕す
to show the cloven hoof―betray the cloven foot
木葉涸落して山骨を露す
The trees are bare of leaves, and the hills are left in their naked glory.
思想を言葉に現す
to express one's thoughts in words―clothe one's ideas in words
思想は言葉をもって表す
Thoughts are expressed by means of words.
思う事があっても言葉に表せない
I feel something, but I can not put it in words.
姿を絵に表す
to represent a figure in a picture
(この絵は何の絵ですかと言うのを英語では)この絵は何を表すか
What does this picture represent?
本を著す、書を著す
to publish a book―write a book

本を著す、書を著す
to publish a book―write a book

content:
あらわに〔陽に〕
〈副〉Openly; plainly; broadly; publicly; in public

content.content: あらわに言う
to speak openly
こういうことがあらわに言ってある
It is plainly stated―broadly hinted―that...
これはあらわにすべきことではない
It ought not to be done in public―made public.
あらわに言えば詐欺だ
To be plain with you, it is fraud.

content:
あらわれる〔現れる、顕れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=見える)to appear, make its appearance; to come out, come in sight, come into view:(にわかに現れる)to come upon the scene, burst upon the view, break upon the scene

content.content: (航海中)船が現れる
A sail comes in sight―heaves in sight.
ある日のことあやしい船が沖に現れた
One day, a suspicious-looking craft appeared in the offing―hove in sight.
(航海中)陸が現れる
Land is sighted.
岬をまわるとにわかに壮観が現れる
When the cape is doubled, a fine sight bursts upon the view.
現れ出たる武智明秀
There breaks upon the scene the valorous from of Takechi Mistuhide!
日が雲間から現れる
The sun breaks through the clouds.
月が雲の蔭から現れ出る
The moon comes out from behind the clouds.
暗闇からぬーと現れたのが一人の大男
There loomed out of the darkness a gigantic form.
魂が目に顕れている
His soul looks out of his eyes.
心が目に顕れている
His heart looks through his eyes.
正直な事が顔に顕れている
His honesty is written on his face.
喜怒哀楽が色に顕れない
He betrays no emotions―He has a perfect self-command―He is stoical.

content: 2. (=姿を表す)to show itself; to manifest itself; to reveal itself; to betray itself; to assert itself

content.content: 水気が冷えると雲になって現れる
When vapour cools, the cloud shows itself.
神意は天地となって現れた
The Divine mind manifested itself in the visible universe.
万有は神意の現れたものである
The universe is a manifestation of the Divine mind.
望遠鏡や顕微鏡をもって見ると天地間の不思議なことが現れる
The wonders of the universe reveal themselves to those who use the telescope and the microscope―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The telescope and the microscope reveal the wonders of the universe.
心に思う事は顔に現れる(穂に出る)
Thoughts betray themselves in the face.
赤面したので罪が現れた
He blushed, and his guilt betrayed itself―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A blush betrayed his guilt.
彼の天才は幼い時から現れた
His genius asserted itself at an early age.

content: 3. (=露顕する)to come to light, be brought to light; to be discovered, be found out, be disclosed, be revealed, be detected; to transpire

content.content: 悪事はきっと顕れる
An evil deed will be discovered―be found out―A dark deed will come to light―be brought to light―Murder will out.
悪事が顕れた
A crime has come to light―The murder is out.
裁判で悪事が顕れた
A crime has come to light at the trial―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The trial brought the crime to light.
隠し事は顕れる
A secret will transpire―come to light―be brought to light―be discovered―be disclosed―be revealed.
隠し事は顕れやすい
A secret will out.
隠し事が顕れた
The secret has transpired―The secret is out.
隠すより顕るるは無し
No secret but will come to light.
陰謀が顕れた
The plot is discovered.
彼は詐欺師だということが顕れた
He was found out to be a swindler.
罪跡が顕れた
The evidence of crime has come to light.
予審で罪跡が顕れた
The proof of guilt came to light at the preliminary examination―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The preliminary examination brought the proof of guilt to light.
嘘はきっと顕れる
A falsehood is sure to be found out―“Liars should have good memories.”
嘘が顕れた
The falsehood is found out―He was caught lying―caught in a lie―detected in a lie.
化の皮が顕れた
He has shown his true colours―betrayed the cloven hoof.

content: 4. (=世に出る)to become known ［famous, renowned, celebrated］; to come to the front

content.content: 彼の名が近頃世に現れた
He has lately come to the front.
彼は世に現れない人だ
He is an obscure individual―a man unknown to fame―a man of modest worth.
世に現れない人は往々認められずにしまう
Modest worth often goes unrewarded.
