content:
あらんかぎり〔有らん限り〕
〈形〉All

content.content: あらん限りの力を出す
(体力なら)to put forth all one's strength―(精力なら)―put forth all one's energies
あらん限りの力を出して働く
to work with all one's might―with might and main
あらん限りの力を出して走る
to run at the top of one's speed
あらん限りの声を張り上げた
I shouted at the top of my voice―bawled at the top of my lungs.
あらん限りの知恵をしぼる
to cudgel one's brains to the utmost

content:
あり〔蟻〕
〈名〉The ant

content.content: 千丈の堤も蟻の穴より崩れる
An ant-hole will destroy a dike―(に相当するは)―“A little leak will sink a great ship.”
蟻の這い出る隙も無いように囲まれた
The castle was closely besieged―tightly invested.
蟻の塔、蟻塚
an ant-hill
蟻地獄
the ant-lion
蟻のとわたり(会陰)
the perineum

content:
あり〔在り〕
〈自動〉
1. (=何は何にあり)to lie (in something); to consist(in doing something)

content.content: 道徳は人たるの本分を尽すにあり
Morality consists in doing man's duty.
幸福は満足にあり
Happiness consists in contentment.
救済法は教育にあり
The remedy lies in education.
(教育事業などの)困難は人選にあり
The difficulty lies in the choice of men.

content: 2. (=何は誰にあり)to lie (with one); to rest (with one)

content.content: 罪は船長にあり
The faults lies with the captain―(It is the captain's fault―The captain is to blame for it)
その罪自家にあり
The fault lies with yourself―lies at your own door.
言責弁士にあり
The responsibility for the statement lies with the speaker―The speaker is responsible for the statement.
文責記者にあり
The responsibility for the wording of the article lies with the editor―The editor is responsible for the wording of the article.
これを決定するは君の権内にあり
It rests with you to decide―The decision rests with you.

content:
ありあい〔有り合い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ありあわせ〔有り合わせ〕

content:
ありあう〔有り合う〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ありあわせ〔有り合わせ〕

content:
ありあけ〔有明け〕
〈名〉
1. The breaking of day before the moon is down

content.content: 有明けの月
the moon overtaken by daylight―the morning moon―the waning moon.
有明けのつれなく
The waning moon so cold did shine
見えし別れより
When we at morn did part,
暁ばかり
The hour of dawn is since become
憂きものはなし
A sadness to my heart.
時鳥鳴きつる
The cuckoo sing his thrilling tune,
方を見渡せば
And my eye sweeps the scene,
只有明けの
Only to see the waning moon
月ぞ残れる
Hang lonesome and serene.
ありあけあんどん〔有明行灯〕

ありあけあんどん〔有明行灯〕
〈名〉A (paper) night-lamp

content:
ありあまる〔有余る〕
〈自動〉
1. (人を主格にすれば)to have too much:(数なら) to have too many:(数量とも) to have more than enough

content.content: 彼は金がありあまっている
He has more than enough money―enough money and to spare.
彼は金がありあまっていながらまだ満足しない
With enough money and to spare, he is not contented.
金というものは有る者はありあまり無い者は無さ過ぎる
Of money one will have either too much or too little.

content: 2. (物を主格にすれば)to be more than enough; to be in excess; to be superabundant; to superabound

content.content: 米国には金がありあまっている
In America, there is more than enough money―more money than is needed―enough money and to spare.
彼は金がありあまっている
He rolls in riches.

content:
ありありと
〈副〉Distinctly; vividly

content.content: ありありと見える
It is distinctly visible.
その場がありありと見えるように記憶している
I have a vivid recollection of the scene.
ありありと想像する
to have a vivid imagination―have one's imagination full of body and colour

content:
ありあわせ〔有り合わせ〕
〈名〉What one has in hand; what one as on hand; what one has in stock:(=の) ready; in hand; on hand:(=る) to be in hand; to be on hand; to be in stock; to occur; to come in one's way

content.content: 有り合わせの金
money in hand―money on hand
有り合わせの品
goods in hand―goods on hand―goods in stock
有り合わせはこれだけです
(金なら)This is all I have on hand―(品物なら)―These are all I have on hand―These are all I have in stock.
有り合わせのご馳走
pot-luck
ご馳走はほんの有り合わせです
You must take pot-luck with us.
有り合わせのご馳走で一つやろう
Let us take pot-luck.
何でも有り合わせた仕事をする事にしよう
I will undertake any work that comes in my way.

content:
ありうち〔有り中〕
〈叙述形容詞〉→『

content.content: ありがち〔有勝〕

content:
ありうべからざる〔有り得可からざる〕
〈形〉Impossible

content.content: それはあり得べからざることだ
It is beyond the bounds of possibility.

content:
ありうべき〔有り得可べき〕
〈形〉Possible

content.content: それはあり得べき事だ
It is quite within the bounds of possibility.

content:
ありか〔在りか〕
〈名〉(The place) where anything is (kept); one's whereabouts, hiding-place, retreat

content.content: お前は金の在りかを知っているだろう
You must know where the money is―where the money is kept―where the money is concealed.
その人の在りかがわからぬ
His whereabouts is unknown.
在りかをくらましている
He has covered his traces.
在りかを探している
I am trying to find his hiding-place.
ようやく彼の在りかを尋ねあてた
I have found out his hiding-place―hit upon his retreat.
彼は仇敵の在りかを探っている
He is searching for his enemy.

content:
ありがたい〔有難い〕
〈形〉［注意］この形容詞には主観、客観の両意あり。
1. ［主観的］(I am) thankful, grateful, obliged, indebted, filled with gratitude (to some one for something)

content.content: 親はありがたい
I am thankful to my parents―grateful to my parents.
親ほどありがたいものは無い
There is no one to whom we ought to be more grateful than our parents.
君のご厚恩はありがたい
I am thankful for―I feel grateful for―I am filled with gratitude for―my lord's favours.
君の同情はありがたい
I am thankful (to you) for your sympathy―grateful (to you) for your sympathy.
今度成功したらありがたい
I shall be thankful to succeed this time.
成功という事はありがたい事だ
Success is a thing to be thankful for―a thing to be grateful for.
煩いを免れてありがたい(嬉しい)
I am thankful to be relieved of the trouble―glad to be rid of the trouble.
この煩いを免れたらありがたいがなー
I should be glad to be rid of the trouble.
お返事下さらばありがたい
I shall be obliged to you for an answer―(他動詞構文にすれば)―An answer will oblige me.
ご助力はありがたい
I am indebted to you for your assistance.
ありがたいことには皆無事でおります
I am thankful to say,―Thanks to Heaven,―Thank God,―we are all well.
ありがたい心(ありがたがる心)
a thankful heart―a grateful heart

content: 2. ［客観的］(It is) welcome, grateful, acceptable (to me); (he is) deserving of gratitude

content.content: 君の同情はありがたい
Your sympathy is welcome to me―grateful to me.
長降りの後の照りはありがたい
Sunshine is welcome (to us)―grateful (to us)―after a long rain.
ありがたい照り
welcome sunshine―grateful sunshine
旱魃後の雨はありがたい
Rain is welcome―grateful―after a drought.
ありがたい雨
welcome rain―grateful rain
寒い時は火がありがたい
Fire is welcome in cold weather.
この金はちょうどよい時手に入ってありがたい
This money does not come amiss.
師はありがたい
Our teacher is deserving of our gratitude―Our teacher deserves our gratitude.
親ほどありがたいものは無い
No one is more deserving of our gratitude than our parents.
ありがたい賜物
a welcome gift―an acceptable present―a grateful boon
戦争は貧民にとってありがたい賜物であった
The war was a boon to the poor.
そんな発明ができたら実にありがたい賜物だ
Such an invention would be a boon to mankind.
ありがたくない物
an unwelcome thing―anything as welcome as snow in harvest

content:
3. 
〈その他〉(時として客観的の「ありがたい」の意味になる形容詞は)blessed, benign, benignant, propitious, gracious(等)

content.content: ありがたい教え
the blessed gospel
ありがたいお説教
an edifying sermon
あたがたい安息日
the blessed day of rest
ありがたい日光
the blessed light of heaven
盲人はありがたい日光が拝まれぬ
The blind are debarred from enjoying the blessed light of heaven.
明治天皇のありがたい御世
the benign rule―the propitious reign―of Meiji Tenno
ありがたい天子様
our benignant Emperor
ありがたきお言葉
your gracious words
有難き御諚を蒙るは拙者の面目
Your servant is honoured by your Majesty's gracious commands.
戦勝の将軍には種々ありがたきご沙汰があった
Honours were showered upon the victorious general.

content:
ありがたがる〔有難がる〕
〈自他動〉To feel thankful (for something); to feel grateful (for something); to show one's gratitude

content.content: 助かった者はありがたがっている
The survivors are thankful for their deliverence.
僅かばかりの親切をありがたがる人がある
Some people feel grateful for a little kindness―A little kindness goes a long way with some people.
彼らはその人を非常にありがたがっている
They worship his shadow as he passes―worship the ground he treads on.

content:
ありがたく〔有難く〕
〈副〉Thankfully; with thanks; gratefully; with gratitude

content.content: 下さるものならありがたく頂戴つかまつる
I shall receive it with thanks―accept it with gratitude.
御厚恩のほど有難く御礼申上げ候
I beg to tender my best thanks for your favours.
ありがたく思う
to feel thankful―feel grateful―for anything
こんなに成功してありがたく思っております
I am thankful for my success.
それをありがたく思うのは当然だ
You ought to be grateful for it.

content:
ありがたさ〔有難さ〕
〈名〉
1. ［主観的］Gratitude

content.content: このありがたさは言語に尽せませぬ
My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.

content: 2. ［客観的］Title to gratitude; goodness

content.content: 親のありがたさ
our parent's goodness to us―parental love
子を持ってみなけりゃ親のありがたさがわからぬ
We do not know parental love till we come to have children of our own.

content:
ありがたなみだ〔有難涙〕
〈名〉Tears of gratitude

content.content: ありがた涙を流す
to shed tears of gratitude―cry tears of gratitude

content:
ありがたみ〔有難味〕
〈名〉
1. (=物の真価)(the true) value (of any good)

content.content: ありがた味を知る
to know the true value of―appreciate―anything
ご教授のありがた味がわかってきました
I begin to appreciate your teachings.
君達のような貴公子は金のありがた味を知るまい
You, young sybarites, can not know the value of money―the virtue of money.
健康はこれを失って始めてそのありがた味がわかる
One does not know the value of health―know the blessing of health―till one has lost it.

content: 2. (=貴さ)dignity, grandeur, nobility (of a title, etc.)

content.content: 「廟堂」というと「内閣」というよりもありがた味がある
“The Imperial Council” sounds more dignified―more grand―than “the Cabinet.”
博士の学位も当節はありがた味が無くなった
The title of doctor is quite cheap nowadays.
ありがた味をつける
to dignify anything
学校を何々大学と言うとありがた味がつく
A school is dignified by the name of So-and-so College.

content: 3. (=尊さ)holiness, sanctity (of religion or priesthood)

content.content: ありがた味のある僧は少ない
There are few “holy men” in the priesthood.
多くはありがた味の無い生ま臭坊主だ
Most of them are unholy priests―unhallowed priests.

content:
ありがためいわく〔有難迷惑〕
〈名〉A mistaken kindness; an unwelcome favour

content.content: 田舎へ行くと酒やご馳走を強いられるのはありがた迷惑だ
It is a mistaken kindness on the part of country folk to press wine and good cheer on their guests.
忙しい時はせっかくのご招待もありがた迷惑だ
An invitation is an unwelcome favour to a busy man.
(雪は豊年の兆とはいいながら)こう降られてはありがた迷惑だ
But if it snows like this, it is too much of a good thing.
(欲しくもない物を下さるとは)そりゃありがた迷惑だ
Thank you for nothing!
こんな物を貰ってはありがた迷惑だ
It is “a white elephant.”

ありがたや〔有難や〕
〈感動詞〉Thank God!; God be thanked!; Thanks to Heaven!; Heaven be praised!

ありがたれん〔有難連〕
〈名〉Religious people; pious folks:(殊に)devout Buddhists; bigoted Buddhists

content:
ありがち〔有勝〕
〈叙述形容詞〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. Frequent; common:(副詞に訳せば) often

content.content: こんな事はありがちだ
Such things are of frequent occurrence―of common occurrence.
今時火事はありがちだ
Fires are frequent―of frequent occurrence―at this time of the year.
情死は娼妓間にありがちだ
Double suicides are of common occurrence among the professional prostitutes.
戦時にはありがちのことだが、その女は夫が戦死したものと諦めて再縁した
As often happens in time of war, the woman gave up her husband for lost and married again.
女にはありがちのことだが、彼女は好奇心が強い
As is often the case with woman, she is curious.
身体の弱い少年にはありがちのことだが、彼は学問にこりたがる
As is often the case with boys of weak constitution, he will fling himself into books.
詩人にはありがちのことだが、彼は飄然来たって飄然去る
As is often the case with poets, he is here today and away tomorrow.
学生にはありがちのことだが、彼は有れば有るだけ使ってしまう
As is often the case with students, he will spend all the money he has.

content: 2. Apt (to do something); liable (to some error):(助動詞を代用すれば) will

content.content: こんなことはありがちだ
Such things are apt to happen―will happen.
けがはありがちだ
Accidents will happen.
その思い違いはありがちだ
People are apt to think so―People will think so.
(男女間の間違いは)若い者にはありがちだ、若い時はありがちだ
Young people are apt to fall into error―Young people are liable to error―Young people will be indiscreet―Young people will be young people.
いたずらは少年にありがちだ
Boys will be boys.
好奇心は女にありがちだ
Women will be curious.
世間の噂はありがちのことだ
People will talk.
放蕩は若い者にはありがちだ
Young man are apt to run wild―Young men will run wild.
向う見ずは血気の若者にはありがちだ
Hot-blooded youths are apt to be rash―Youth will be rash.
血気の若者にはありがちのことだが、彼は非常に向う見ずだ
He is extremely rash, as hot-blooded youths will be.
学生にはありがちのことだが、彼は有れば有るだけ使ってしまう
He spends all the money he has, as students will.
女にはありがちのことだが、彼女は好奇心が強い
She is curious, as women will be.
身体の弱い少年にはありがちのことだが、彼はたいそう学問にこる
He fling himself into books, as boys of weak constitution will.
詩人にはありがちのことだが、彼は飄然と来たって飄然と去る
He is here today and away tomorrow, as poets will.
女の子にはありがちのことだが、彼女は自分に来た手紙をていねいに保存しておく
She carefully keeps the letters she receives, as girls will.
子どもにはありがちのことだが、我々二人で家の中をよく散らかしたものだ
We two used to put the house in disorder, as children will.
こんな事件にはありがちのことだが、この事件の裏に女がいる
There is a lady in the case, as there will be.

content: 3. Incident, incidental (to something)

content.content: 危険は乗船生活にはありがちのことだ
Dangers are incident to a seafaring life―A seafaring life is liable to danger.
淫売は人間社会にありがちの弊害に過ぎぬ
Prostitution is but one of the evils incidental to human society.
男女の間の間違いは若い時はありがちだ
Indiscretion is incidental to youth―Young people will be indiscreet.
貧乏は学者にありがちのことだ
Poverty is incidental to a scholary life―Scholars are apt to be poor.

content:
ありがとう〔有難う〕
〈謝辞〉Thank you!; Thanks!

content.content: どうもありがとう
Thank you kindly!
大きにありがとう(多謝)
Thank you very much!―Many thanks!―A thousand thanks!
ありがとう存じます
I am obliged to you (for it)―I esteem it a great favour―I appreciate the honour.
ご親切ありがとう
I thank you for your kindness―You are very kind―It is very kind of you.
それはありがとう
It is very kind of you to do so―Thank you for doing so!―God bless you for doing so!
そう言って下さるのはありがとう
It is very kind of you to say so.
ご配慮にあずかってありがとう存じます
I must thank you for―I am obliged to you for―your solicitude in my behalf.
お願いをかなえて下さるか、それはありがとう
If you will grant my request, I shall be greatly obliged to you―esteem is a great favour.
お願いをお聴き下さらばありがとう存じますが
If you would grant my request, I should esteem it a great favour.
お招きにあずかってありがとう存じます
Thank you for your kind invitation!―I esteem it an honour to be invited―I consider it a privilege to be invited―(通例は)―I am delighted to accept your invitation.
今晩はありがとう
Thank you for your engagement for the evening!

ありがね〔有金〕
〈名〉Money in hand; cash on hand; ready money

content:
ありきたり〔在り来り〕
〈名〉Custom; usage; convention:(=の) customary; conventional

content.content: これが村のありきたりだから仕方がない
We can not change the custom of the village.
これがありきたりの方法です
This is the customary method―the conventional method.
ありきたり通り寄り合いをします
We shall hold a meeting according to custom―according to usage.

ありくい〔食蟻獣〕
〈名〉The ant-eater

content:
ありざし〔蟻刺し〕
〈名〉(A) dovetail (joint)

content.content: 接ぎ目を蟻刺しにする
to dovetail a joint
接ぎ目が蟻刺しにしてある
The joints are dovetailed.

content:
ありさま〔有様〕
〈名〉
1. (=状態)(the) state, condition, plight, predicament, situation (a person or thing is in):(世の中の有様は) state of things; state of matters; state of affairs

content.content: その有様はどうだ
What a state you are in!―What a plight you are in!
これは何という有様だ
What is this state of things?―(を通例)―Here is a pretty state of things!
ロシアの有様を見よ
Look at the state of affairs in Russia!
現今の有様では教育などは思いも寄らぬ
In the present state of things―In the existing state of matters,―As matters now stand,―As things are,―education is out of the question.

content: 2. (=光景)a sight; spectacle; a scene

content.content: 被害地は惨憺たる有様だ
The districts affected present a deplorable spectacle.
現場は火事場のような有様だ
It is an exciting scene.

ありじごく〔蟻地獄〕
〈名〉The ant-lion

content:
ありそうな〔有りそうな〕
〈形〉Likely; probable

content.content: それはありそうなことだ
That is probable―very likely―quite likely―likely enough―(は現在の事、未来の事なら)―That is likely to happen.
それはありそうもないことだ
That is improbable―not likely―(未来の事なら)―unlikely to happen.
彼の発狂はありそうなことだ
I should not be surprised if he were to go mad.
君にしてはありそうなことだ
I should not be surprised to hear it of you.

content:
ありだか〔有高〕
〈名〉What is in hand; what is on hand; what is in stock

content.content: 金の有高
the amount in hand―the amount on hand
品物の有高
the goods on hand―the goods in hand―the articles in stock

content:
ありたけ〔有丈〕
〈名〉(数なら)as many as there are; all there are:(量なら) as much as there is; all there is:(数量共)all one has

content.content: 金をありたけ上げます
I give you all the money I have.
銭箱の金をありたけ持って行った
He took all the money there was in the till.
図書館にありたけの本を読んだ
I read all the books there were in the library.
身上ありたけ
one's all
身上ありたけを一事業に投ずるものではない
One should not lay out one's all in a single enterprise―risk one's all on a single venture―put all one's eggs in one basket.
ありたけの知恵をしぼる
to cudgel one's brains to the utmost
彼はばかのありたけを尽した
He has committed all conceivable follies―left no folly uncommitted―completed the list of follies―filled up the sum of follies―run through the catalogue of follies―ranged over the gamut of folly.
悪い事のありたけを尽した
He has committed all possible crimes―left no crime uncommitted―completed the list of crimes―filled up the measure of crimes―run through the catalogue of crimes―ranged over the gamut of crime.

content:
ありだけ〔有丈〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ありたけ〔有丈〕

content:
ありつく〔有付く〕
〈他動〉To get; to find

content.content: ご馳走にありつく
to find good cheer―fare well
こんなご馳走にありつく事は滅多に無い
I seldom find such good cheer―I rarely fare so well.
あの女は良縁にありついた
She has made a good match.
職にありつく
to find employment―obtain employment
(下男などが)奉公口にありついている
He is in service―in collar.

content:
ありったけ〔有りっ丈〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: ありたけ〔有丈〕

content:
ありてい〔有体〕
〈名〉The (plain or whole) truth

content.content: ありていに白状する
to confess the whole truth―confess everything―make a clean breast of it
ありていに白状すれば寛大に処分してやる
Confess everythings, and I will be lenient with you.
ありていに言う
to tell the plain truth―“call a spade a spade”
ありていに言えば詐欺だ
To tell the plain truth,―To be plain with you,―it is fraud.

content:
ありとあらゆる〔有りとあらゆる〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: あらゆる

content:
ありどころ〔在処〕
〈名〉(The place) where anything is (kept)

content.content: お前は金のありどころを知っているだろう
You must know where the money is―where the money is kept―where the money is concealed.

content:
ありに〔在荷〕
〈名〉Stock (in hand)

content.content: 手許在荷
stock on hand―stock in hand
在荷を調べる(棚卸しをする)
to take stock
在荷調べ(棚卸し)
stock taking
在荷を片づける
to clear out the stock
在荷過多
an overstock
市場は在荷過多だ
The market is overstocked―There is a glut in the market.
在荷帳
a stock-book

ありのとう〔蟻の塔〕
〈名〉An ant-hill

ありのとわたり〔蟻のとわたり〕
〈名〉(=会陰)The perineum

content:
ありのまま〔有の儘〕
〈名〉The plain ［simple, whole, exact, downright, naked, undisguised, unvarnished, unadorned, ungarbled］ truth:(=の) plain, simple, downright, straightforward, undisguised unvarnished, unadorned (tale):(=に) plainly; simply; as it is

content.content: ありのままに言う
to speak the plain, unvarnished truth―tell the downright truth―state a fact as it is―“call a spade a spade.”
ありのままに言えば詐欺だ
To tell the plain truth,―To be plain with you,―In plain English―it is fraud.
ありのままの説
a plain statement―a straightforward story―an unvarnished tale
この顔をありのままに描け
Paint me as I am.
事実だけをありのままに述べて後は各自の判断にお任せする
I will state the facts as they are, and leave you to judge for yourselves.

content:
ありふれた〔有り触れた〕
〈形〉Common; of common occurrence

content.content: これはありふれた話だ
It is a common case―the old story―the old, old story.
ごくありふれた事件だ
This is an affair of most common occurrence.

content:
ありもせぬ〔有りもせぬ〕
〈形〉
1. (=無き)non-existent; imaginary; fancied

content.content: ありもせぬ敵と戦う
to fight imaginary foes―fight windmills
ありもせぬ不平を言う
to complain of fancied wrongs

content: 2. (=無けなしの)little; few

content.content: ありもせぬ金を出した
I give the little money that I had―what little money I had―what money I had.

content:
ありゃこりゃ
〈副〉→『

content.content: あべこべ

ありゅうさん〔亜硫酸〕
〈名〉Sulphurous acid

content:
ある
〈不完動詞〉(これは何である)to be (something)

content.content: 我輩は猫である
I am a cat.
君は金持ちである
You are a rich man.
鯨は哺乳動物である
The whale is a mammal.
鯨は魚に非ずして哺乳動物である
The whale is not a fish, but a mammal.

content:
ある〔或〕
〈形〉(A) certain; one ［注意］“Some”, “any”を用いるべからず。

content.content: ある日
one day
ある時
on one occasion―one time―once
ある人
a certain person―a man
ある人に聞いた
A certain person told me―A little bird whispered to me.
ある人に貰った
A certain person gave it me.
ある人から借りた
A certain person lent it me.
ある所に
in a certain place
ある程度までは本当だ
It is true to a certain extent.

content:
ある〔在る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=何はどこにある)to be; to be situated:(またその物の形状により)to lie; to stand(等)

content.content: 日月は天に在り
The sun and the moon are in the heavens.
宮城は市の中央に在る
The Imperial Palace is situated in the heart of the city.
その家は郊外に在る
The house stands in the suburbs.
神社は頂上に在る
The shrine stands at the summit.
その町は河のほとりに在る
The town stands on the banks of a river.
公園は町の北の方に在る
The park lies in the north of the town.
ハワイは日本と米国の間に在る
The Sandwich Islands lie between Japan and America.
その地所は町はずれに在る
The plot lies on the outskirts of the city.
宮城野は仙台の東に在る
Miyagino stretches to the east of Sendai.
富士山は東京の西に在る
Mt. Fuji rises to the west of Tokyo.
鴨緑江は朝鮮と満洲の間に在る
The Yalu flows between Korea and Manchuria.
その路は崖縁に在る
The road runs along the edge of a precipice.
その言葉はどこに在るか
Where does this word occur?
百ページの五行目に在る
It occurs in the fifth line on page 100.
金は天然に在る
Gold occurs in nature.

content: 2. (=何は何にあり)to lie (in something); to consist (in something)

content.content: 幸福は満足に在り
Happiness consists in contentment.
困難は人選に在り
The difficulty lies in the choice of men.

content: 3. (=何は誰に在り)to lie (with one); to rest (with one)

content.content: その罪自家に在り
The fault lies with yourself―lies at your own door.
これを決するは君の権内に在り
It rests with you to decide―The decision rests with you.

content:
ある〔有る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=何が有る)to exist:(普通語にては) there is

content.content: 神が有るか
Is there a God?
神が有る
There is a God―God exists.
有ると言う人もあり無いと言う人もある
Some say there is; others say there is none.

content: 2. To find(は探す物が有る)

content.content: (無くなした)時計があった
I have found my watch.
どこにあったか
Where did you find it?
妙な所にあった
I found it in a curious place.
紙なら抽斗にある
You will find some paper in the drawer.
猟が有りましたか
Have you found any game?―had any game?

content: 3. To know of(は有るを知る); to hear of(は有ると聞く); to think of(は心当たりが有る)

content.content: 適任者がありませんか
Do you know of any one fit for the post?―Can't you think of any fit person?
差当たりありませんね
I can't think of any one at this moment.
あったら知らせましょう
If I hear of one, I will let you know.
何か名案がありませんか
Can't you think of some good plan?
(そんなばかな事をする奴が)どこの世界にあるものか
Who ever heard of any one doing such a foolish thing?

content: 4. To believe in(は有ると信ずる)

content.content: 幽霊はあるものと思うか
Do you believe in ghosts?
僕は来世はあると思う
I believe in the future existence.

content: 5. (=いまだ有る、今なお存す)to be in existence; to be existent; to be extant:(人なら) to be living:(建物なら) to be standing

content.content: シェークスピアの作の初版はまだどこかにありますか
Is the folio Shakespeare still in existence?―still extant?
シェークスピアの住んだ家はまだある
Shakespeare's house is still standing.
その人はまだ世にある
He is still living.

content: 6. (=どこに何が有る)there is:(またその物の形状により) there lies, there stands(等)

content.content: 世界に不思議な物が七つある
There are seven wonders in the world.
頂上に神社がある
There is a shrine―There stands a shrine―A shrine stands―at the summit.
市外に野がある
There is a field―There lies a field―A field lies―outside the city.
仙台の東に原がある
There is a plain―There stretches a plain―A plain stretches―to the east of Sendai.
京都の西北にあたって山がある
There is a mountain―There rises a mountain―A mountain rises―to the north-west of Kyoto.
京都に河がある
There flows a river―A river flows―through Kyoto.
崖縁に道路がある
There runs a road―A road runs―along the edge of the precipice.

content: 7. To be found(は自然に有る)

content.content: 金剛石はどこにあるものか
Where are diamonds found?
この植物は日本にもある
This plant is to be found in Japan.
いくらでもある
They are to be found in any number.
べたにある
They are to be found all over the place.
そんな人は桝で量るほどある、箒で掃くほどある
Such men are to be found by the cartload.

content: 8. To be had(は売物などに有る)

content.content: この本は東京にあるか
Is this book to be had in Tokyo?―Can I get this book in Tokyo?
どこの本屋にもあります
It is to be had at any bookstore―You can get it at any bookstore.
日本国中にありません
It is not to be had in all Japan.
しけで魚は金ずくにも何ずくにもありません
Owing to stress of weather, fish is not to be had for love or money.
ざらにある
They are to be had for the gathering.

content: 9. To have (in it, on it, to it―は何に何が有る)

content.content: 壁に孔がある
There is a hole in the wall―The wall has a hole in it.
僕の鞄には名前がある
There is a name on my trunk―My trunk has a name on it.
お鞄に鍵がありますか
Is there a key to your trunk?―Has your trunk a key to it?
戸の鍵がありません
There is no key to the door―The door has no key to it.
この規制には例外がある
There are exceptions to this rule―This rule has exceptions to it.
この鉱石に金がある
There is gold in this ore―This ore has gold in it―This ore contains gold.

content: 10. (=誰に何が有る)to have:(有形の物なら) to own:(無形の物なら) to possess:(代用動詞) to boast(は誇り有す); to enjoy(は享有す)

content.content: あの人は金がある
He has money―possesses wealth―is possessed of wealth.
精力がある
He has energy―possesses energy―is possessed of energy.
地所や家作がある
He has lands and houses―owns lands and houses―is the owner of lands and houses.
宝物がある
He has a treasure―boasts a treasure.
名誉がある
He has a reputation―enjoys a good reputation―rejoices in a good reputation.
よい息子がある
He has a good son―He is happy in a good son―He is blessed with a good son.
不孝息子がある
He has a bad son―He is cursed with a bad son.
人には理性と言語がある
Man has reason and speech―Man is endowed with reason and speech.
あの人は才がある
He has talents―He is endowed with talents.
牛には角がある
A cow has two horns―is armed with two horns―is furnished with two horns.
日本には良い学校がある
Japan has good schools―boasts good schools―is blessed with good schools.
日本ではたいがいの家に風呂場がある
Most Japanese houses have a bath-room―is provided with a bath-room.
有りそうで無いものは金
People will seem to have more money than they do have.
無さそうで有るものは借金
People will seem to have less debts than they do have.

content: 11. (=いくら財産が有る)to be worth (so much)

content.content: 彼は百万の財産がある
He is worth a million.

content: 12. (=いつ何が有る)to happen(は大事件や偶然); to occur(は小事件); to take place(は事件や催し); to come off, go off(は儀式など); to come on(は裁判など); to be fought(は戦い); to be felt(は地震)

content.content: 君の不在中にあった事を聞いたか
Have you heard of what happened in your absence?
大事件があった
A great event happened.
意外な事があるものだ
It is the unexpected that happens.
一度あった事は二度ある
What has happened once, may happen again.
君の身に万一の事があったら家族はどうする
If anything should happen to you, what would become of your family?
何事があろうとも覚悟をきめている
Whatever may happen,―Come what may,―I am prepared for it.
己が長短を知らずにいることが往々ある
It often happens that a man is blind to his own merits or faults.
昨夜火事があった
There was a fire―We had a fire―A fire broke out―A fire occurred―last night.
昨日地震があった
There was an earthquake―An earthquake occurred―A Shock was felt―yesterday.
ほどなく機会があった
It was not long before an opportunity presented itself―an opportunity occurred―an opportunity offered.
会は日曜にあった
The meeting was held on Sunday.
今度の会はいつあるか
When is the next meeting to be held?
試験はいつあるか
When is the examination to take place?―to be held?
裁判は来月ある
The trial takes place―comes on―next month.
儀式は昨夜あった
The ceremony came off last night.
ここに戦いがあった
A battle was fought here.
海戦はどこにあったか
Where was the naval-battle fought?―Where did the sea-fight take place?
明日稽古があるか
Is there school tomorrow?
稽古はいつまであるか
How long does school last?
三時まである
It lasts till three.
明日議会があるか
Does the House sit tomorrow?

content: 13. (何百ある)to number (so many hundred):(何尺ある) to measure (so many feet):(何貫目ある)to weight (so many pounds):(何反、何町歩ある)to cover (so many acres):(何マイルある) to be (so many miles) distant

content.content: 君は何尺あるか
How many feet do you stand?
五尺五寸ある
I stand five feet six.
何貫目あるか
How many pounds do you weigh?
十五貫ある
I weigh fifteen stones.
日本の人口は七千万ある
The population of Japan is seventy millions―The population of Japan numbers seventy millions―Japan has a population numbering seventy millions―Japan has a population of seventy millions.
英国の人口がいくらあるか
What is the population of England?
畳は長さ六尺ある
A mat is six feet long―measures six feet in length―has a length of six feet.
幅三尺ある
A mat is three feet wide―measures three feet in width―has a width of three feet.
この河は長さがいくらあるか
How long is this river?―What is the length of this river?
幅はどれほどあるか
How wide is the river?―What is the width of the river?
あの塔の高さは二十間{けん}ある
That tower is 120 feet high―measures 120 feet in height―has a height of 120 feet.
富士山の高さはどれほどあるか
How high is Mt. Fuji?―What is the height of Mt. Fuji?
この河の深さは三尋{ひろ}ある
This river is three fathoms deep―measures three fathoms in depth―has a depth of three fathoms.
太平洋の深さはいくらあるか
How deep is the Pacific Ocean?―What is the depth of the Pacific Ocean?
三笠の甲鉄の厚さが九インチある
The Mikasa's armour is nine inches thick―measures nine inches in thickness―has a thickness of nine inches.
長門の甲鉄は何インチあるか
How thick is the Nagato's armour?―What is the thickness of the Nagato's armour?
大きな鰻は六百匁{もんめ}もある
A large eel will weigh five pounds.
大きな駝鳥は高さ二間もある
A large ostrich will stand 12 feet.
大きな鯨は五間もある
A large whale will measure 30 feet.
大きな鷲は羽根の先から先まで二間もある
A large eagle will measure 12 feet from tip to tip of its wings.
その動物の大きさはどれほどあるか
How large is the animal?―What is the size of the animal?
大きさは猫くらいある
It is about as large as a cat―about the size of a cat.
大きさは猫の倍ある
It is twice as large as a cat―twice the size of a cat.
ここから仙台まで何里あるか
How far is it―What is the distance―from here to Sendai?
東京から仙台まで百里ある
Sendai is a hundred ri (distant) from Tokyo.
王子まではよほどある
It is a long way to Oji―Oji is a long way from here.
公園の面積は十町歩どある
The park covers about 20 acres.

content:
14. 
〈代用形容詞〉Some; any(?)

content.content: 日本人で英語をよくする人がある
Some Japanese speak English well.
日本人でロシア語を話す者があるか
Do any Japanese speak Russian?
少しはある
A few do.
これができる者があるか
Can anybody do this?
たくさんある
Many can.
白い烏がある
Some crows are white.
黒くない烏がある(Some crows are not black.―と言わずして)
All crows are not black―Crows are not always black.
飛ぶ魚がある
Some fish can fly.
飛べない鳥がある
There are some birds which can not fly.
有るは無いに勝る
Something is better than nothing.

content:
15. 
〈代用副詞〉(=何々することが有る)sometimes; often; ever(?)

content.content: 彼は徹夜することがある
He sometimes sits up all night.
病気することが往々ある
He often falls ill.
君はこっちの方へ来ることがあるか
Do you ever come (up or down) this way?
時にはある
I sometimes do.

content:
16. 
〈代用副詞〉(=何々したことが有る)the Perfect Tense:(副詞にて表わせば) before; once; ever(?)

content.content: その話は聞いたことがある
I have heard that story (once or before).
君は獅子を見たことがあるか
Have you seen a lion?―Did you ever see a lion?
見たことがある
Yes, I have―I have seen one.
君はここへ来たことがあるか
Have you (ever) been here (before)?―Did you ever come here (before)?
あそこへ行ったことがあるか
Have you (ever) been there?―Did you ever go there?
あの人にはどこかで逢ったことがある
I have met that man―remember meeting that man―somewhere.
逢ったことが幾度もある
I have met him several times.

content:
あるいは〔或は〕
〈接続詞〉Or; either...or

content.content: 日本の学者はたいがい英語のほかにフランス語かあるいはドイツ語を知っている
Most Japanese scholars know French or German, besides English.
大学生はドイツ語かあるいはフランス語かいずれかを選ばなければならぬ
The undergraduates must choose either German or French.

content:
〈副〉
1. Perhaps; possibly:(助動詞を以て表わせば) may

content.content: あるいは然らん
Perhaps it is so―It may be so―That may well be―It is possible―It is not impossible.
あるいはそうでないとも限らぬ
It may possibly be so.
戦争の事だから日本があるいは負けないとも限らぬ
As it is the fortune of war, Japan might possibly be defeated.

content:
2. 
〈その他〉

content.content: あるいは…あるいは…
now...now...―(不定代名詞を用いれば)―some...some...―some...others...
あるいは飲みあるいは食う
They now eat and now drink.
あるいは是としあるいは非とす
Some approve of it, others disapprove of it.

content:
あるかなし〔有るか無し〕
〈形〉Few or none; few, if any:(量なら) little or none; little, if any:(事なら) seldom or never; seldom, if ever

content.content: そんな人は有るか無しだ
There are few, if any, such men.
見込はあるか無しだ
There is little, if any, hope.
彼が出かけることは有るか無しだ
He rarely, if ever, goes out.

content:
あるかり〔亜爾加里<アルカリ>〕
〈名〉An alkali:(=の) alkaline

content.content: アルカリ性
alkalinity
アルカリ性の物質
an alkaline substance

content:
あるかり〔亜爾加里<アルカリ>〕
〈名〉An alkali:(=の) alkaline

content.content: アルカリ性
alkalinity
アルカリ性の物質
an alkaline substance

content:
あるきかた〔歩き方〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あるきぶり〔歩き振り〕
あの人の歩き方は妙な歩き方だ
He has a queer gait.

content:
あるきつき〔歩き付き〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あるきぶり〔歩き振り〕
あの人は遠くから歩きつきでわかる
I know him a mile off by his walk―by his gait.

content:
あるきぶり〔歩き振り〕
〈名〉(One's) manner of walking, walk, gait, pace, step, tread

content.content: その歩きぶりでは今日中に行き着くのはむつかしいね
You will never get there today if you go at that pace.

content:
あるきまわる〔歩き廻る〕
〈自動〉To walk about

content.content: 今日は一日東京中を歩きまわった
I have walked about the city all day.

content:
あるく〔歩く〕
〈自動〉
1. To walk:(広い意味に用いれば) to travel; to go:(列を成して歩く) to march:(どのように歩く) to step, tread (how?)

content.content: 足で歩く
I walk on my legs.
そっと歩く
to walk softly―step softly―tread softly
軽く歩く
to step lightly―tread lightly
重く歩く
to step heavily―tread heavily
彼は日本国中を歩いている
He has travelled all over Japan.
世界中方々歩いている
He has knocked about the world.
手を振って歩く
He swings his arms as he goes.
杖を振りまわして歩く
He flourishes his cane as he goes.
歩いて行く、歩いて来る
to go on foot―come on foot―walk it
車が無いから歩いて来た
No kuruma was to be had, and I came on foot―and I had to walk it.
天気が好いから歩いて行こう
The weather is fine. Let us go on foot―Let us walk it.
日曜に王子まで歩いて行った
I walked to Oji―walked as far as Oji―went to Oji on foot―on Sunday.
半分歩いた
I walked one half of the distance―I did half the distance on foot.
地上を歩く
to walk over the ground
畳の上を歩く
to walk over the mats
敷物の上を歩く
to walk over the carpet
芝草の上を歩く
to walk over the lawn
天井を歩く
to walk over the ceiling
氷の上を歩く
to walk over the ice
雪を踏んで歩く
to walk through the snow
道を歩く
to walk down the road―(登り坂に限って)―walk up the road
市中を歩く
to walk about the city
市街を歩く
to walk (about) the streets
ひと息に十里歩いた
I walked ten leagues at a stretch.
今日はあまり歩いてくたびれた
I have walked so much that I am tired―walked myself weary.
君はよく歩く(健脚だ)
You are a good walker―a good pedestrian.
僕の所から学校まで歩いて五分かからない
I live within five minutes' walk of the school.
犬も歩けば棒に当る
A walking dog will get something―“Every dog will have his day.”
歩く姿は百合の花
She walks a lily.
The cygnet nobly walks the water:
So walks on earth Yamato's daughter.―Adapted from Byron.

content: 2. ［注意］「ブラブラ歩く」とか「テクテク歩く」とか種々の歩き方を言うには「歩き方」の動詞を用いて「歩く」は副詞(along, about)を以て表わす事が多い。例えば

content.content: ブラブラ歩く
to stroll about―saunter along―lounge along―loiter along
食事をすましてから市街をブラブラ歩いた
Dinner over, we strolled about the streets―went for a stroll about the streets.
彼は(太っていて)ころがるよう歩く
He rolls along―rolls about.
駆け歩く
to run about―run along
飛んで歩く
to fly about―run about
彼は朝飯前から飛んで歩く
He will run about without waiting to eat his breakfast―(を通例)―“not let the grass grow under his feet.”
お転婆娘が廊下をバタバタ駆けて歩く
A romping girl bounces about the passages.
小児がチョコチョコ歩く、ヨチヨチ歩く
A child toddles about―toddles along.
老人がヨボヨボ歩く
An old man hobbles along.
病人がヨロヨロ歩く、ヒョロヒョロ歩く
An invalid totters along―staggers along.
あの女は家鴨のようにヨタヨタ歩く
She waddles about―waddles along.
老婆が重い物を背負ってヨッコラヨッコラ歩く
An old woman halts along under a heavy load.
テクテク歩く
to trudge it
車が無いからテクテク歩いて来た
I had to trudge it―hoof it―for want of a kuruma.
トボトボ歩く
(疲れてなら)to plod one's way―(独りでなら)―pursue one's lonely way
タドタド歩く
to totter along
千鳥足に歩く
to reel along
貴婦人がショナショナ歩く
A fine lady minces her steps―walks with mincing steps.
ノラクラ歩く
to loiter along
ノロノロ歩く
to walk slow―loiter along―proceed at a snail's pace
ノソノソ歩く
hulk about―hulk along
ノソノソ歩いて来る
He comes hulking along.
急いで歩く、忙しく歩く
to bustle about―hurry about
だらしなく歩く
to slouch along―shuffle along―flop along―shamble along
足を棒にして歩いた、足をすりこぎにして歩いた
I have walked myself lame.
足にまかして歩く
to go wherever fancy leads
足をひきずって歩く
to drag oneself along
びっこ引いて歩く
to go limping―limp along―halt along
餌をあさり歩く
to go about in quest of food―prowl about in quest of prey
出歩く、ホッキ歩く、浮かれ歩く
to gad about
近頃浮かれ歩いている
He has been gadding about in a giddy fit.
家を外にして出歩いてばかりいる
He is always upon the gad―He is a stranger at home.
品物をふれて歩く
to cry about―hawk about―one's wares
行列をして歩く
to march in a procession
行列をして市中をねり歩く
to march through the streets―parade the streets
裸足で歩く
to go barefoot
ハキハキ歩く
to walk briskly―walk at a brisk pace
早足に歩く、急ぎ足に歩く
to walk at a smart pace
赤子がはって歩く
A baby creeps about―creeps on all fours.
路をひろって歩く
to pick one's way―pick one's steps―through the mire
威張って歩く
to stalk along
気取って歩く、容体ぶって歩く
to strut along―strut about
肩で風を切って歩く
to swagger about
コソコソ歩く
to prowl about―slink about
小さくなって歩く
to slink about―sneak about
隠れて歩く
to skulk about―dodge about
門づけが流して歩く
An itinerant musician busks along―busks about.
大股に歩く
to stride along―walk with great strides―walk with rapid strides―walk with vigorous strides
大道狭しと押し歩く
to stalk through the streets―lord it over the town
迷子を探して歩く
to go about in search of a lost child
遊んで歩く
to go about in quest of pleasure―travel for pleasure
さすらい歩く
to wander about
人の後をつけて歩く
to shadow one―dog one's steps
爪先で歩く、爪立ちに歩く
to walk on tiptoe
市街をゾロゾロ歩く
They walk the streets in parties.
持ち歩く
to carry about anything with one
この本は持って歩くに便利だ
The book is convenient to carry about (with one).
病人は立って歩けるようになった
The invalid can get about now―He has found his legs―He now feels his legs.

content:
あることないこと〔有る事無い事〕
〈名〉Fact and fiction; a mass of lies

content.content: 有る事無い事を言う
to tell a mass of lies―give rein to one's imagination
彼は有る事無い事悪口を言う
He calumnizes people.
有る事無い事を言いふらす
to spread false reports

content:
あるこーる〔亜爾箇保児<アルコール>〕
〈名〉Alcohol; spirits

content.content: アルコール中毒
alcoholism
アルコール漬け
preservation in spirits
切断した腕がアルコール漬けになっている
The amputated arm is preserved in spirits.
アルコール・ランプ
a spirit-lamp

content:
あるこーる〔亜爾箇保児<アルコール>〕
〈名〉Alcohol; spirits

content.content: アルコール中毒
alcoholism
アルコール漬け
preservation in spirits
切断した腕がアルコール漬けになっている
The amputated arm is preserved in spirits.
アルコール・ランプ
a spirit-lamp

content:
あるじ〔主〕
〈名〉The master (of the house); the head (of a family):(夫) the husband;(the guest に対し) the host:(女なら) the hostess:(旅館などなら) the landlord:(女なら) the landlady

content.content: 主と親には勝たれぬ
It is no use kicking against authority.
行き暮れて木の下
Belated, 'neath a cherry's shade
蔭を宿とせば
A shelter for the night I found;
花や今宵の
And well the fragrant flower played
主ならまし
The hostess to my slumber sound.

content:
あるたけ〔有る丈〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ありたけ〔有丈〕

content:
アルプス
〈固名〉The Alps:(=の) Alpine

content.content: 日本アルプス
The Japanese Alps.

How can I do such a thing, as if I were a beggar?―like a beggar?
君じゃあるまいし誰がそんなことをするものか
Who would do such a thing, as if I were you?―like you?
盗むのじゃあるまいし借りるのだからかまわないじゃないか
Why should I not borrow? Borrowing is not stealing.

Why should we eat the globe-fish (at the risk of our lives) when we have other good fish at our command?

content:
2. (=皮膚などの荒れ)roughness
3. (=荒廃)waste; devastation

〈指摘代名詞〉

content.content: あれって何のこと

あれさ

無論あれさ
Of course you know what.
あれか、あれは大丈夫だ
I know what you mean―it is all right.
あれやこれや
this and that―one thing and another
あれやこれやでなかなか金を儲ける
He makes much money by this and that―by one thing and another―one way and another.
あれやこれやで手がふさがっている
My time is taken up with his and that―What with one thing, what with another, my time is wholly taken up.
あやれこれやを思い合わしてそうに違いないと思った
Putting this and that together,―Putting two and two together, I concluded it to be so.
あのことはあれでよろしい
The matter may remain as it stands.
あれだ
How he goes on!―How he carries on!―How he talks!
あれでなかなかこっけい家だ
He is a wag in his way.
あれでも学者だ
He is a scholar in his way.
あれほど(あれだけ)金があったらたくさんだろう
He ought to be contented with so much money.
あれくらい金が欲しい
I should like to be as rich as he is.
あれまでは万事好都合でした
Up to that time, all had gone well.
あれからここにいる
I have been here since then―ever since.
あれっきり会わない
I never saw him after that―That was the last I saw of him.
あの事はあれなりになっている
The matter remains as it was.
あれしきの事で怒るものでない
You should not get angry at such trifles.
あればかりの金で何ができるものか
What can be done with so trifling a sum?

content:

to clear waste land―reclaim waste land

content:

〈副〉That was all; that was the last

content.content: あれっきりでもう無い
That was all I had―That was the last I had―I have no more.
あれっきり会わない
I never saw him after that―That was last I saw of him―I saw no more of him.
あれっきりで何の音沙汰が無い
That was the last I heard of him―I heard no more of him.
あれっきり来ない
That was the last time he came―He came no more.
酒はあれっきりで止めた
That was the last time I drank―I drank no more.

content:

content.content: あれでなかなかこっけい家だ
He is a wag in his way.
あれでなかなか親切だ
He is kind after a fashion.
あれでなかなか勉強する
He works hard in his way.
あれでなかなか学問ができる
He is a scholar in his way.

content:

content.content: あれでも学者だ

あれでも学者じゃげな
He is a scholar, it would seem.
あれでも天才だ
He is a genius in a sense.
あの男はあれでも親切だ
He is kind after a fashion.

The country is being desolated.
家が荒れ果てる
The house is being dilapidated―going to rack and ruin.
庭が荒れ果てている
The garden is utterly neglected―going to the dogs.

content:
あれやこれや

content.content: 彼はあれやこれやでなかなか金を儲ける
He makes much money by this and that―by one thing and another―one way and another.
あれやこれやで手がふさがっている
My time is taken up with this and that―What with one thing, what with another, my time is wholly taken up.
あれやこれやを思い合わせてそうに違いないと思った
Putting this and that together,―Putting two and two together,―I concluded it to be so.

〈間投詞〉An exclamation descriptive (not expressive) of alarm

content.content: 皆あれよあれよと騒ぐばかり

content:
あれる〔荒れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=荒らされる)to be wasted; to be laid waste; to be devastated; to be desolated; to be ravaged; to be dilapidated

content.content: 戦後、国が荒れている
The country is desolate after the war.
田畑が荒れる
The fields are wasted―become waste.
洪水で田畑が荒れた
The fields are wasted―laid waste―ravaged―by the flood―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The flood has ravaged―wasted―laid waste―the fields.
これが洪水で荒れた跡だ
These are the ravages of the flood.
北海道の大部分はまだ荒れている
The greater part of Hokkaido still lies waste.
家は手入れをしないから荒れている
The house is dilapidated―out of repair―going to rack and ruin.
庭は(掃除をしないから)荒れている(草ぼうぼう)
The garden is ill-kept―neglected―going to the dogs―overgrown with weeds.
冬は肌が荒れる
The skin roughens―frets―chafes―chaps―gets chapped―in winter.
肌が荒れている
My skin is roughened―fretted―chafed―chapped.
寒いと顔が荒れる
The face chafes or frets in cold weather―skins with the cold―is chapped or skinned by the cold.
寒い風に当たると顔が荒れる
The face is chafed―fretted―chapped―skinned―by cold winds―(他動詞構文にすれは)―Cold winds chafe―fret―chap―skin―the face.
顔が荒れている
My face is chafed―fretted―chapped―skinned.
手が荒れる
The hand roughens―chaps―gets chapped.
水仕事をすると手が荒れる
Washing chaps the hands.
白墨を使うと手が荒れる
Chalk roughens the hand.
手が荒れている
My hands are rough―chapped.
舌が荒れる
The tongue roughens.
酸っぱい果物を食うと舌が荒れる
Sour fruits roughen the tongue.
舌が荒れて何を食べても味がしない
My tongue is so rough that I can not taste anything.
芝生が荒れている
The lawn is ruffled.
地面が荒れている
The ground is disturbed.
天気が荒れる
The weather is stormy―A storm rages.
天気が荒れている
The weather is stormy―A storm is raging.
九月十月は荒れがちだ
The weather is stormy in September and October―September and October are stormy months.
海が荒れる
The sea rages.
海が荒れている
The sea is troubled―The sea is rough―The water are raging.
渡航中海が荒れた
The sea was rough―We experienced rough weather―during the passage.
風で海が荒れる
The gale lashes the sea into fury.
海が荒れて漁ができぬ
There is no fishing owing to the rough weather―owing to stress of weather.

content: 4. (=暴れる)to rage; to rampage; to tea about; to rip and tear about:(口でなら)to rave; to storm; to bluster:(群集なら)to run riot

content.content: 獅子が荒れる
A lion rages.
赤い物を見せると牛が荒れる
Red colour enrages a bull.
籠の鳥が荒れる
A caged bird chafes against the bars.
天井で鼠が荒れる
The mice scramble among the beams.
鼠が荒れる時は安心して寝られる
When the mice play, you may sleep in peace.
狂人が荒れ狂う
A madman rips and tears about.

content:
あろう
〈可能助動詞〉
1. May; must

content.content: 多分そうであろう

きっとそうであろう
It must be so.
これは何かの間違いであろう
It must be some mistake.

content:
2. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 大臣であろうと何であろうとその分にして置かぬ
Whether he may be a minister or not,―Minister or no minister,―he shall smart for it.
この評判が本当であろうと嘘であろうと我々には関係の無い事だ
The report, whether it may be true or false,―be it true or false,―does not concern us.
人もあろうに君がそんなことをしては
That you, of all persons, should do so!
時もあろうに元旦早々借金取りは恐れ入った
That I should be dunned for payment, of all the days in the year, on New Year's Day!
場所もあろうに教会堂でばくちとは
That a church, of all places, should be used for gambling!
有ろう事か有るまい事か教会でけんかを始めた
Would you believe it if I tell you that they began quarrelling in the church?

せっかくの骨折りも水の泡

肌に粟を生ずる
to have goose-skin―have goose-flesh

The sight gives me goose-skin―makes my flesh creep.
粟おこし
millet-cake
粟粒

〈名〉A bubble:(口から吹く泡)foam:(ビールなどの泡)forth:(沸騰の泡)spume:(煮物の泡)scum:(せっけんの泡)lather; suds

content.content: 泡が立つ
to bubble―(荒波なら)―foam―(ビールなら)―froth―(葡萄酒なら)―sparkle―(煮物なら)―scum―(せっけん水なら)―lather―(沸騰してなら)―effervesce
泡が消える
A bubble bursts.
口から泡を吹く
to foam at the mouth―froth at the mouth
カニが泡を吹く
A crab foams at the mouth.
一ト泡吹かせる
to beat one into fits―give one fits
口角泡を飛ばす
to splutter―sputter
口角泡を飛ばして論ずる
to discuss a matter with spluttering violence―with sputtering vehemence
泡食う
to lose one's presence of mind―lose one's head―be flustered―be flurried

〈名〉A space (between two objects); an interval (between two occurrences)

あわおこし〔粟おこし〕

〈形〉Fresh (water); tasteless (food); light (taste); faint (colour); frank (nature); simple (intercourse); indifferent (to or about wine and woman, etc.)

content.content: 名利に淡し
He is indifferent to wealth or fame.
君子の交わりは淡きこと水の如し
“Great men meet as water meets water.”
淡き交わり
frank intercourse―simple intercourse
淡い悦びを覚えた
I felt a faint joy.

content:
あわくう〔泡食う〕
〈自動〉To lose one's presence of mind; to lose one's head; to be flustered; to be flurried

content.content: 泡食って飛び出した
I ran out in a flurry.

content:
あわして〔合わして〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: あわせて〔合わせて〕

あわせ〔袷〕
〈名〉A lined gown (for spring and autumn wear)

あわせかがみ〔合わせ鏡〕
〈名〉A mirror used in conjunction with another (to show the back of the head); counter mirrors

content:
あわせて〔合わせて〕
〈副〉
1. (=皆合わせて)altogether; in all

content.content: 合わせていくらになるか
What do you make it in all?
合わせて七十五円
I make it 75 yen in all.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 二人の金を合わせて百円ある
We have 100 yen between us.
皆の所持金を合わせて一円足らず
They have not one yen among them all.

content: 2. (=何に合わせて)in addition (to something); besides (something)

content.content: これも合わせてお頼み申す
I ask this favour in addition to the other―besides the other.
合わせて平素の疎遠を謝す
In addition, I beg to apologize for being such a bad correspondent.

content: 3. (=標準に合わせて)according to (some standard); after (a model)

content.content: 規則に合わせてこしらえる
to make anything according to the rule―by rule
機械はこの雛形に合わせてこしらえて貰いたい
I wish the machine to be made after this model.
寸法に合わせてこしらえる
to make clothes or shoes to measure
この靴は寸法に合わせてこしらえた靴だ
These shoes are made to measure.
縮尺に合わせて図を引く
to draw a plan to scale
この図は縮尺に合わせて引いてある
The plan is drawn to scale.

content: 4. (=音楽に合わせて)(to sing or dance) to (music)

content.content: 音楽に合わせて歌う
to sing to music
音楽に合わせて踊る
to dance to music
三味線に合わせて歌う
to sing to a samisen accompaniment―sing to the samisen
バイオリンに合わせて舞踏をする
to dance to (the music of) the violin
船歌に合わせて舟をこぐ
The rowers keep time with the boat-song.
力を合わせて事をしとげる
A thing is accomplished by united efforts.
我々が力を合わせてかかったならできない事はあるまい
It might be done by our united efforts.
兄弟力を合わせて大望をとげた
The grand object was attained by the united efforts of the brothers.
心を合わせて働く
to work with one accord

あわせど〔合わせ砥〕
〈名〉A set of two whetstones (one of which is used to smoothe the other, used for sharpening razors, etc.)

あわせめ〔合わせ目〕
〈名〉The junction, the seam (of things joined together)

content:
あわせもの〔合わせ物〕
〈名〉Things joined together

content.content: 合わせものは離れもの
What are joined, may be disjoined―What are united, may be separated.

content:
あわせる〔逢わせる〕
〈他動〉To expose (one to some experience)

content.content: 人を危険に逢わせる
to expose one to danger
そんなことをするとひどい目にあわしてやる
You shall smart for it―pay dearly for it.
踏んだり蹴ったりの目に逢わせる
to add insult to injury―heap insults upon one

content:
あわせる〔会わせる〕
〈他動〉To let (one) see (another); to make (one) meet (another)

content.content: 中へ入って二人を会わせる
to arrange a meeting between the two
(会いたいなら)会わしてやる
I will arrange a meeting between you―You shall see her.
(不在だと言って)来訪者に会わせぬ
to deny a person to a caller
誰が行っても会わせない
They deny him to all callers―He is denied to all callers.
幾度行っても会わしてくれない
I called several times, but he was denied to me.
西洋で人を食事に招くのはいろいろな人に会わせるのが目的である
The foreign host invites you to dinner to bring people together.

content:
あわせる〔合わせる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=加える)to combine, unite, join, put together, add up, sum up (two or more things)

content.content: 二組を合わせる
to combine two classes―(団体なら)―unite two parties
分れている党派を合わせて一つにする
to unite different parties into one
彼は我々を皆合わしたよりも強い
He is stronger than all of us put together.
数を合わせる
to add one number to another―add up figures
七と三を合わせると十になる
to add 7 to 3―7 and 3 is 10
利益を合わせる
to add up the profits―sum up the profits
二枚を合わせる
to put two sheets together―put one sheet on another―put one sheet on top of another
三枚を合わせる
to put three sheets together―put three sheets one on top of another
力を合わせる
to join forces―unite efforts―cooperate
力を合わして働く
to work together―cooperate with some one in some work
力を合わして事をしとげる
A thing is accomplished by united efforts.
主従力を合わして大望をとげた
The object was attained by the united efforts of master and servant.
混ぜ合わせる
to mix things together
縫い合わせる
to sew pieces together
物と物を打ち合わせる
to strike things together
二枚の板を釘で打ち合わせる
to nail two boards together

content: 2. (=適合せしむ)to fit, suit, adapt, adjust, conform, square (one thing to another)

content.content: 洋服を身体に合わせる
to fit a coat to the figure
よく合わしてくれ
You must make it a good fit―make me a good fit.
望遠鏡や顕微鏡を目に合わせる
to adjust a telescope or a microscope to the eye―set a telescope―set a microscope
言葉に身振りを合わせる(身振りをして話す)
to suit the action to the word
意見を合わせる
to adapt one's views to another's―square one's views to another's
話を聴き手に合わせる、聴衆の程度に合わして説く
to suit one's discourse to the capacity of the audience―adapt oneself to the audience
規則に合わせる
to conform anything to the rule
規制に合わしてこしらえる
to make anything according to the rule―by rule
教義を世に合わせる
to adapt one's doctrine to the times―“fashion one's doctrines to the varying hour”

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 合印を合わせる
to check the counter-marks
バツを合わせる
to keep one's companion in countenance
帳面を合わせる
(読み合わせるの意味なら)to verify accounts―(間違いを直すの意味なら)―adjust accounts
帳尻を合わせる
to make the accounts balance
調子を合わせる
(楽器のなら)to tune an instrument―put a piano in tune―(人の歌になら)―play up to the song or the singer―(人になら)―make oneself agreeable to a person
あの人は誰にでも調子を合わせる
He makes himself agreeable to everybody―He will dance to anybody's tune.
符節を合わすが如し
They are―(出来事なら)―feature for feature alike―(本なら)―page for page alike―(詩文なら)―line for line alike―(原文と訳文なら)―word for word alike.
訳文を原文に合わせる
to conform the translation to the original―(比較するの意味なら)―compare the translation with the original
訳文は原文と符節を合わすが如し
The translation is word for word like the original.

色を合わせる

to set a razor
顔を合わせる
to show one's face―(相撲なら)―be matched against each other―(役者なら)―appear in the same play
二人は土俵で顔を合わした事が無い
They have never been matched against each other―never met on the ring.
二人は舞台で顔を合わせたことが無い

面目なくて合わす顔が無い

顔を合わせながら知らぬ顔

カルタを合わせる
to play (at) cards
薬を合わせる
to compound a medicine―(毒薬なら)―mix a poison
心を合わせる
to act with one accord
心を合わして働く

間に合わせる
to make anything do
この金で間に合わせよう

(月給で暮らせるかと問われて)どうかこうか間に合わせられる
I can meet my expenses―make both ends meet.
音楽に合わせる
(歌なら)to set a song to music―(合わして歌うのなら)―sing to music―(合わして踊るのなら)―dance to music
三味線に合わして歌う

縮尺に合わして図を引く

寸法に合わせる

太刀を合わせる

手を合わせる

with folded hands

to set a watch―set a clock

時計が進んでいるから合わせてくれ給え

つじつまを合わせる

content:
あんがい〔案外〕
〈副〉
1. Contrary to expectation; beyond expectation; more...than one expected ［thought, hoped, feared］:(=な) unexpected, unlooked-for, surprising, astonishing, amazing (result); unexpected, unlooked-for, unhoped-for (success); unexpected, unlooked-for, disappointing (failure)

content.content: 結果は案外だ
The result is unexpected―contrary to expectation―contrary to our expectations―not what we expected―surprising―a surprise.
彼の成功したのは案外だ

He has succeeded beyond expectation―beyond our expectations―better than we expected―His success is unexpected―beyond expectation―beyond our expectations―surprising―an agreeable surprise―His success exceeds our expectations.
彼が失敗したのは案外だ
He has failed contrary to expectation―contrary to our expectations―His failure is unexpected―contrary to expectation―contrary to our expectations―disappointing―a disappointment.
彼の成功は実に案外だ
His success exceeds my wildest hopes.
成績は案外良い
The result is better than I expected―beyond expectation―beyond my expectations―surprisingly good―an agreeable surprise―The result exceeds my expectations.
成績は案外悪い
The result is worse than I expected―disappointing―a disappointment―The result falls short of my expectations―The result does not come up to my expectations.
利益は案外多い
The profit is larger than I expected―far greater than I hoped―It exceeds my expectations.
損亡は案外少ない
The loss is smaller than I expected―much less than I feared.
仕事は案外骨が折れる
I find my work harder than I expected.
試験は案外やさしかった。
The examination was easier than I had expected.
あそこの試験は案外やさしい
That examination is easier than people think.
君の病気は案外早く治った
You have recovered sooner than I expected―much sooner than I hoped.
彼の病気は案外長くかかった
His recovery has taken longer than I expected―even longer than I feared.
案外好い天気になった
Contrary to expectation,―Contrary to our expectations,―the weather has turned out well―The weather has turned out to be an agreeable surprise―a pleasant surprise.
案外に思う
to be surprised―be astonished―be amazed―be disappointed
結果を見て案外に思った
I was surprised at the result―The result surprised me―The result was a surprise to me.
彼が成功したと聞いて案外に思った
I was agreeably surprised at his success―His success was an agreeable surprise to me.
彼が失敗したと聞いて案外に思った
I was surprised at his failure―disappointed at his failure―His failure was a surprise to me―a disappointment to me.
(親独派曰く)ドイツが負けたのは実に案外に思う
I am astonished at German's defeat―I little thought that Germany would be defeated.
ドイツが負けたと聞いて実に案外に思った人があるだろう

content.content: 海峡は暗礁だらけだ
The straits are full of sunken rocks―full of reefs.
前方に暗礁あり(航海中の警戒)
Breakers ahead!
船が暗礁をよけて通る
A ship steers clear of the rocks.
船が暗礁の間を縫って走る
A ship threads her way between the rocks.
船が暗礁に乗り上げる
A ship runs on a rock―strikes a rock.
船が暗礁に乗り上げて砕けてしまう
A ship splits on a rock.
船を暗礁から下ろす
to get a ship off the rocks
船が(独りで)暗礁から下りる
A ship floats off the rocks.
満潮になると船が暗礁から下りる
The next tide will float her off the rocks.

content:
あんじる〔案じる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=心配する)to be anxious, be concerned (about a matter―for a person)

content.content: 親が子の身の上を案ずる
The parents are concerned for the children's welfare.
先が案じられる
I am anxious about the future―I fear for the future―I wonder what will become of me.
こんなふうでは先が案じられる
This is a bad sign for the future―This augurs ill for the future.
この塩梅じゃお前の身の行く末が案じられる
You will come to no good―come to grief―come to the gallows―if you go on at that rate.
明日の事は明日案じる
“Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.”

content: 2. (=気遣う)to be afraid of, fear, expect (some bad result)

content.content: 案じるより生むが易い
Things are easier than expected―“Fear outruns the danger.”

content: 3. (=案じ出す)to think out, devise, contrive, invent (a machine, etc.)

content.content: 一策を案じた
I have thought of a plan―hit upon a plan.

あんじわずらう〔案じ煩う〕
〈自動〉To be oppressed with doubts and anxieties

content:
あんしん〔安心〕
〈名〉
1. (=心配の無い安心)ease of mind; rest of mind:(=する) to feel easy; to be easy in one's mind; to make oneself easy; to set one's heart at ease; to set one's mind at rest

content.content: 彼の件についてはご安心なさい
You may make yourself easy―set your heart at ease―set your mind at rest―about that matter.
安心しました
I now feel easy―I am easy in my mind―My mind is at rest―My heart is at ease.
(心配していると悪いから)彼に安心させてやろう
I will make him easy―set his heart at ease―set his mind at rest.
お話を承って安心しました
You have made me easy―set my heart at ease―set my mind at rest.
仕事が片づくまでは安心ができん
I shall have no rest till my work is done.
あの男は一遍殴らないとうるさくて安心ができんよ
You will have no rest―(他動詞構文にすれば)―He will give you no rest―till you give him a thrashing.

content: 2. (=心配の無くなった安心) relief:(=する) to feel relief; to feel relieved; to be relieved of anxiety; to have a weight taken off one's mind

content.content: お話を承って安心しました
You have relieved me of my anxiety―taken a weight off my mind―removed a load off my mind―lifted a great load off my mind.
その報に接して安心した
I was relieved at the news.
(彼が心配しているから)安心さしてやろう
I will relieve him of his anxiety―take a load off his mind.
安心してほっと一息吐く
to give a sigh of relief―draw a long breath
安心して胸をなで下ろした
I feel a sense of relief―breathe again―breath freely.
(話を聞かしてやったら)安心した様子をして帰って行った
He left me with a look of relief.
事件が首尾よく落着して、皆非常に安心した
The matter has been brought to a happy termination, to the unspeakable relief of everybody.

content: 3. (=心に罪悪、煩悩などの無い安心)peace of mind; peace of conscience

content.content: 安心して暮らす(安堵する)
to live in peace
安心して眠る(安眠する)
to sleep in peace
鼠が暴れる時は安心して寝られる(火事、地震の憂い無し)
When the mice play, you may sleep in peace.
(疑いが晴れたから)安心して立ち去れ(元引導を渡す言葉)
Depart in peace!
(美人が男の)安心を妨害する(気を揉ませる)
to disturb one's peace of mind
この方法は試してみたから安心してお勧め申す
I can recommend the method with a good conscience.

content: 4. (=悟りを開いた安心)resignation; calm resignation

content.content: 安心を得る
to find calm resignation
運命と諦めて安心を得る
to resign oneself to one's fate―be resigned to one's lot
天命と諦めて安心を得る
to resign oneself to Heaven's will―(キリスト教なら)―make peace with God
彼は安心を得た様子だ
He has a resigned air.
無常の世に住む人は依頼すべき磐石(神)を得て始めて安心あり
Man can not attain calm resignation in this mutable world till he has found his “Rock of Ages”

content: 5. (=苦労の無い安心)happiness; contentment:(=する) to be happy; to be contented

content.content: 彼はよい息子を持って安心だ
He is happy in his son.
息子に嫁を取って安心しました
My son's marriage has made me happy.
ご普請ができてさぞご安心でしょう
You must be happy with your new house finished.
息子が卒業すると親達が安心する
The parents are made happy by their son completing his education.
早くご両親にご安心させなさい
You must make haste and make your parents happy.
彼は小成に安じて安心している
He is contented with a little―contented with his humble lot.
安心は小成に安んずるにあり
Happiness consists in contentment.

content: 6. (=恐れの無い安心)confidence; security:(=する) to be confident, be sure, be certain (of success); to be secure (of success―from danger); to feel safe (from danger); to be free from danger; to be out of danger

content.content: 国民は安心して勝利を期していた
The people were confident of victory.
僕はきっと成功するつもりで安心している
I am confident of―am secure of―am sure of―am certain of―success.
利息の安い預金は安心だ
Money is secure at low interest.
事件は君に託しておけば安心だ
The matter is safe in your hands.
事件は安心な人に託してある
The matter is in safe hands.
この家は危険が無いから安心だ
We feel safe from danger―We are secure from danger―here.
我家へ帰ってまず安心
I am safe at home―safe in my den.
病人はもう安心だ
The invalid is safe (from danger)―free from danger―out of danger.
日本ほどよい国は無いと安心してそう言える(断言して憚らず)
I may safely say―It is safe to say―that Japan is the best country under the sun.
この方法は(実見の結果)安心してお勧め申す
I can recommend the method with a safe conscience―with a good conscience.
(大丈夫と請け合って)安心させる
to assure one of safety―assure one that all is safe―reassure one
安心する
to reassure oneself―be reassured
彼の返事を聞いて安心した
I was reassured by his answer―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His answer reassured me―His answer was reassuring.
うまくゆくから安心し給え
I can assure you that all will go well―assure you of success.
僕は全力を尽くすからご安心下さい
I assure you―You may rest assured―that I will do my best.
僕がきっと後援すると言って彼に安心さしてやり給え
You may assure him that I will back him―assure him of my support.
彼は君に安心させる為にそう言ったのだ
He said so to reassure you.
彼にはなんとなく人に安心させる語調がある
There is something reassuring in his tone―He speaks in a reassuring tone.［注意］同じ「安心させる」場合でも以下を比較せよ。
安心して預ける、安心して託す
to trust one with anything
あの男には金を託しても安心か
Can you trust him with money?
君なら金をいくらでも安心して預けておける
I would trust you with any amount of money.
あの年になれば独りで世の中へ出しても安心だ
At his age, you may trust him alone in the world.
君は東京の市街を安心して歩けるようになったか
Can you trust yourself in the streets of Tokyo now?
僕は(慣れないから)安心して演壇に登れない
I can not trust myself on the platform.
若い女が安心して世界中歩けるようになった
A young girl can now trust herself alone all over the world―travel by herself all over the world in perfect safely.
あれは安心のできない男だ
You can not trust that man―must not trust that man.

content.content: あんな奴と遊ぶな

あんなことを言っているがあれは口ばかりだ
He talks like that, but it is all talk.

あんな悪い奴を信用するとはどうしたばかだ

あんな美しい女を見たことが無い
I never saw such a beautiful woman―so beautiful a woman―(と言うよりも通例)―I never saw a more beautiful woman―She is the most beautiful woman I ever set eyes on.

content:
あんない〔案内〕
〈名〉
1. (=先導)Conduct; guidance:(=する) to conduct, guide (one); to show (one) the way; to show, usher (one into a room); to show (one over the house)
《a》

content.content: 先に立って案内する
to lead the way
案内しろ
Lead on!
道を案内する
to show one the way
(道をご存じなくば)ご案内しましょう
I will show you the way.
(勝手がわかりませんから)どうぞご案内を願います
Will you kindly show me the way?
宿屋へご案内しよう
I will take you to a hotel.
明かりを持って案内する
to light one the way
明かりを見せて二階へ案内した
I lighted him upstairs.
案内して見せる
to show one over a place
家をご覧になるならご案内しましょう
I will show you over the house.
(甲板士官が水兵を呼んで)この方に艦内をご案内してお見せ申せ
Show this gentleman over the ship.
校長が校内を案内してくれた
The principal showed us over the school.
学校の構内も案内してくれた
He also walked us over the school-grounds.
市内を案内して見せる
to take one over the city
京都なら私がご案内しよう
I will take you over Kyoto―show you the sights of Kyoto.
田舎者の案内を引き受けて東京中引っ張りまわした

(教育視察に来た西洋人を)方々の学校へ案内した
I showed him round the schools―took him round to the various schools.
案内して通す
to usher one in (or into a room)―(は雅文、普通は)―show one in (or into a room)―ask one in (or into a room).
その方をご案内しろ
Show him in.
客間へご案内しろ
Show him into the parlour.
二階へご案内しろ
Show him upstairs.
案内を乞う(頼もうと言う)
to call out for admission―(西洋では)―knock at the door―ring the bell.
玄関に(頼もうと言って)案内を乞う者がある
There is some one singing out at the door―(西洋では)There is some one at the door―a knock at the door―a ring at the bell.
案内無しに人の家に入る
to enter a house unannounced
案内も無く上がり込む
to force one's way into a house
誰の案内で
under one's conduct―under one's guidance
一行は市長の案内で市内を見物した
The party saw the sights of the city under the conduct of the Mayor―under the guidance of the Mayor―The Mayor showed them the sights of the city―took them over the city―did the honours of the city.

content: 《g》(=案内者)a guide:(名所のは)a cicerone

The illustrious visitor did the sights of Japan under the conduct of a guide.

I did Nikko under the conduct of a cicerone.

Previous engagement obliges me to decline your kind invitation.

A cordial invitation is extended to everybody.

As I am familiar with the place, I can find my way in the dark.

You must know―You must be aware―that we are in the Imperial Preserve.

The Mayor acted as guide to the party.

It is dangerous to enter the mountains without a guide.

content:
あんなに
〈副〉So (much); that (much); (with, for, after, in spite of) all

content.content: あんなに金があったら沢山だろう
He ought to be contented with so much money―such wealth.
あんなに金があっても満足しない
He is not contented with so much money―all that money―all his wealth―For all his wealth, he is not contented.
あんなに借金があっても平気なものだ
With all his debts, he is perfectly calm and serene.
あんなに勉強したから及第するはずだ
He ought to succeed after such labours.
あんなに勉強したのに落第した
He has failed after all his labours.
あんなに言っておいたのにまた忘れたのか
Have you forgotten again after all I told you?
あんなに堅い約束をしたのに今日来ないのは不思議だ
After all his solemn promises, his absence today is unaccountable.
あんなに稼いでも相変わらず貧乏だ
He remains poor in spite of all his labours―For all his labours, he remains as poor as ever.
あんなに言い聞かしてもまだわからない
All my talk has been in vain.
あんなにやかましく言ってもまだ聴かない
All my serious talk is lost upon him.
たった三年で身代をあんなにした
It took him only three years to build up such a fortune―to amass such wealth.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: あんなにあった身代をどうしたろう
I wonder what he can have done with his large fortune.
学校をあんなにするにはだいぶ骨が折れたろう
It must have cost him much labour to make the school what it is.

content:
あんに〔暗に〕
〈副〉Darkly; obscurely; obliquely; indirectly

content.content: 暗にほのめかす
to hint darkly―hint obscurely
彼は暗に辞意をほのめかした
He obscurely hinted at resignation―darkly hinted that he should resign―dropped a dark hint about resignation.
暗に諷す
to hint obscurely―hint obliquely―suggest indirectly―insinuate―innuendo
暗に諷して切腹を勧めた
I advised him, by innuendoes,―by insinuations,―by oblique hints,―by indirect suggestions,―to answer for his crime with death.
暗に言う
to hint a fact―suggest an idea to one
相手は気違いだぞと暗に言った
I hinted that he had to deal with a madman―I hinted the fact of his having to do with a madman.
そんな者を相手にするなと暗に言った
I suggested to him the idea of having nothing to do with such a man.
暗に示す
to hint a way―suggest a plan
暗に指す
to allude to a person or thing
彼は暗に君のことを言っているのだ
He is alluding to you.
腹がへったから暗に謎をかけた
I dropped a dark hint that I was hungry―let fall a delicate hint about the dinner-hour.
彼は暗に暇乞いに来たのであった
He had come to bid me an indirect farewell.
暗に非難する
to reflect upon―cast a reflection upon―a person or his character
かく言うのは決してその人の人格を暗に非難するのではない
I do not mean to cast a reflection upon the man's character.

content.content: 案に違わず彼は負けた
According to expectation,―According to our expectations,―he came off a loser.
案に違わず彼はちゃんとそこにいた
Sure enough, there he was.

〈名〉
1. (=調味)taste, flavour, seasoning (of food):(=する) to flavour, season (food)

content.content: 塩梅を見て下さい
Please taste it.
僕が塩梅見をしよう
I will taste it―constitute myself taster.
塩梅はどうですか

It is very well seasoned―excellently seasoned―(焼き物の塩梅なら)―done to a turn.

content: 2. (=健康状態)state of health

content.content: ご塩梅はどうですか

content: 4. (=様子、工合)state of things; rate

content.content: (まず)好い塩梅です
Things go well―All goes well―I am glad all has gone well.
好い塩梅に天気になりました
I am glad the weather has turned out well.
好い塩梅に火事が広がらなかった
I am glad the fire did not spread.
好い塩梅に早く治った
I am glad you have recovered so soon.
この塩梅じゃ
Judging from the present state of things―At this rate,...
この塩梅じゃ事がうまく行きそうだ
Judging from the present state of things, the enterprise is likely to go well―This is a good sign for the success of the enterprise.
この塩梅じゃ事が失敗に帰しそうだ
Judging from the present state of things, the scheme is likely to end in a failure―This is a bad sign for the success of the scheme―This augurs ill for the success of the scheme.
この塩梅じゃ明日の天気はむつかしい
This is a bad sign for tomorrow's weather―This augurs ill for tomorrow's weather.
この塩梅じゃ先が案じられる
This is a bad sign for the future―This augurs ill for the future.
この塩梅じゃお前の末が案じられる
I fear for your future if you go on at the rate.
あの塩梅じゃたちまち身代を使い果たすだろう
He will soon go through his fortune at that rate.
この塩梅じゃとて今日中に行き着けないよ
We shall never get there today, going at this rate.

content: 2. (=心意)mind; heart

content.content: 彼の答に大いに意を強うする
His answer is heartening―encouraging―reassuring.
日本にこの人ありと思えば意を強うするに足る
The presence of such a man in Japan is enough to fortify our minds―It is reassuring to think that Japan boasts such a man.
意を決する
to make up one's mind―determine―resolve
意を明かす
to open one's mind―open one's heart―to some one
意に介する
to mind trouble―take anything to heart

Do not mind what he says!―Do not take what he says to heart!
煩労の如きは意に介するところにあらず
I do not mind trouble―I make nothing of trouble.
危険などは意に介さぬ
I don't mind dangers―I care nothing for dangers.
成功失敗は意に介さぬ
I don't care about success or failure.

content: 3. (=注意)care; attention

content.content: 意を用いる
to take care―be careful
衛生に意を用いる

意を用いた支度

意に留める

content.content: 意に適う
to be to one's mind―to one's liking―to one's taste―after one's fancy―to suit one―please one
この本は意に適わぬ
The style is not to my taste.
意に適った家が無い
None of the houses suits me―pleases me―I can not find a house after my fancy.
我が意を得たり
It pleases me―I am pleased.
この家は我が意を得た

人の意を迎える
to insinuate oneself into another's favour―ingratiate oneself with another―scratch one where one itches

content: 5. (=意向)intention; wish; desire; inclination; thought; pleasure

content.content: 彼は辞職の意がある
He thinks of resigning―He has thoughts of resigning.
僕はそんな意は無い
I have no intention of doing such a thing.
彼はあの地位を得ようという意がある
He wishes to get the position―He is desirous to secure the position.
彼は洋行の意がある
He intends to go abroad.
僕は外遊の意は無い
I have no intention of going abroad.
彼は試みる意がある
He is inclined to make a trial―He has a mind to try.
己が意を明かす

意を通ずる
to make known one's intention―make oneself understood
君は英語で意を通ずることが出来るか
Can you make yourself understood in English?
人の意を探る
to sound one's views―feel one's pulse
人の意に従う

君の意にまかす、意のままにし給え
You may act at your pleasure―You may do as you please―You shall have your way.

意のままにならぬことが多い

そうすれば成功は意のままになる

万事意の如くならぬ

彼の言語といい挙動といいどうしても発狂に違いないと思った
From his speech and behaviour, I concluded him to be mad.

content: いい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕→『

content.content: よい〔善い、好い、良い、宜い〕

content:
』
〈形〉
1. Good:(副詞に訳せば)well

content.content: これは好い酒だ
This is good wine.
実に好い子だ
She is as good as gold―worth her weight in gold.
好いことは待遠しい
A good thing is a long time in coming.
好いことばかりは無い
We must take the evil with the good.
好い物は得難い
Good things are hard to get―“The best fish swim near the bottom.”
好い子だから早くお寝なさい
Go to bed, there is a good boy!―there is a good girl!
彼は人が好い
He is good -natured.
様子が好い
He is good-looking.
今日は気分が好い
I feel well today.
気持が好い
I feel that it is well with me.
彼の病気はたいがい好い
He is nearly well.
彼は亭主ぶりが好い
He plays the host well―hosts it well.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉 Nice (man); handsome (man); fine (woman); fair (weather); pretty (face); sweet (smell or voice); agreeable (taste)

content.content: 好い方ね
What a nice man!
あの人は程が好い
He is sweet-tempered―amiable.
好い男だ
He is a handsome man.
好い女だ
She is a fine woman―a fine girl.
天気が好い
It is fine weather―We have fair weather.
好い景色だ
What a fine prospect!
あの家は見晴らしが好い
The house commands a fine prospect.
あの娘は好い顔だ
She has a pretty face.
この花は匂いが好い
This flower smells sweet.
あの子は声が好い
She has a sweet voice.
この果物は味が好い
This fruit has an agreeable taste.

content: 3. (=めでたい)auspicious (occasion); happy (event); lucky (day)

content.content: 好い日を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
日が好い
The day is lucky.
近いうちに好いことがある
A happy event is expected.

content: 4. (=何の方が好い)better

content.content: この方が好い
This is better than that―the better of the two.
この方がはるかに好い
This is far better than that―by far the better of the two.
僕は洋服より和服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
あの人はいない方が好い
His room is better than his company―I prefer his room to his company.

content: 5. (=一番好い)best

content.content: これが一番好い
This is the best (of all).
日本ほど好い国は無い
Japan is the best country in the world―the best country under the sun―the best land the sun shines upon.

content: 6. (=何に好い)good for (something)

content.content: 運動は身体のために好い
Exercise is good for the health.
苦い物は胃に好い
Bitters are good for stomach.
風邪に好い薬は無いものか
Is there no remedy for colds?

content: 7. (=どうした方が好い)(you) had better; (I) may as well

content.content: 君は自分で行った方が好いだろう
You had better go yourself―I would advise you to go yourself.
君に事実を打明けた方が宜かろう
I may as well tell you the truth.

content: 8. (=何々しても好い)(you) may; (I) do not mind (doing something); (I) have no objection to (doing something)

content.content: 君は行ってもいい
You may go―I don't mind your going―I don't care if you go―I have no objection to your going.
一杯飲んでもいい
I don't mind taking a glass―I don't care if I take a glass―I have no objection to taking a glass.
金を貸してくれてもいいじゃないか
You might lend me the money.
見てもいいじゃないか
Why should I not look at it?

content: 9. (=何々すれば好い)have only to

content.content: 勉強さえすれば好い
You have only to work hard.
金は月末に返せば好い
You have only to pay the money at the end of the month―You need not pay the money before the end of the month.

content: 10. (=何々するが好い)ought to

content.content: もっと勉強するがいい
You ought to work harder.
お父さんに伺って見るがいい
You ought to ask your father―You will do well to ask your father.

content: 11. (=何々したのが好い)(You have) done well (in doing something)

content.content: 僕に相談したのがいい
You have done well in consulting with me.

content: 12. (=何々しなくとも好い)need not

content.content: その金は返さなくてもいい
You need not repay the money.

content: 13. (=無くとも好い)can do without

content.content: この金は当分無くともいい
I can do without this money for the present.
あの人はいなくともいい
We can do without him―He can be very well done without.

content: 14. (=そうなら好い)I wish it were so

content.content: 僕は鳥なら好い
I wish I were a bird.
羽根があったら好いだろう
I wish I had wings.
飛ぶことができたら好いだろう
I wish I could fly.
君の病気が早く治れば好い
I wish you would soon get well.
彼が今度及第すれば好い
I wish he would pass this time.
待つ人が早く来れば好い
I wish he would come soon.

content: 15. (=何でも好い)any

content.content: 何本でもいいから貸してくれ
Lend me any book.
いくらでもいいから貸して下さい
Please lend me any sum.
どちらの本でもいいから貸してくれ
Lend me either book.
嘘でも本当でもいいからその話を聞かしてくれ給え
Please tell me the story whether it may be true or false.

content: 16. (=それで好い)That will do

content.content: 何でもいい
Anything will do.
どちらでもいい
Either will do.
ただ懸けておけばそれでいい
You just hang it up, and there you are.
いいか
Are you ready?
明日は早く来るんだぞ、いいか
You must come early tomorrow, mind!―mark my words!
まあいいわ
Well, let it go!―Let it pass!―It is no matter.
それでいい
That will do.
それはいいとして食事はどうしよう
Setting that aside, how shall we do for the meals?
いいともいいとも
Certainly.
まあいいじゃありませんか
Are you going so soon?―Surely you can stay a little longer.
彼は好い腕を持っている
He has ability.
酒や女はあっても無くてもいい
Wine and woman are indifferent to me―I am indifferent to wine and woman.
(僕が東京に慣れないのを)いいことにして僕をだました
He took advantage of my ignorance of the town to cheat me.
年が違ったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the difference in age!
いくら金がかかったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the expense!―Hang the expense!
いいようにし給え
Do as you please!―Suit yourself!
好いところで逢った
I am glad to have met you―Well met!
好い気味だ
Serve you right!
好い面の皮だ
Poor fellow!
好い物を拾った
See what I have found!
好い人でもできたか
He has got a sweetheart it would seem―She has got a chap, it would seem.
好い年をして結婚でもあるまい
Marriage is not to be thought of at his age―at his time of life.
生きがい好い
to be fresh―to look rosy about the gills
彼は金廻りが好いと見える
He seems to be flush of money.
君は察しが好い、思いやりが好い
You are considerate.
彼は酒の上が好い
He is merry over his cups.
彼は非常な倹約で吝嗇と言ってもいいくらいだ
He is extremely frugal, not to say stingy.
君はちょうど好い時に来た
You have come just in time―just at the right moment―in the nick of time.
