I feel that it is well with me.
彼の病気はたいがい好い
He is nearly well.
彼は亭主ぶりが好い
He plays the host well―hosts it well.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉 Nice (man); handsome (man); fine (woman); fair (weather); pretty (face); sweet (smell or voice); agreeable (taste)

content.content: 好い方ね
What a nice man!
あの人は程が好い
He is sweet-tempered―amiable.
好い男だ
He is a handsome man.
好い女だ
She is a fine woman―a fine girl.
天気が好い
It is fine weather―We have fair weather.
好い景色だ
What a fine prospect!
あの家は見晴らしが好い
The house commands a fine prospect.
あの娘は好い顔だ
She has a pretty face.
この花は匂いが好い
This flower smells sweet.
あの子は声が好い
She has a sweet voice.
この果物は味が好い
This fruit has an agreeable taste.

content: 3. (=めでたい)auspicious (occasion); happy (event); lucky (day)

content.content: 好い日を選ぶ
to fix upon a lucky day
日が好い
The day is lucky.
近いうちに好いことがある
A happy event is expected.

content: 4. (=何の方が好い)better

content.content: この方が好い
This is better than that―the better of the two.
この方がはるかに好い
This is far better than that―by far the better of the two.
僕は洋服より和服の方が好い
I like Japanese clothes better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign clothes.
あの人はいない方が好い
His room is better than his company―I prefer his room to his company.

content: 5. (=一番好い)best

content.content: これが一番好い
This is the best (of all).
日本ほど好い国は無い
Japan is the best country in the world―the best country under the sun―the best land the sun shines upon.

content: 6. (=何に好い)good for (something)

content.content: 運動は身体のために好い
Exercise is good for the health.
苦い物は胃に好い
Bitters are good for stomach.
風邪に好い薬は無いものか
Is there no remedy for colds?

content: 7. (=どうした方が好い)(you) had better; (I) may as well

content.content: 君は自分で行った方が好いだろう
You had better go yourself―I would advise you to go yourself.
君に事実を打明けた方が宜かろう
I may as well tell you the truth.

content: 8. (=何々しても好い)(you) may; (I) do not mind (doing something); (I) have no objection to (doing something)

content.content: 君は行ってもいい
You may go―I don't mind your going―I don't care if you go―I have no objection to your going.
一杯飲んでもいい
I don't mind taking a glass―I don't care if I take a glass―I have no objection to taking a glass.
金を貸してくれてもいいじゃないか
You might lend me the money.
見てもいいじゃないか
Why should I not look at it?

content: 9. (=何々すれば好い)have only to

content.content: 勉強さえすれば好い
You have only to work hard.
金は月末に返せば好い
You have only to pay the money at the end of the month―You need not pay the money before the end of the month.

content: 10. (=何々するが好い)ought to

content.content: もっと勉強するがいい
You ought to work harder.
お父さんに伺って見るがいい
You ought to ask your father―You will do well to ask your father.

content: 11. (=何々したのが好い)(You have) done well (in doing something)

content.content: 僕に相談したのがいい
You have done well in consulting with me.

content: 12. (=何々しなくとも好い)need not

content.content: その金は返さなくてもいい
You need not repay the money.

content: 13. (=無くとも好い)can do without

content.content: この金は当分無くともいい
I can do without this money for the present.
あの人はいなくともいい
We can do without him―He can be very well done without.

content: 14. (=そうなら好い)I wish it were so

content.content: 僕は鳥なら好い
I wish I were a bird.
羽根があったら好いだろう
I wish I had wings.
飛ぶことができたら好いだろう
I wish I could fly.
君の病気が早く治れば好い
I wish you would soon get well.
彼が今度及第すれば好い
I wish he would pass this time.
待つ人が早く来れば好い
I wish he would come soon.

content: 15. (=何でも好い)any

content.content: 何本でもいいから貸してくれ
Lend me any book.
いくらでもいいから貸して下さい
Please lend me any sum.
どちらの本でもいいから貸してくれ
Lend me either book.
嘘でも本当でもいいからその話を聞かしてくれ給え
Please tell me the story whether it may be true or false.

content: 16. (=それで好い)That will do

content.content: 何でもいい
Anything will do.
どちらでもいい
Either will do.
ただ懸けておけばそれでいい
You just hang it up, and there you are.
いいか
Are you ready?
明日は早く来るんだぞ、いいか
You must come early tomorrow, mind!―mark my words!
まあいいわ
Well, let it go!―Let it pass!―It is no matter.
それでいい
That will do.
それはいいとして食事はどうしよう
Setting that aside, how shall we do for the meals?
いいともいいとも
Certainly.
まあいいじゃありませんか
Are you going so soon?―Surely you can stay a little longer.
彼は好い腕を持っている
He has ability.
酒や女はあっても無くてもいい
Wine and woman are indifferent to me―I am indifferent to wine and woman.
(僕が東京に慣れないのを)いいことにして僕をだました
He took advantage of my ignorance of the town to cheat me.
年が違ったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the difference in age!
いくら金がかかったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the expense!―Hang the expense!
いいようにし給え
Do as you please!―Suit yourself!
好いところで逢った
I am glad to have met you―Well met!
好い気味だ
Serve you right!
好い面の皮だ
Poor fellow!
好い物を拾った
See what I have found!
好い人でもできたか
He has got a sweetheart it would seem―She has got a chap, it would seem.
好い年をして結婚でもあるまい
Marriage is not to be thought of at his age―at his time of life.
生きがい好い
to be fresh―to look rosy about the gills
彼は金廻りが好いと見える
He seems to be flush of money.
君は察しが好い、思いやりが好い
You are considerate.
彼は酒の上が好い
He is merry over his cups.
彼は非常な倹約で吝嗇と言ってもいいくらいだ
He is extremely frugal, not to say stingy.
君はちょうど好い時に来た
You have come just in time―just at the right moment―in the nick of time.

content:
いい〔唯々〕
〈副〉Yes; aye

content.content: 唯々として
willingly
妻は唯々として夫に従う
The wife should bend to her husband's will.
唯々諾々
He is too compliant.

content:
いいあい〔言い合い〕
〈名〉An altercation; a dispute; a quarrel:(=する) to altercate, dispute, quarrel, have words (with any one)

content.content: 彼は人と言い合いなどをしたことが無い
He never had words with any one.
言い合いから殴り合いになった
They proceeded from words to blows.

content:
いいあう〔言い合う〕
〈自動〉To altercate, dispute, quarrel, have words (with any one)
〈他動〉To exchange

content.content: 悪口を言い合う
to exchange compliments (with each other)

content:
いいあてる〔言い当てる〕
〈自他動〉To guess right

content.content: 君はうまく言い当てた
You have guessed right―hit it―hit the right nail on the head―made a correct guess.

content:
いいあらそい〔言い争い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いいあい〔言い合い〕

いいあらそう〔言い争う〕
〈自動〉To wrangle, altercate, dispute, quarrel, have words (with any one)

content:
いいあらわす〔言い表わす〕
〈他動〉To express; to describe

content.content: 思うことを言い表わす
to express one's thoughts and feelings―express oneself
思うことは言葉をもって言い表わす
Thoughts are expressed by means of words.
このありがたさは言葉をもって言い表わすことはできません
My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.
その風景の美は言葉をもって言い表わせぬ
The scenery is beautiful beyond description―The beauty beggars description.
その風景は絶美の二字よりほかに言い表わす言葉が無い
“Superb ” is the only word that describes the scenery.

content:
いいあわせる〔言い合わせる〕
〈自動〉To agree upon a plan; to make previous agreement; to preconcert

content.content: 二人の間にかねて言い合わしてあったに違いない
It must have been agreed upon between the two.
都下の新聞は言い合わしたように沈黙を守っている
The town papers preserve silence as if by common consent.

いいいれる〔言い入れる〕
〈自他動〉To offer; to make an offer; to make overtures

content:
いいえ
〈応答詞〉No:(打消の疑問に対しては)yes

content.content: お邪魔さま―いいえ、どう致しまして
I am sorry to stand in your way.―No, not at all.
お出でになりませんか―いいえ、参ります
Are you not going?―Yes, I am.

いいおき〔言い置き〕
〈名〉
1. (=伝言)a message:(=する) to leave a message; to leave word
2. (=遺言)a will:(=する) to make a will

content:
いいおく〔言い置く〕
〈他動〉To leave a message; to leave word

content.content: そのかたは今晩また伺うと言い置いて行きました
He left word that he would return in the evening.
彼は何か言い置いて行かないか
Hasn't he left any message for me?―left any message with you?
玄関番にくわしく言い置いて来た
I have left the particulars with the door-boy.

content:
いいおくる〔言い送る〕
〈他動〉To send(one) word; to write (one) word; to write to (one)

content.content: 先方へその趣きを言い送って下さい
Please write him to that effect.

いいおとこ〔好い男〕
〈名〉A handsome man; a good-looking man

content:
いいおとす〔言い落す〕
〈他動〉To omit to say; to forget to mention; to leave (anything) unsaid

content.content: 一つ言い落したことがある
There is one thing I forgot to mention.
もう言い落したことは無い
I have left nothing unsaid―said everything.

content:
いいおよぶ〔言い及ぶ〕
〈他動〉To refer to (a subject)

content.content: 誰もその問題に言い及んだ者は無い
Nobody referred to the subject―said anything in reference to the subject.

いいおんな〔好い女〕
〈名〉A fine woman; a good-looking girl

いいがいある〔言い甲斐ある〕
〈形〉Worth speaking of; worth mentioning

content:
いいがいない〔言い甲斐無い〕
〈形〉
1. Not worth speaking of; not worth mentioning
2. (=臆病な)cowardly

content.content: 言いがい無い奴だ
You are a coward.

content:
いいかえす〔言い返す〕
〈自動〉To answer back; to talk back

content.content: 長者に言葉を言い返すものでない
You should not answer back to your superiors.

content: 〈他動〉To retaliate (on one―a charge on one); to retort (on one―a charge on one)

content.content: 負けずと悪口を言い返した
I gave as good as I got.

content:
いいかえる〔言い換える〕
〈他動〉To say in other words; to paraphrase

content.content: 言い換えれば
in other words―that is to say―to wit―namely

content:
いいがかり〔言い掛かり〕
〈名〉
1. (=根の無い罪をかぶせること)a false charge; a false accusation

content.content: 言いがかりをつける
to accuse one falsely―make a false charge
言いがかりをつけられる
to be falsely accused
そんな言いがかりをつけられてはぜひ言い開きをしなければならぬ
I must clear myself of the false charge.

content: 2. (=口実)a pretext; an excuse

content.content: 彼らはなんとかかとか言いがかりをつけてけんかを吹掛ける
They will pick a quarrel with you on some pretext or other.

content:
いいかける〔言い掛ける〕
〈自動〉
1. (=話し掛ける)to speak to address (a person)

content.content: 言いかけられた人
The person spoken to.

content: 2. (=話し始める)to begin speaking

content.content: 彼はいつも半分言いかけて後は言わない
He always begins talking about something and stops half-way.

content: 3. (=罪を言い掛ける)to accuse (one of a crime); to charge (one with a crime)

content.content: 彼は盗みを言いかけられた
He was accused of theft.

content:
いいかげん〔好い加減〕
〈形〉
1. (=適度)moderate

content.content: 勉強も好い加減にするが好い
You ought to work in moderation―be moderate in working.
(何事も)好い加減にしろ
Do not go too far―Do not carry the matter too far―Do not go beyond bounds―Keep within bounds.
冗談も好い加減にしろ
You carry your joke too far―There are limits to a man's patience.
酒は好い加減にお止しなさい
It is time for you to leave off drinking.
汁は好い加減だ
The soup is well seasoned.
肉は好い加減に焼けている
The meat is done to a turn.
風呂はちょうど好い加減だ
The bath is to my liking.

content: 2. (=出鱈目)random; haphazard

content.content: (彼は知らないことを聞かれると)いい加減な返答をする
He will answer at random.
いい加減の返答
a random answer
いい加減に書いた答案が当たった
The answer I gave at random, has proved correct.
いい加減に選んだのが当たった
What I chose at hazard―at haphazard―has turned out well.
いい加減にやっておくさ
Do it anyhow and everyhow.
彼はいい加減のことを言う
He talks humbug―talks bunkum.
いい加減の作り話
a trumped up story―a made-up story―a make-up―a fabrication―an invention

content: 3. (=不徹底)not thorough; inconclusive; unconvincing; incomplete; half

content.content: 説明は極めていい加減のものだ
The explanation is extremely unconvincing.
彼の議論は極めていい加減のものだ
His argument is quite inconclusive.
回答は頗るいい加減のものだ
This answer is nothing to the purpose.
僕はいい加減のことをするのは嫌いだ
I do not like to do things by halves.
いい加減の処置をする
to talk half-measures
彼は人をいい加減にあしらう
He will put you off with evasive answers.
仕事をいい加減にする
to slight one's work―fudge one's work―scamp one's work

content: 4. (=曖昧な)vague; non-committal

content.content: いい加減の返事をしておいた
I gave a vague answer―a non-committal answer.

content: 5. (=申しわけだけの)perfunctory

content.content: 教員達はいい加減に職務をすましておく
The teachers go through their duties in a perfunctory way.

content:
いいかた〔言い方〕
〈名〉A way of saying; a mode of expression; an expression

content.content: 私の言い方はよろしいか
Do I express myself correctly?
ほかに何とか言い方がありそうなものだ
There must be some other way of expressing it―some other mode of expression―You might put it some other way.
それはうまい言い方だ
That is a happy expression―happily expressed―well put.

content:
いいがたい〔言い難い〕
〈形〉(It is) hard to say, impossible to say; unspeakable; indescribable

content.content: どうなるか言い難い
It is impossible to say what may happen―There is no saying what may happen.
彼の文章にはなんとも言い難い妙味がある
There is an indescribable charm about his style.
曰く言い難し
It is an unanswerable question.

content:
いいかねる〔言い兼ねる〕
〈自他動〉To be unable to say

content.content: そこまではどうやらこうやら言ったがその先は言いかねた
I managed to say so far, but beyond that I was unable to go on.
しかとしたところは言いかねます
I can't say for certain.

content:
いいかわす〔言い交す〕
〈自動〉To plight one's troth

content.content: 末は夫婦と互いに言い交わした
They plighted themselves to each other.
二人は深く言い交わした仲だ
They are plighted lovers.

content:
いいき〔異域〕
〈名〉A foreign country

content.content: 異域の鬼となる
to die in a foreign land

content:
いいき〔好い気〕
〈形〉Vain; proud; spoilt

content.content: いい気になる
to become vain―get spoilt
賞めるといい気になる
Praise will spoil him―Praise will make him vain.
母が甘いものだからいい気になって何をしでかすかわかったものでない
As he is spoilt by his fond mother, there is no saying what he may do.

content:
いいきかせる〔言い聞かせる〕
〈他動〉To tell (one something); to talk to (one); to advise; to warn

content.content: しみじみ言い聞かせた
I talked seriously to him.
あれほど言い聞かしてもまだわからない
All my talk has been in vain.
何を言い聞かしても耳に入れない
He gives no heed to advice or warning.

content:
いいきたり〔言い来り〕
〈名〉A tradition

content.content: 言い来たりによれば
according to tradition

content:
いいきる〔言い切る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=断言する)to be positive about (anything)

content.content: はっきり言い切らない方がよい
You had better not be positive about it.
いやならいやだとキッパリ言い切ってしまうさ
If you don't like it, say so once for all.

content: 2. (=言い終る)to finish saying

content.content: 言い切れぬほど話がある
I have more than I can say.

content:
いいぐさ〔言い草〕
〈名〉
1. (=言)one's words

content.content: その言い草がしゃくにさわった
His words stung me to the quick.

content: 2. (=言い訳)an excuse; a pretext

content.content: (彼は仕事を言いつけられると)なんとかかとか言い草を言って逃げる
When he is set a task, he will evade it on some pretext or other.

content: 3. (=話の種)a subject of talk

content.content: 彼は世間の言い草になっている
He is the talk of the town.

content:
いいくさす〔言いくさす〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: くさす

いいくるめる〔言いくるめる〕
〈自動〉To talk black into white; to talk wrong into right

content:
いいくろめる〔言い黒める〕
〈他動〉

content.content: 鷺を烏と言い黒める
to talk black into white―talk right into wrong

いいけす〔言い消す〕
〈他動〉To deny; to unsay; to gainsay; to contradict

content:
いいこ〔好い子〕
〈名〉
1. A good child; a good boy; a good girl

content.content: いい子だから早くお寝なさい
Go to bed, there's a good boy!―there's a good girl―there's a dear!―that's a dear!

content: 2. (=人に好かれる人)a fine fellow; a popular man

content.content: 彼はいい子になろうとする
He wishes to be thought a fine fellow.
自分独りいい子になろうとしたって人が承知しない
They will not allow him to make himself popular at other's expense.

content:
いいこしらえる〔言い拵える〕
〈自他動〉To fabricate, invent (a lie); to make up a story (out of the whole cloth)

content.content: うまく言い拵らえて家を出てきた
I invented a fib to come out.

content:
いいこと〔好い事〕
〈名〉A good thing; a happy event

content.content: 好い事は待ち遠しい
A good thing is a long time in coming.
好い事ばかりは無い
We must take the evil with the good.
近いうちに好い事がある
A happy event is shortly expected.
主人の不在をいいことにして
Taking advantage of the master's absence,...

content:
いいことにして〔好い事にして〕
〈副〉Taking advantage of (something)

content.content: 僕が黙っているのをいいことにして勝手なことを言う
They take advantage of my silence to say what they like.

content:
いいこなし〔言いこなし〕
〈名〉A happy expression

content.content: 彼は言いこなしがうまい
He has felicity of expression.

content:
いいこなす〔言いこなす〕
〈他動〉To express (it) somehow

content.content: うまく言いこなしたものだ
It is happily expressed―well put.

content:
いいこめる〔言い込める〕
〈他動〉To drive (one) into a corner; to corner (one)

content.content: 彼は言い込められてとうとう無茶なことを言い出した
He was driven into a corner, and finally came squarely up to the statement that two and two do not always make four.

content:
いいごん〔遺言〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆいごん〔遺言〕

いいしぶる〔言い渋る〕
〈自他動〉To hesitate to say

content:
いいじゃないか〔好いじゃないか〕
〈熟語〉Why not? (you) might; never mind

content.content: 行ったっていいじゃないか
Why should I not go?
笑ったっていいじゃないか
Why should I not laugh?
君金を貸してくれてもいいじゃないか
You might lend me the money, (might you not?)
年が違ったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the difference in age!
いくらかかったっていいじゃないか
Never mind the expense!―Hang the expense!

content:
いいしれぬ〔言い知れぬ〕
〈形〉Unspeakable; unutterable

content.content: と聞いて言い知れぬ悦びを覚えた
I felt unspeakable joy at the news.

いいすぎる〔言い過ぎる〕
〈自動〉To say too much; to exaggerate; to anticipate

content:
いいすごす〔言い過ごす〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: いいすぎる〔言い過ぎる〕

content:
いいすてる〔言い捨る〕
〈他動〉To say (anything) over one's shoulder

content.content: そう言い捨てて出て行った
So saying over his shoulder,―With this,―he left the room.

いいそこない〔言い損い〕
〈名〉A slip of the tongue; a misstatement

いいそこなう〔言い損う〕
〈自他動〉To say amiss; to missay; to mis-state

content:
いいたいこと〔言い度い事〕
〈名〉What one wants to say

content.content: 言いたいことがあるなら言え
You may say your say.
彼に言いたいことを言わしてやれ
Let him have his say.
言いたいことはたくさんある
I have much to say.
言いたいことは何も無い
I have nothing to say.
彼は言いたいことを言う
He has an unbridled tongue.

content:
いいだくだく〔唯々諾々〕
〈形〉Too compliant; passive

content.content: 貴様は何を言われても唯々諾々でいかん
You are a mush of compliance.

content:
いいたす〔言い足す〕
〈他動〉To say in addition

content.content: 「すぐね」と言い足した
“At once,” he added.

content:
いいだす〔言い出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=言い始める)to be the first to say

content.content: そんなことをいったい誰が言い出したのか
Who on earth was the first to say such a thing?

content: 2. (=発言する)to utter; to speak; to say

content.content: 彼はいったん言い出したら後へは退かぬ質だ
He never swerves from his resolutions.
言い出した以上は後へは退けぬ
Since I have said it, I must act up to it.
今頃そんなことを言い出しては困る
You must not recede from your promise at the eleventh hour.

content: 3. (=発議する)to propose; to suggest; to bring forward

content.content: これは誰が言い出した処置か
Who proposed the measure?―By whom was the measure suggested?

content: 4. (=切り出す)to broach the subject; to open the case; to break the ice

content.content: 言い出しにくい
I am afraid to broach the subject―afraid to break the ice.
どう言い出そうかと考えている
I am considering how I shall open the case.

content: 5. (=報を伝える)to raise the alarm

content.content: 言い出し屁
It is always the guilty party who raises the alarm.

content:
いいたて〔言い立て〕
〈名〉An assertion; a plea:(=る) to assert (one's innocence); to plead (illness); to mention (others' faults)

content.content: 彼はしきりに身の潔白を言い立てている
He strongly asserts his innocence―protests his innocence.
彼は病気と言い立てて欠席した
He absented himself on the plea of illness―under plea of illness.
人の非を言い立てるものでない
You should not mention others' faults.

content:
いいたる〔易々たる〕
〈形〉Very easy

content.content: それは実に易々たることだ
Nothing is easier―Nothing can be simpler.

いいちがい〔言い違い〕
〈名〉A misstatement; a slip of the tongue

いいちがえる〔言い違える〕
〈自他動〉To say amiss; to missay; to mis-state

content:
いいちらす〔言い散らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=勝手なことを言う)To say all sorts of things

content.content: 彼は人中で僕のことをさんざんに言い散らした
He abused me in every key in company.
当ても無い悪口を言い散らす
to scatter imputations at large

content: 2. (=言いふらす)to circulate (a rumour); to set (a rumour) afloat; to spread (a rumour) abroad

いいつくす〔言い尽す〕
〈自他動〉To say everything, to leave nothing unsaid; to exhaust (a subject)

content.content: (Thackeray と Dickens は)二人で英国社会の事を言い尽している
They have left nothing unsaid about English society between them.
彼らは悪口という悪口を悉く言い尽した
They have left no calumny unspoken.
言い尽せぬほど恩を蒙りました
I have received more favours than I can count.
その美は言葉に言い尽せぬ
Words can not do justice to the beauty―It is beautiful beyond description―The beauty defies description―baffles description―beggars description.

いいつくろう〔言い繕う〕
〈他動〉To gloss over, gloze over (a fault)

content:
いいつけ〔言い付け〕
〈名〉A command; a charge; an injunction; orders; directions; instructions

content.content: 言いつけ通りに致しました
I have acted according to orders―obeyed orders.
親の言いつけに背くものでない
You should not disobey your parents.
これが親の最期の言いつけです
This is my father's dying injunction.

content:
いいつける〔言い付ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=命ずる)to tell (one to do something); to bid(one do something); to order (one to do something); to direct (one to do something); to instruct (one to do something); to charge (one to see that...); to enjoin(a duty on one)

content.content: 座敷を掃除するように書生に言いつけて出て来た
I told the boy to clean my room when coming out.
言いつかったようになさい
Do as you are told―Do as you are bidden.
車夫に迎えに来るように言いつけておいた
I directed my jinrikishaman to come for me.
万事不都合の無いように頼むよと彼に言いつけた
I charged him to see that all was well.
貴方にこのお手紙をお手渡するように言いつかって参りました
I am charged to hand you this letter.
父に正直にするようにと言いつかりました
My father enjoined on me the duty of honesty.
ご用があったら何なりともお言いつけ下さい
I am at your service.

content: 2. (=告口する)to tell tales; to tell on (one); to peach on (one); to blow upon (one); to split on (one); to squeal on (one); to let on (to one); to sneak

content.content: (そんなことをすると)言いつけるぞ
I will tell on you―peach on you.
先生に言いつけるぞ
I will let on to Grim.
あの小僧は何でも先生に言いつける
He is a tale-bearer―a sneak.
あの小僧が言いつけたために事がばれた
The plot was discovered through that sneak.
そんなことをするとお父様に言いつけますよ
Your father shall know what you have done.

content:
いいっこなし〔言いっこ無し〕
〈熟語〉No saying

content.content: そんなことは言いっこ無しさ
No talking about that!

content:
いいつたえ〔言い伝え〕
〈名〉A tradition:(=る) to hand down (by tradition)

content.content: 言い伝えて今なお美談とす
The story is still told to this day and listened to with tears.

いいつのる〔言い募る〕
〈自動〉To declare with greater vehemence

いいつぶす〔言い潰す〕
〈他動〉To confute (one's opponent)

いいつめる〔言い詰める〕
〈他動〉To drive (one) into a corner; to corner (one)

content:
いいつらのかわ〔好い面の皮〕
〈熟語〉Poor fellow!

content.content: 犠牲になった僕ばかりいい面の皮だ
I have been victimized, poor me!

content:
いいとおす〔言い通す〕
〈他動〉To persist in saying

content.content: 彼はどこまでも知らぬ存ぜぬと言い通した
He persisted in saying that he did not know―persisted in denying his knowledge.
彼は自分の説を言い通している
He sticks to his opinion.

content:
いいとし〔好い年〕
〈名〉An advanced age

content.content: 好い年をして結婚でもあるまい
Marriage is out of the question at his age.

content:
いいとり〔好い鳥〕
〈名〉A pigeon

content.content: 好い鳥がかかった
I have caught a pigeon.
ポン引きが好い鳥もがなと上野停車場に見張っている
Sharks are on the lookout for pigeons at Ueno station.
好い鳥を食う奴がいる
Sharks pluck pigeons.

いいなおす〔言い直す〕
〈他動〉To correct oneself

content:
いいなか〔好い仲〕
〈形〉Intimate (with some one)

content.content: 君はどうして彼と好い仲になったか
How came you to be so intimate with him?
二人は好い仲だ
They are lovers.

content:
いいながら〔言い乍ら〕
〈副〉So saying; with this

content.content: と言いながら出て行った
With this, he left the room.

content: 〈接続詞〉Though; granting that

content.content: 酩酊の上とは言いながらあんなことをしては言い訳が立たぬ
Granting that he was drunk, that is no excuse for his behaviour.

いいなぐさめる〔言い慰める〕
〈他動〉To comfort; to console

content:
いいなずけ〔許嫁〕
〈名〉(事)betrothal; affiance:(人)one's betrothed; one's affianced (husband or bride):(許嫁の男)one's fianc?:(許嫁の女)one's fianc?e:(=する) to betroth, affiance (a boy to a girl):(=の) betrothed; affianced

content.content: あの人はいいなずけがある
He has an affianced bride.
あの娘はいいなずけがある
She has an affianced husband.
二人は許嫁だ
They are betrothed to each other.
幼い時からのいいなずけだ
They have been affianced since their infancy.

content:
いいなまり〔言い訛り〕
〈名〉A corruption

content.content: シャツは“shirt”の言いなまりだ
“Shatsu” is a corruption of “shirt”.

いいなまる〔言い訛る〕
〈自動〉To be corrupted (into “shatsu”)

いいなやむ〔言い悩む〕
〈他動〉To hesitate to say

いいならわし〔言い習わし〕
〈名〉
1. (=言葉の習慣)a usage of speech; an idiom
2. (=諺)a common saying; a proverb

content:
いいなりしだい〔言いなり次第〕
〈熟語〉→『

content.content: いいなりほうだい〔言いなり放題〕
彼は人の言いなり次第でどうでもなる人だ
He is wax in your hands―clay in the potter's hands.
彼は細君の言いなり次第だ
He is tied to his wife's apron-strings.

content:
いいなりほうだい〔言いなり放題〕
〈熟語〉To be at one's beck and call; to be led by the nose

content.content: 家の中は彼の言いなり放題になっている
The whole household is at his beck and call―He has the whole household at his beck and call.
教員は校長の言いなり放題だ
The principal leads the teachers by the nose.

content:
いいにくい〔言いにくい〕
〈形〉Delicate; tender; ticklish

content.content: これは言いにくいことだ
This is a delicate matter.
言いにくいことをあっさり言う
to slide over a delicate subject
金銭のことは言いにくい
It is awkward to speak about money matters.
腹にあっても口に出して言いにくい
I have it in my mind, but can not put it into words.
ちと言いにくい事情があって止めるのです
I must leave for reasons of my own.
女は言いにくそうにもじもじしていた
She hesitated to speak.

content:
いいぬけ〔言い抜け〕
〈名〉An evasion; an evasive answer; a shuffling answer; an excuse; a dodge; a put-off; an elusion; a subterfuge; a quibble:(=る)to evade a question; to give an evasive answer; to give a shuffling answer; to excuse oneself; to dodge; to quibble; to shuffle; to palter; to shift and prevaricate; to equivocate

content.content: こう言うと言い抜けとしか聞こえない
It sounds like an evasion.
彼は言い抜けがうまい
He is clever at subterfuges―an artful dodger.
言い抜けに困った
I was at a loss for an excuse.
彼は頓智で危ないところを言い抜けた
He dodged himself out of a compromising position by his wit.
裸のところを廊下で見つかって風呂場はどこだと言い抜けた
Caught naked in the passage, he dodged himself out of the difficulty by asking where the bath-room was.
彼に何を尋ねても何とか言い抜ける
Ask him any question you will, and he will excuse himself somehow or other―shift and prevaricate.

content:
いいね〔言い値〕
〈名〉The price asked

content.content: 言い値に買おう
I will take it at your own price―take it on your own terms―Name your price, and you shall have it.
僕は何でも言い値に買う
I always give the price asked for anything.
あの人は決して言い値に買わない
He never gives the price asked for anything.

content:
いいのがれる〔言い遁れる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: いいぬけ〔言い抜け〕

content:
いいのこす〔言い残す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=言い置く)to leave word

content.content: 彼は何か言いのこして行かないか
Hasn't he left any message for me?

content: 2. (=言い落とす)to leave (anything) unsaid; to omit to say; to forget to say

content.content: 言い残したことは無い
I have left nothing unsaid―said everything.

content:
いいはなつ〔言い放つ〕
〈他動〉To declare; to commit oneself (to a line of conduct)

content.content: 彼は断然辞職すると言い放った
He declared that he would resign at once.
首相は増税は断然せぬと言い放った
The Premier committed himself to non-increment of taxation.

content:
いいはやす〔言い囃す〕
〈他動〉To speak highly of (one); be extol (one) to the skies; to sing one's praises; to chant one's praises

content.content: 世間では彼のことをしきりに言いはやしている
People are loud in his praises―warm in his praises.

content:
いいはる〔言い張る〕
〈他動〉To insist on (knowing); to persist in saying (something); to assert, protest (one's innocence); to declare (that it is so); to maintain (that it is so); to stand to it (that it is so); to have it (that it is so)

content.content: 彼はそうだと言い張っている
He maintains that it is so―He declares that it is so―He stands to it that it is so―He will have it that it is so―He asserts the fact.
僕はぜひそのわけを聞きたいと言い張った
I insisted on knowing the reason.
彼はどこまでも知らぬ知らぬと言い張った
He persisted in saying that he did not know―persisted in denying his knowledge.
医者は患者に薬を飲めと言い張った
The doctor insisted on his patient taking the medicine.
患者はどうしても薬を飲まぬと言い張った
The patient persisted in saying that he would not take it―persisted in refusing to take it.
彼は身に覚えは無いと言い張っている(身の潔白を主張している)
He declares that he is innocent―He asserts his innocence―protests his innocence.
敵はどうしても降参せぬと言い張った
The enemy declared that he would not surrender―positively refused to surrender.
彼は酒精に滋養があると言い張って聴かぬ
He will have it that alcohol is a food.

content:
いいひと〔好い人〕
〈名〉A sweetheart:(男なら)a lover:(女なら)a mistress

content.content: 好い人がある
He has a sweetheart―He walks out with a girl.
あの子は好い人がある
She has a sweetheart―She has a lover―She walks out with a man.
好い人ができたらしい
There is somebody in the wind.

content:
いいひらき〔言い開き〕
〈名〉Vindication; justification; exculpation; explanation; ?claircissement:(=する) to clear oneself (of the charge); to exculpate oneself (from the charge); to justify oneself; to right oneself; to explain oneself; to vindicate one's character; to disprove (a charge)

content.content: 名誉に関することだから言い開きをしておかねばならぬ
The matter concerns my honour, so I must clear myself―justify myself―vindicate my character.
君はそんなことをして言い開きができるか
Can you justify yourself for such conduct?―justify such conduct?
ここに彼が言い開きのできない証拠がある
Here is evidence which he can not disprove.
あやしい行動の言い開きをする
to come to an ?claircissement

content:
いいふくめる〔言い含める〕
〈他動〉To give (one) to understand; to instruct; to give (one) instructions

content.content: 彼にもうこの上世話になるつもりではいけないと言い含めた
I gave him to understand that he must not expect any more help.
使いの者によく言い含めてやったから間違うはずは無い
I give the messenger full instructions, so that it is impossible that he can have mistaken my meaning.

content:
いいふせる〔言い伏せる〕
〈他動〉To silence, confute (an opponent)

content.content: 議論をして相手を言い伏せた
I silenced my opponent in argument.

content:
いいふらす〔言いふらす〕
〈他動〉To circulate (a rumour); to set (a rumour) afloat; to spread (a rumour) abroad; to blaze (the news); to blazon (the news) abroad; to noise (a fact) abroad; to give out (a false statement)

content.content: 僕のことを有ること無いこと言いふらした者がある
Some one has spread false reports about me.
彼が死んだように言い触らした
It was given out that he was dead.

content:
いいぶり〔言い振り〕
〈名〉A manner of speaking; expression; delivery

content.content: 彼の物の言い振りはいかにもおかしい
He certainly has a funny manner of speaking.

content:
いいぶん〔言い分〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: もうしぶん〔申分〕

いいまえ〔言い前〕
〈名〉A pretence; a pretext

いいまかす〔言い負かす〕
〈他動〉To confute (an opponent)

content:
いいまぎらす〔言い紛らす〕
〈自他動〉To equivocate; to prevaricate; to quibble; to shuffle; to palter; to dodge; to shift and prevaricate

content.content: 理を非に言いまぎらす
to talk right into wrong

いいまくる〔言い捲くる〕
〈他動〉To talk (one) down

content:
いいまわし〔言い廻し〕
〈名〉
1. (=言い廻した言葉)a turn of expression

content.content: これはうまい言いまわしだ
This is a happy turn of expression―a happy expression―a felicitous expression.
思想は好いが言いまわしが拙だ
The thought is good, but ill expressed.

content: 2. (=言い廻す力)a command of language

content.content: 彼は言いまわしが巧みだ
He has a good command of language.
彼の英語は言いまわしが自在だ
He has a perfect command of English.
僕は言いまわしが下手だ
I have no command of language―I am a poor speaker.

content:
いいまわす〔言い廻す〕
〈他動〉To express

content.content: うまく言いまわしたものだ
It is happily expressed―well put.

content:
いいもの〔好い物〕
〈名〉A good thing

content.content: 好い物は得難い
Good things are hard to get―“The best fish swim near the bottom.”

content:
いいもらす〔言いもらす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=漏らす)to disclose, divulge, reveal (a secret)

content.content: 一言半句も言い漏らすな
Do not breathe a syllable of it (to any one).

content: 2. (=言い落とす)to omit to say; to forget to say

content.content: 言い漏らしたことがある
There is one thing I have omitted to mention.

いいやぶる〔言い破る〕
〈他動〉To refute, confute (the opponent's position)

content:
いいよう〔言い様〕
〈名〉A way of saying; a manner of speaking

content.content: もう少し何とか言いようがありそうなものだ
He might have put it more mildly.
彼女は田舎育ちで物の言いようも知らない
She is country-bred, and does not know how to speak properly.
何とも言いようの無いほど好い景色だ
The scenery is beautiful beyond description―The beauty of scenery defies description―baffles description―beggars description.
物も言いようで角が立つ
“Smooth words make smooth ways.”

いいよる〔言い寄る〕
〈他動〉(=婦人に言い寄る)To court, pay court to, pay one's addresses to, make advances to (a lady)

content:
いいわけ〔言い訳〕
〈名〉An excuse; an exculpation; justification; a warrant; a plea; a pretext; an explanation; an apology:(=する) to make an excuse; to excuse oneself; to exculpate oneself; to justify oneself; to explain oneself; to plead (ignorance); to apologize (for a fault); to warrant (violence, etc.)

content.content: どう言い訳をしようか
How shall I excuse myself?―justify myself?
言い訳をしても駄目だ
It is no use trying to excuse yourself.
そんなことをしては言い訳が立たぬ
Such conduct is inexcusable―unjustifiable―Such conduct admits of no excuse―permits of no excuse―allows of no excuse―You have no warrant for what you do.
酩酊の上とは言いながらあんなことをしては言い訳が立たぬ
Granting that he was drunk, that is no excuse for his behaviour.
こんな失錯をしては言い訳が立たない
I can not excuse myself for my blunder―justify my blunder.
そんな失錯をして言い訳が立つか
Can you excuse yourself for committing such a blunder?―justify such a blunder?
病気だと言えば言い訳が立つ
My illness will serve as an excuse.
どんな事情があっても暴行の言い訳にはならぬ
No circumstances can justify violence―warrant violence.
彼は言い訳に病気だと言った
He said he was ill by way of excuse―He pleaded illness.
彼は(そんな法律のあることを)知らなかったと言い訳をしている
He pleads ignorance.
落第したら父に何と言って言い訳をしようか
What shall I say to my father if I should fail?
僕は言い訳が下手だ
I am ill at making excuses.
言い訳の上手な者に限って何にも役に立たぬ
Those who are good at making excuses, are good for nothing else.
下手な言い訳をする
to make a lame excuse
人に迷惑をかけておいて苦しい言い訳だ
That is a sorry excuse for inconveniencing others.
借金の言い訳をする
to apologize for non-payment―put off a dun
細君は借金の言い訳が上手だ
His wife shows tact in putting off duns.

content:
いいわたし〔言い渡し〕
〈名〉A sentence; a judgment

content.content: 裁判の言い渡しをする
to pass a sentence―pronounce judgment―on a prisoner
死刑の言い渡し
the sentence of death
死刑の言い渡しを受ける
to be condemned to death
死刑の言い渡しを受けた罪人
a criminal under sentence of death―a condemned criminal
懲役の言い渡しを受ける
to be sentenced to penal servitude

content:
いいわたす〔言い渡す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=宣告する)to sentence (one to penal servitude); to condemn (one to death); to pass (a sentence); to pronounce (judgment)

content.content: 三年の懲役に処する旨言い渡された
He was sentenced to three years' penal servitude.
死刑を言い渡された
He was condemned to death.
判決を言い渡す
to pass a sentence―pronounce judgment―on a prisoner
無罪を言い渡す
to acquit the prisoner (of the charge)
無罪を言い渡された
He was acquitted.

content: 2. (=命ずる)to order

content.content: 退校を言い渡された
He was ordered to leave school―expelled from school.

content: 3. (=告げる)to tell

content.content: 願いの趣き聞き届け難しと言い渡された
I was given to understand that my petition could not be granted.

content:
いいん〔委員〕
〈名〉(団体)a committee:(一人)a committee-man; a member of the committee:(政府委員)a commission; a board:(の一人)a commissioner; a delegate

content.content: 僕は委員だ
I am on the committee―a member of the committee.
議案を委員に付託した
The bill was referred to the committee.
委員を設ける
to appoint a committee
委員を設けて調査さした
A committee was appointed to investigate the matter.
この問題について委員会を開いている
A committee is sitting on the question.
委員会
a meeting of the committee
委員会を開く
The committee sits.
全院委員となる
The whole House resolves itself into a committee.
全院委員会
a committee of the whole House
委員長
the chairman of the committee
常置委員
the standing committee
調査委員
a committee of inquiry―an investigation committee
政府委員
a government delegate―a government commissioner
学務委員
the school board
衛生委員
the board of health
文官試験委員
the civil service commission―(の一人)―a civil service commissioner
回航委員
the officers charged with bringing out a ship

いいん〔医員〕
〈名〉(総体)the medical staff:(一人)a medical assistant; an assistant physician

content:
いいん〔医院〕
〈名〉(A medical practitioner's) office

content.content: 佐藤医院
Dr. Sato's office.

content:
いう〔云う、言う〕
〈他動〉
1. To say; to state; to remark; to observe

content.content: 人の言うこと
what one says―one's statement
なるほど君の言う通りだ
What you say, is true―I admit the truth of your statement―I admit the fact.
誰がそう言ったか
Who said so?―Who is responsible for the statement?
時と場所が判然と言ってない
The exact time and place are not stated.
一概にそうは言われぬ
The statement is too sweeping.
何心無く言う
to make a casual remark
皮肉を言う
to make cynical remarks
厭味を言う
to make disagreeable remarks
因みに言う
Let me remark in passing―By the way,...
彼は病気だと言うことだ
He is said to be ill―reported to be ill.
否とか応とか言う
to say yes or no―reply in the affirmative or negative
誰が行くと言ったか
Who said go?
僕は白いと言わない
I did not say white.
彼はどこへ行くと言ったか
Where did he say he was going?
彼はどこへ行くとか言ったか
Did he say where he was going?
君がそう言うのももっともだ
You may well say that―You have good reason to say so.
僕の口からそう言っちゃおかしいが好い子だ
She is a good girl, though I say it who should not.
彼の言いそうなことだ
It is just like him to say so―The remark is characteristic of the man.
彼は控えめに言っても非常な節倹家だ
He is extremely frugal, to say the least of it.
彼は極端な節倹家で吝嗇と言ってもよいくらいだ
He is extremely frugal, not to say a miser―I might almost say a miser.
言うに及ばず、言うには及ぶ
I need not say―It is needless to say―It goes without saying.
(戦争になるかに対して)何とも言えぬ
There is no saying what may happen.
彼は僕のことをそんな悪口を言ったか
Did he say such things of me?
世間では僕のことをどう言っているか
What do people say of me?
世間では彼を評して狂人だと言っている
People say of him that he is mad.
俺が友人に不義理なことをしたと人に言わせぬ
It shall never be said of me that I deserted a friend in need.
君は何か言いたいことがあるか
Have you anything to say?―any remarks to make?
彼に言いたいことを言わしてやれ
Let him say his say!―have his say!
言わぬが花
Better leave it unsaid―“The less said, the better”―“The least said, the soonest mended.”
言わずもがな
It should be left unsaid.
言うべくして行い難し
“Easier said than done.”
日本はアジア唯一の独立国なりと言うも可なり
One may safely say―It may be safely said―that Japan is the only independent state in Asia.
(何々と)言うもあえて過言にあらず
It is not too much to say―no exaggeration to say―that...
二人でありとあらゆることを言い尽した
They have said everything―left nothing unsaid―between them.
年寄りの言うことは聴くものだ
You should listen to an old man―What an old man says, is generally true.

content: 2. ［注意］「人の言うこと」(what one says)を略して代名詞のみを用いる動詞五あり。―to hear (one), listen to (one), understand (one), believe (one), obey (one)

content.content: 今度だけ僕の言うことを聴いてくれ
Hear me for this time!―Listen to me for this once!
僕の言うことをしまいまで聴いてくれ給え
Hear me out!
老人の言うことは聴くものだ
An old man should be heard.
僕の言うことがわかったか
Do you understand me?
僕は君の言うことを信ぜん
I do not believe you.
俺の言うことを聴け(命に従え)
Obey me!
女が男の言うことを聴く
A woman gives herself to a man.

content: 3. (=物言う)to speak

content.content: 子どもがもうものを言う
The child speaks already.
彼はめったに僕にものを言わない
He seldom speaks to me.
彼は君のことを僕に言った
He spoke to me about you.
あきれてものが言えない
I can not speak for astonishment―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Astonishment deprives me of my power of speech.
本当のことを言う
to speak the truth
思うことを真直に言う
to speak one's mind
遠慮無く言う、忌憚無く言う
to speak without reserve―speak freely
控え目に言う
to speak within bounds―speak within compass―draw it mild
はっきり言う
to speak definitely
彼はありとあらゆる悪口を言い尽した
He has left no calumny unspoken.
言わぬは言うに勝る
Silence is better than speech―Speech is silvern, silence is golden.
「非凡の凡人」ということを言う人がある
Some speak of “a rare mediocrity.”
(彼は貧乏ではないが)財産というほどのものは無い
He has no property to speak of―no property worth mentioning.
(家は好い家だが)庭というほどの庭が無い
But there is no garden to speak of―no garden worth mentioning.
皆君のことを好く言っている
Everybody speaks well of you.
蔭で人のことを悪く言うものでない
You should not speak ill of a man behind his back.
彼は学問ができると言われている
He is spoken of as a good scholar.
ものが言えなかった
I could not speak―I was tongue-tied.

content: 4. (=話す)to talk

content.content: 彼は何でも知っていそうなことを言う
He talks as if he knew everything.
あの人の言うことを聞くと何でも知っていそうだ
To hear him talk, one would think he knew everything.
彼は死んでしまうなどと言っている
He talks of dying.
辞職するなどと言っている
He talks of resigning.
独り言を言う
to talk to oneself
寝言を言う
to talk in one's sleep
わけのわからぬことを言う
He talks nonsense.
そう言えば話がわかる
Now you are talking sense.
ばか言うな、ばか言え
Don't talk nonsense!―Nonsense!―Stuff and nonsense!
馬と言えば今度買った馬を見たか
Talking of horses, have you seen my new one?
小説と言えばこの小説を読んだか
Talking of novels, have you read this one?
ひと口にたばこくらいと言うが一年に積ればなかなかばかにならぬ
One may talk of tobacco as if it were a trifle, but it will come up to a considerable expense in a year.

content: 5. (=告げる、聞かせる)to tell

content.content: 人に言うな
Don't tell any one!
彼に来いと言え
Tell him to come.
あまり飲むなと言え
Tell him not to drink too much.
僕の言う通りにしなさい
Do as I tell you!
彼は君の言う通りだ
He is all you tell me.
実を言う、嘘を言う
to tell the truth―tell a lie
実を言えば君の計画はあまり感心しない
To tell the truth, I don't care much for your project.
君に言うことがある
I tell you what.
だから言わないこっちゃない
Why, I told you so.
後は言わずと知れたこと
The rest needs no telling.

content: 6. (=挙げる)to mention

content.content: 人の名を言う
to mention names
名を言うな
Don't mention names!
時と場所が判然と言ってない
The exact time and place are not mentioned.
(彼は貧乏じゃないが)財産というほどのものは無い
He has no property worth mentioning―no property to speak of.
(家は好い家だが)庭というほどの庭が無い
There is no garden worth mentioning―no garden to speak of.
「自由」といえば直ちに米国を連想する
One is instantly reminded of America when “liberty” is mentioned.
言うに足る者は少ない
Few are worth mentioning―worthy of mention.

content: 7. (=何を何と言う、称す、評す)to name; to call; to speak of (a man as something); to describe (a man as something); to represent (it as something)

content.content: 君は Smith という人を知っているか
Do you know a Mr. Smith?
私は田中一郎という者です
I am one Ichiro Tanaka.
清水という港に着いた
We arrived at a port called Shimizu―known as Shimizu.
この花を英語で何というか
What do you call this flower in English?
彼は豪傑とはいえるが聖人とはいえぬ
You may say that he is a great man, but you can not say that he is a good man―You may call him a great man, but you can not call him a good man.
世人は彼を狂人だという
People say that he is mad―People call him mad.
彼は楠木正成の末孫だといっている
He says he is descendant from Kusunoki Masashige―He calls himself a descended of Kusunoki Masashige.
そんなことをすると狂人だといわれる
If you do such a thing you will be called a mad man.
彼は僕のことを恩人だと言った
He said I was his benefactor―He called me his benefactor―He styled me his benefactor.
世人は彼を豪傑だと言う(評す)
People say he is a hero―People describe him as a hero.
世間では彼は学問ができると言っている(評判する)
People say that he is a good scholar―People speak of him as a good scholar.
彼女は美人だと言われてたいそう悦んだ
She felt herself highly flattered on hearing herself described as a beauty.
あの人はたいそう金持ちのように言われている
He is said to be very rich―He is represented as being very rich.
金額を判然と言え
Name the exact sum.
値段をいくらならいくらと言えば言い値に買ってやる
Name your price, and it shall be paid.

content: 8. (=如何に言う、言い表す)to express; to put it

content.content: どう言えばよいだろう
How shall I say it?―express it?―put it?
そのことを英語でどう言うか
How do you say it in English?―express it in English?―put it in English?
具体的に言う
to express it in a concrete form―put it in a concrete form
具体的に言わないと人にわからない
People will not understand, unless you put it in a more palpable form.
君の言い方は正しい
You express yourself correctly.
彼はこう言った
He said―He expressed himself as follows:―
彼は満足したと言っている
He says he is satisfied―He has expressed himself satisfied―expressed his satisfaction.
彼は遺憾だと言っている
He says he is sorry―He has expressed his regret.
礼を言う
to express one's thanks―offer one's thanks―tender one's thanks

content: 9. (=何のことを言う、指す)to mean; to allude to

content.content: 君は誰のことを言うのか
Whom do you mean?―Whom do you allude to?
それはどういうことか
What does that mean?―What do you mean by that?―What is meant by that?

content: 10. (=何々すると言う、約束する)to promise

content.content: 彼はこれからもっと勉強すると言っている
He says he will work harder in future―He promises to work harder in future.
彼は間違い無く金を返すと言った
He said he would pay me without fail―He promised to pay me without fail.

content: 11. (=どうしてやろうと言う、提供する)to offer

content.content: 伯(叔)父が学資を仕送ってくれると言います
My uncle says he will supply me with my school-expenses―My uncle offers to pay my school-expenses.
彼はご入用だけご用立しようと言った
He said he would―offered to―place at my disposal any sum I might need.

content: 12. (=承諾する)to consent

content.content: 彼は仕事を引受けると言った
He says he will undertake the work―He has consented to undertake the work.

content: 13. (=いやだと言う、拒絶する)to refuse

content.content: 娘はその人のところへお嫁に行くのはいやだと言う
She says she will not marry him―She refuses to marry him.

content: 14. (=何々するぞと言う、脅す)to threaten

content.content: 彼は貴様を殺してしまうぞと言った
He said he would kill me―He threatened to kill me―He threatened me with death.

content: 15. (=ぜひ何々すると言う、どこまでも何々だと言う、主張する)to assert; to insist upon (doing something); to persist in saying

content.content: 彼はぜひそのわけを聞きたいと言った
He said he must positively know my reason―He insisted upon knowing my reason.
僕はぜひ否応の返答を聞きたいと言った
I said I must have his answer, yes or no―I insisted upon having his answer, yes or no.
彼はどこまでも自分の言うことが本当だと言っている
He says his statement is true―He strongly asserts his statement to be true―He asserts the truth of his statement.
彼はその説が本当でないと言っている
He says the statement is not true―He denies the statement to be true―He denies the truth of the statement.
彼は身に覚えが無いと言っている
He says he is innocent―He asserts himself to be innocent―He asserts his innocence.
彼はどこまでも知らぬ存ぜぬと言っている
He persists in saying that he does not know―persists in denying his knowledge.

content: 16. (=誓ってそうだと言う、断言する)to swear; to affirm

content.content: 彼は誓ってそうだと言っている
He swears it is true―He solemnly affirms it to be true―He affirms its truth.

content: 17. (=なるほどそうだと言う、認める)to admit; to acknowledge

content.content: 彼はなるほど君の言う通りだと言った
He said what I said was true―He admitted my statement to be true―He admitted the truth of my statement―He admitted the fact.
彼は自分が間違っていると言った
He said he was mistaken―He acknowledged himself to be mistaken―He acknowledged his error.
彼は自分が悪かったと言って謝まった
He said he was in fault―He acknowledged himself to be in fault―He acknowledged his fault.
彼は尋常に参ったと言って降参した
He said he was fairly beaten―He acknowledged himself to be fairly beaten―He acknowledged his defeat.
彼は君の方が偉いと言った
He said I was his superior―He acknowledged me as his superior―He acknowledged my superiority.

content: 18. (=自白する)to own

content.content: 彼はばかなことをしたと言っている
He says he has been foolish―He owns himself to have been foolish―He owns his past folly.

content: 19. (=白状する)to confess

content.content: 彼は身に覚えがあると言う
He says he is guilty―He has confessed himself to be guilty―He has confessed his guilt.
身に覚えが無いと言う
He says he is not guilty―He denies himself to be guilty―He denies his guilt―He asserts his innocence.

content: 20. (=公言する)to profess; to avow

content.content: 彼は専門は医者だと言っている
He says he is a physician by profession―He professes himself to be a physician―He professes medicine.
彼はキリスト教信者だと言っている
He says he is a Christian―He professes himself to be a Christian―He is a professed Christian.
彼はその論文は自分が書いたと言っている
He says he was written the article―He avows himself to be the author of the article―He avows the authorship.

content: 21. (=言明する)to declare

content.content: 彼はその説は虚偽だと言っている
He says the statement is false―He declares the statement to be false.

content: 22. (=診断する、鑑定する)to pronounce

content.content: 医者は僕の病気は軽いと言った
The doctor said my illness was a slight one―He pronounced my illness to be a slight one.
玉屋に見せるとダイヤは本物だと言った
The jeweller said the diamond was genuine―He pronounced it genuine.

content: 23. (=何々しても宜しいと言う、許可する)to permit

content.content: 父は芝居へ行ってよろしいと言いました
My father said I might go to the play―He permitted me to go to the play.

content: 24. (=何々してはいかんと言う、禁ずる)to forbid

content.content: 父は酒を飲んではいかんと言います
My father says I must not drink―He has forbidden me to drink.

content: 25. (=不平を言う、訴える)to complain

content.content: 彼は不平ばかり言っている
He does nothing but complain.
子どもは頭痛がすると言う
The child complains of a headache.
皆暑い暑いと言っている
They complain of the heat.
寒い寒いと言っている
They complain of the cold.
重い重いと言っている
They complain of the weight.
苦しい苦しいと言っている
They complain of the strain.

content: 26. (=言いかける)to accuse (one of a crime); to charge (one with a crime)

content.content: 彼は米探だと言われている
He is said to be a spy―accused of being a spy.
わいろを取ると言われた
He was accused of corruption―charged with corruption.
女は男が不実だと言った
She accused him of infidelity―charged him with infidelity―reproached him with infidelity.

content:
27. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君の言う通り
You are right.
君の言うことは間違っている
You are wrong.
暗に言う
to hint a fact
露骨に言えば詐欺だ
To be plain with you, it is fraud.
正直に言えばばかだ
To be honest with you, he is a fool.
公平に言えば悪い人間じゃない
To do him justice, he is not a bad man.
悪く言えば詐欺だ
Give it a hard name, and it is fraud.
ふるえ声で言う
to falter out something
どもって言う
to stammer out something
言うべからざることを言う
to tread on forbidden ground
口にまかして言いたいことを言う
to give a loose to one's tongue
ばかにものを言うと日が暮れる
Words are wasted on a fool.
お前のようなばかにはものを言わぬ
I will not waste words on you.
言いながら実行する
to suit the action to the word
言いもせぬことを言ったように言う
He puts in my mouth words I never used.
公園といえば公園だが
It is a park, if you will, but...
公園というほどの公園じゃない
It is not much of a park.
ホテルというほどのホテルじゃない
It is not much of a hotel.
あの人の言うことは当てにならぬ
He is not to be relied upon.
僕の言うことは大丈夫本当だ
You may depend upon it.
針ほどのことを棒ほどに言う
to make a mountain of a mole-hill
言わしておけば方図が無い
No more of your impertinence!―None of your sauce!
知ってはいるけれども誰にも言わずにおいた
I kept the matter to myself.
彼は得手勝手ばかり言う
He will have everything his own way.
彼に言わせると叩き上げられたのだ
He was, to use his own words, “licked into shape.”
僕がいやと言うのに無理に飲ました
They forced me to drink against my will.
君がそう言うとおかしい
It sounds strange from your lips.
その人の名は言わぬ
He shall be nameless.
彼は今行くと言って寄越した
He has sent me word that he is coming.
右といえば左と言う
He is perverse.
女はああ言えばこう言う
A woman will have the last word.
言っても返らぬこと
It is beyond recall―past recall.
何百という船が常に港に停泊している
Hundreds of ships are always at anchor in the harbour.
幾千人という人が毎日参詣する
Thousands of people daily worship at this shrine.
彼は三井という金穴がある
He has a backer in the Mitsuis.
僕は知事という良友を得た
I have found a friend in the governor.
学校は田中という良教師を失った
The school has lost a good teacher in Mr. Tanaka.
アッと言わせる
to take away one's breath
ギュウギュウ言わせる
to give one fits
皆寄ってたかって頭と言わず背中と言わず乱打した
They crowded about him and pommeled him, head and back.
君は無理を言う
You are unreasonable.
彼は口を開くとぶちこわしを言う
He never opens his mouth but he puts his foot in it.
書いた物がものを言います
I have it in black and white.
おぶうといえば抱かると言う
“Give him an inch, and he will take an ell.”
四の五の言う
to grumble
小言を言う
I blow him up―give him a piece of my mind.
俗に言う気が利かないのだ
He has, in common parlance, no head.
銀行では筆跡が違うと言って支払いを拒絶した
The bank refused payment on the ground that the handwriting was different.
天に口無し人をもって言わしむ
The voice of the people is the voice of God.
ひと口に言えば
in a word
そう言えば(僕も世間知らずだ)
Nor do I, for that matter.
彼の助かったのは奇蹟と言わざるを得ぬ
His escape is nothing short of a miracle―a positive miracle.
目も口ほどにものを言う
The eye is more eloquent than the tongue.
つかない事を言うようだが
By the bye,...
君は偉いということさ
You are a great man, that's all.
何を言っているものやら
I can't comprehend what he is driving at.
学問といい人物といい申し分の無い人だ
In scholarship and character, he leaves nothing to be desired.
しゃれを言う
to be witty
冗談を言う
to be funny―jest―joke―crack a joke
彼は自分のことばかり言っている
He is full of himself.
つけつけ言う
to din in one's ears
そう言われるのが何より辛い
I shall never hear the end of the matter.
(自分の欠点などを)言われぬ先に言う
to take the wind out of one's sail
彼はものを言うと損が行くといったようなふうだ
He has not a word to throw at a dog.
今にするなと言ってもするようになる
He will do it soon enough.
誰言うとなく彼は発狂したという噂が立った
It began to be rumoured that he was mad.
何を言っても彼は偉い
He is a great man, after all.

content:
いう〔云う、言う〕
〈他動〉
1. To say; to state; to remark; to observe

content.content: 人の言うこと
what one says―one's statement
なるほど君の言う通りだ
What you say, is true―I admit the truth of your statement―I admit the fact.
誰がそう言ったか
Who said so?―Who is responsible for the statement?
時と場所が判然と言ってない
The exact time and place are not stated.
一概にそうは言われぬ
The statement is too sweeping.
何心無く言う
to make a casual remark
皮肉を言う
to make cynical remarks
厭味を言う
to make disagreeable remarks
因みに言う
Let me remark in passing―By the way,...
彼は病気だと言うことだ
He is said to be ill―reported to be ill.
否とか応とか言う
to say yes or no―reply in the affirmative or negative
誰が行くと言ったか
Who said go?
僕は白いと言わない
I did not say white.
彼はどこへ行くと言ったか
Where did he say he was going?
彼はどこへ行くとか言ったか
Did he say where he was going?
君がそう言うのももっともだ
You may well say that―You have good reason to say so.
僕の口からそう言っちゃおかしいが好い子だ
She is a good girl, though I say it who should not.
彼の言いそうなことだ
It is just like him to say so―The remark is characteristic of the man.
彼は控えめに言っても非常な節倹家だ
He is extremely frugal, to say the least of it.
彼は極端な節倹家で吝嗇と言ってもよいくらいだ
He is extremely frugal, not to say a miser―I might almost say a miser.
言うに及ばず、言うには及ぶ
I need not say―It is needless to say―It goes without saying.
(戦争になるかに対して)何とも言えぬ
There is no saying what may happen.
彼は僕のことをそんな悪口を言ったか
Did he say such things of me?
世間では僕のことをどう言っているか
What do people say of me?
世間では彼を評して狂人だと言っている
People say of him that he is mad.
俺が友人に不義理なことをしたと人に言わせぬ
It shall never be said of me that I deserted a friend in need.
君は何か言いたいことがあるか
Have you anything to say?―any remarks to make?
彼に言いたいことを言わしてやれ
Let him say his say!―have his say!
言わぬが花
Better leave it unsaid―“The less said, the better”―“The least said, the soonest mended.”
言わずもがな
It should be left unsaid.
言うべくして行い難し
“Easier said than done.”
日本はアジア唯一の独立国なりと言うも可なり
One may safely say―It may be safely said―that Japan is the only independent state in Asia.
(何々と)言うもあえて過言にあらず
It is not too much to say―no exaggeration to say―that...
二人でありとあらゆることを言い尽した
They have said everything―left nothing unsaid―between them.
年寄りの言うことは聴くものだ
You should listen to an old man―What an old man says, is generally true.

content: 2. ［注意］「人の言うこと」(what one says)を略して代名詞のみを用いる動詞五あり。―to hear (one), listen to (one), understand (one), believe (one), obey (one)

content.content: 今度だけ僕の言うことを聴いてくれ
Hear me for this time!―Listen to me for this once!
僕の言うことをしまいまで聴いてくれ給え
Hear me out!
老人の言うことは聴くものだ
An old man should be heard.
僕の言うことがわかったか
Do you understand me?
僕は君の言うことを信ぜん
I do not believe you.
俺の言うことを聴け(命に従え)
Obey me!
女が男の言うことを聴く
A woman gives herself to a man.

content: 3. (=物言う)to speak

content.content: 子どもがもうものを言う
The child speaks already.
彼はめったに僕にものを言わない
He seldom speaks to me.
彼は君のことを僕に言った
He spoke to me about you.
あきれてものが言えない
I can not speak for astonishment―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Astonishment deprives me of my power of speech.
本当のことを言う
to speak the truth
思うことを真直に言う
to speak one's mind
遠慮無く言う、忌憚無く言う
to speak without reserve―speak freely
控え目に言う
to speak within bounds―speak within compass―draw it mild
はっきり言う
to speak definitely
彼はありとあらゆる悪口を言い尽した
He has left no calumny unspoken.
言わぬは言うに勝る
Silence is better than speech―Speech is silvern, silence is golden.
「非凡の凡人」ということを言う人がある
Some speak of “a rare mediocrity.”
(彼は貧乏ではないが)財産というほどのものは無い
He has no property to speak of―no property worth mentioning.
(家は好い家だが)庭というほどの庭が無い
But there is no garden to speak of―no garden worth mentioning.
皆君のことを好く言っている
Everybody speaks well of you.
蔭で人のことを悪く言うものでない
You should not speak ill of a man behind his back.
彼は学問ができると言われている
He is spoken of as a good scholar.
ものが言えなかった
I could not speak―I was tongue-tied.

content: 4. (=話す)to talk

content.content: 彼は何でも知っていそうなことを言う
He talks as if he knew everything.
あの人の言うことを聞くと何でも知っていそうだ
To hear him talk, one would think he knew everything.
彼は死んでしまうなどと言っている
He talks of dying.
辞職するなどと言っている
He talks of resigning.
独り言を言う
to talk to oneself
寝言を言う
to talk in one's sleep
わけのわからぬことを言う
He talks nonsense.
そう言えば話がわかる
Now you are talking sense.
ばか言うな、ばか言え
Don't talk nonsense!―Nonsense!―Stuff and nonsense!
馬と言えば今度買った馬を見たか
Talking of horses, have you seen my new one?
小説と言えばこの小説を読んだか
Talking of novels, have you read this one?
ひと口にたばこくらいと言うが一年に積ればなかなかばかにならぬ
One may talk of tobacco as if it were a trifle, but it will come up to a considerable expense in a year.

content: 5. (=告げる、聞かせる)to tell

content.content: 人に言うな
Don't tell any one!
彼に来いと言え
Tell him to come.
あまり飲むなと言え
Tell him not to drink too much.
僕の言う通りにしなさい
Do as I tell you!
彼は君の言う通りだ
He is all you tell me.
実を言う、嘘を言う
to tell the truth―tell a lie
実を言えば君の計画はあまり感心しない
To tell the truth, I don't care much for your project.
君に言うことがある
I tell you what.
だから言わないこっちゃない
Why, I told you so.
後は言わずと知れたこと
The rest needs no telling.

content: 6. (=挙げる)to mention

content.content: 人の名を言う
to mention names
名を言うな
Don't mention names!
時と場所が判然と言ってない
The exact time and place are not mentioned.
(彼は貧乏じゃないが)財産というほどのものは無い
He has no property worth mentioning―no property to speak of.
(家は好い家だが)庭というほどの庭が無い
There is no garden worth mentioning―no garden to speak of.
「自由」といえば直ちに米国を連想する
One is instantly reminded of America when “liberty” is mentioned.
言うに足る者は少ない
Few are worth mentioning―worthy of mention.

content: 7. (=何を何と言う、称す、評す)to name; to call; to speak of (a man as something); to describe (a man as something); to represent (it as something)

content.content: 君は Smith という人を知っているか
Do you know a Mr. Smith?
私は田中一郎という者です
I am one Ichiro Tanaka.
清水という港に着いた
We arrived at a port called Shimizu―known as Shimizu.
この花を英語で何というか
What do you call this flower in English?
彼は豪傑とはいえるが聖人とはいえぬ
You may say that he is a great man, but you can not say that he is a good man―You may call him a great man, but you can not call him a good man.
世人は彼を狂人だという
People say that he is mad―People call him mad.
彼は楠木正成の末孫だといっている
He says he is descendant from Kusunoki Masashige―He calls himself a descended of Kusunoki Masashige.
そんなことをすると狂人だといわれる
If you do such a thing you will be called a mad man.
彼は僕のことを恩人だと言った
He said I was his benefactor―He called me his benefactor―He styled me his benefactor.
世人は彼を豪傑だと言う(評す)
People say he is a hero―People describe him as a hero.
世間では彼は学問ができると言っている(評判する)
People say that he is a good scholar―People speak of him as a good scholar.
彼女は美人だと言われてたいそう悦んだ
She felt herself highly flattered on hearing herself described as a beauty.
あの人はたいそう金持ちのように言われている
He is said to be very rich―He is represented as being very rich.
金額を判然と言え
Name the exact sum.
値段をいくらならいくらと言えば言い値に買ってやる
Name your price, and it shall be paid.

content: 8. (=如何に言う、言い表す)to express; to put it

content.content: どう言えばよいだろう
How shall I say it?―express it?―put it?
そのことを英語でどう言うか
How do you say it in English?―express it in English?―put it in English?
具体的に言う
to express it in a concrete form―put it in a concrete form
具体的に言わないと人にわからない
People will not understand, unless you put it in a more palpable form.
君の言い方は正しい
You express yourself correctly.
彼はこう言った
He said―He expressed himself as follows:―
彼は満足したと言っている
He says he is satisfied―He has expressed himself satisfied―expressed his satisfaction.
彼は遺憾だと言っている
He says he is sorry―He has expressed his regret.
礼を言う
to express one's thanks―offer one's thanks―tender one's thanks

content: 9. (=何のことを言う、指す)to mean; to allude to

content.content: 君は誰のことを言うのか
Whom do you mean?―Whom do you allude to?
それはどういうことか
What does that mean?―What do you mean by that?―What is meant by that?

content: 10. (=何々すると言う、約束する)to promise

content.content: 彼はこれからもっと勉強すると言っている
He says he will work harder in future―He promises to work harder in future.
彼は間違い無く金を返すと言った
He said he would pay me without fail―He promised to pay me without fail.

content: 11. (=どうしてやろうと言う、提供する)to offer

content.content: 伯(叔)父が学資を仕送ってくれると言います
My uncle says he will supply me with my school-expenses―My uncle offers to pay my school-expenses.
彼はご入用だけご用立しようと言った
He said he would―offered to―place at my disposal any sum I might need.

content: 12. (=承諾する)to consent

content.content: 彼は仕事を引受けると言った
He says he will undertake the work―He has consented to undertake the work.

content: 13. (=いやだと言う、拒絶する)to refuse

content.content: 娘はその人のところへお嫁に行くのはいやだと言う
She says she will not marry him―She refuses to marry him.

content: 14. (=何々するぞと言う、脅す)to threaten

content.content: 彼は貴様を殺してしまうぞと言った
He said he would kill me―He threatened to kill me―He threatened me with death.

content: 15. (=ぜひ何々すると言う、どこまでも何々だと言う、主張する)to assert; to insist upon (doing something); to persist in saying

content.content: 彼はぜひそのわけを聞きたいと言った
He said he must positively know my reason―He insisted upon knowing my reason.
僕はぜひ否応の返答を聞きたいと言った
I said I must have his answer, yes or no―I insisted upon having his answer, yes or no.
彼はどこまでも自分の言うことが本当だと言っている
He says his statement is true―He strongly asserts his statement to be true―He asserts the truth of his statement.
彼はその説が本当でないと言っている
He says the statement is not true―He denies the statement to be true―He denies the truth of the statement.
彼は身に覚えが無いと言っている
He says he is innocent―He asserts himself to be innocent―He asserts his innocence.
彼はどこまでも知らぬ存ぜぬと言っている
He persists in saying that he does not know―persists in denying his knowledge.

content: 16. (=誓ってそうだと言う、断言する)to swear; to affirm

content.content: 彼は誓ってそうだと言っている
He swears it is true―He solemnly affirms it to be true―He affirms its truth.

content: 17. (=なるほどそうだと言う、認める)to admit; to acknowledge

content.content: 彼はなるほど君の言う通りだと言った
He said what I said was true―He admitted my statement to be true―He admitted the truth of my statement―He admitted the fact.
彼は自分が間違っていると言った
He said he was mistaken―He acknowledged himself to be mistaken―He acknowledged his error.
彼は自分が悪かったと言って謝まった
He said he was in fault―He acknowledged himself to be in fault―He acknowledged his fault.
彼は尋常に参ったと言って降参した
He said he was fairly beaten―He acknowledged himself to be fairly beaten―He acknowledged his defeat.
彼は君の方が偉いと言った
He said I was his superior―He acknowledged me as his superior―He acknowledged my superiority.

content: 18. (=自白する)to own

content.content: 彼はばかなことをしたと言っている
He says he has been foolish―He owns himself to have been foolish―He owns his past folly.

content: 19. (=白状する)to confess

content.content: 彼は身に覚えがあると言う
He says he is guilty―He has confessed himself to be guilty―He has confessed his guilt.
身に覚えが無いと言う
He says he is not guilty―He denies himself to be guilty―He denies his guilt―He asserts his innocence.

content: 20. (=公言する)to profess; to avow

content.content: 彼は専門は医者だと言っている
He says he is a physician by profession―He professes himself to be a physician―He professes medicine.
彼はキリスト教信者だと言っている
He says he is a Christian―He professes himself to be a Christian―He is a professed Christian.
彼はその論文は自分が書いたと言っている
He says he was written the article―He avows himself to be the author of the article―He avows the authorship.

content: 21. (=言明する)to declare

content.content: 彼はその説は虚偽だと言っている
He says the statement is false―He declares the statement to be false.

content: 22. (=診断する、鑑定する)to pronounce

content.content: 医者は僕の病気は軽いと言った
The doctor said my illness was a slight one―He pronounced my illness to be a slight one.
玉屋に見せるとダイヤは本物だと言った
The jeweller said the diamond was genuine―He pronounced it genuine.

content: 23. (=何々しても宜しいと言う、許可する)to permit

content.content: 父は芝居へ行ってよろしいと言いました
My father said I might go to the play―He permitted me to go to the play.

content: 24. (=何々してはいかんと言う、禁ずる)to forbid

content.content: 父は酒を飲んではいかんと言います
My father says I must not drink―He has forbidden me to drink.

content: 25. (=不平を言う、訴える)to complain

content.content: 彼は不平ばかり言っている
He does nothing but complain.
子どもは頭痛がすると言う
The child complains of a headache.
皆暑い暑いと言っている
They complain of the heat.
寒い寒いと言っている
They complain of the cold.
重い重いと言っている
They complain of the weight.
苦しい苦しいと言っている
They complain of the strain.

content: 26. (=言いかける)to accuse (one of a crime); to charge (one with a crime)

content.content: 彼は米探だと言われている
He is said to be a spy―accused of being a spy.
わいろを取ると言われた
He was accused of corruption―charged with corruption.
女は男が不実だと言った
She accused him of infidelity―charged him with infidelity―reproached him with infidelity.

content:
27. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君の言う通り
You are right.
君の言うことは間違っている
You are wrong.
暗に言う
to hint a fact
露骨に言えば詐欺だ
To be plain with you, it is fraud.
正直に言えばばかだ
To be honest with you, he is a fool.
公平に言えば悪い人間じゃない
To do him justice, he is not a bad man.
悪く言えば詐欺だ
Give it a hard name, and it is fraud.
ふるえ声で言う
to falter out something
どもって言う
to stammer out something
言うべからざることを言う
to tread on forbidden ground
口にまかして言いたいことを言う
to give a loose to one's tongue
ばかにものを言うと日が暮れる
Words are wasted on a fool.
お前のようなばかにはものを言わぬ
I will not waste words on you.
言いながら実行する
to suit the action to the word
言いもせぬことを言ったように言う
He puts in my mouth words I never used.
公園といえば公園だが
It is a park, if you will, but...
公園というほどの公園じゃない
It is not much of a park.
ホテルというほどのホテルじゃない
It is not much of a hotel.
あの人の言うことは当てにならぬ
He is not to be relied upon.
僕の言うことは大丈夫本当だ
You may depend upon it.
針ほどのことを棒ほどに言う
to make a mountain of a mole-hill
言わしておけば方図が無い
No more of your impertinence!―None of your sauce!
知ってはいるけれども誰にも言わずにおいた
I kept the matter to myself.
彼は得手勝手ばかり言う
He will have everything his own way.
彼に言わせると叩き上げられたのだ
He was, to use his own words, “licked into shape.”
僕がいやと言うのに無理に飲ました
They forced me to drink against my will.
君がそう言うとおかしい
It sounds strange from your lips.
その人の名は言わぬ
He shall be nameless.
彼は今行くと言って寄越した
He has sent me word that he is coming.
右といえば左と言う
He is perverse.
女はああ言えばこう言う
A woman will have the last word.
言っても返らぬこと
It is beyond recall―past recall.
何百という船が常に港に停泊している
Hundreds of ships are always at anchor in the harbour.
幾千人という人が毎日参詣する
Thousands of people daily worship at this shrine.
彼は三井という金穴がある
He has a backer in the Mitsuis.
僕は知事という良友を得た
I have found a friend in the governor.
学校は田中という良教師を失った
The school has lost a good teacher in Mr. Tanaka.
アッと言わせる
to take away one's breath
ギュウギュウ言わせる
to give one fits
皆寄ってたかって頭と言わず背中と言わず乱打した
They crowded about him and pommeled him, head and back.
君は無理を言う
You are unreasonable.
彼は口を開くとぶちこわしを言う
He never opens his mouth but he puts his foot in it.
書いた物がものを言います
I have it in black and white.
おぶうといえば抱かると言う
“Give him an inch, and he will take an ell.”
四の五の言う
to grumble
小言を言う
I blow him up―give him a piece of my mind.
俗に言う気が利かないのだ
He has, in common parlance, no head.
銀行では筆跡が違うと言って支払いを拒絶した
The bank refused payment on the ground that the handwriting was different.
天に口無し人をもって言わしむ
The voice of the people is the voice of God.
ひと口に言えば
in a word
そう言えば(僕も世間知らずだ)
Nor do I, for that matter.
彼の助かったのは奇蹟と言わざるを得ぬ
His escape is nothing short of a miracle―a positive miracle.
目も口ほどにものを言う
The eye is more eloquent than the tongue.
つかない事を言うようだが
By the bye,...
君は偉いということさ
You are a great man, that's all.
何を言っているものやら
I can't comprehend what he is driving at.
学問といい人物といい申し分の無い人だ
In scholarship and character, he leaves nothing to be desired.
しゃれを言う
to be witty
冗談を言う
to be funny―jest―joke―crack a joke
彼は自分のことばかり言っている
He is full of himself.
つけつけ言う
to din in one's ears
そう言われるのが何より辛い
I shall never hear the end of the matter.
(自分の欠点などを)言われぬ先に言う
to take the wind out of one's sail
彼はものを言うと損が行くといったようなふうだ
He has not a word to throw at a dog.
今にするなと言ってもするようになる
He will do it soon enough.
誰言うとなく彼は発狂したという噂が立った
It began to be rumoured that he was mad.
何を言っても彼は偉い
He is a great man, after all.

いうならく〔説道〕
〈副〉People say; they say; it is said

content:
いうにいわれぬ〔言うに言われぬ〕
〈形〉Unspeakable (sorrow); unexpressible (feeling); unutterable (grief); indescribable (beauty); indefinable (charm); ineffable (grace, etc.)

content.content: 言うに言われぬ心地がする
I have an indescribable feeling―an indefinable feeling.
言うに言われぬほど美しい
It is beautiful beyond description―Its beauty beggars description―baffles description―defies description―It is too beautiful for words.
言うに言われないいやな(味や匂い)
a vile―villainous―taste or smell

content:
いうにおよばず〔言うに及ばず〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: いうまでもなく〔言うまでもなく〕

いうにやおよぶ〔言うにや及ぶ〕
〈熟語〉It goes without saying

content:
いうまでもなく〔言うまでもなく〕
〈副〉I need not say; it need scarcely be said; it goes without saying; needless to say; not to mention; not to speak of; to say nothing of; let alone

content.content: 彼は英語は言うまでもなく独語仏語もできる
He knows French and German, not to speak of English―to say nothing of English.
言うまでもなく家は滅亡した
Needless to say, the house went to ruin.

content:
いうもさらなり〔言うも更なり〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: いうまでもなく〔言うまでもなく〕

content:
いえ〔家〕
〈名〉
1. (=家屋)a house; a mansion; a cottage; a place

content.content: 家を建てる
to build a house
あの人は家を建てた
He has built himself a house―had a house built.
家を建て直す
to rebuild a house
出来合いの家を買った
I have bought a ready-built house.
この家は借家だ
This is not my own house.
家を借りる
to rent a house
彼は自分の家を持っている
He has a house of his own.
家を修繕する
to repair a house
家は修繕中
The house is under repairs.
家は修繕が行届いている
The house is in good repair.
家は修繕しないからこわれている
The house is out of repair.
家に住む
to live in a house
住む家
a house to live in
この家に誰が住んでいるか
Who lives in this house?―Who occupies this house?
この家は誰も住んでいない
The house is unoccupied―The house is untenanted.
この家は人が住んだことがあるか
Has this house been lived in?
この家は人が住んだことが無い
This house has not been lived in.
あの家はふさがっているか
Is the house occupied?
家は明いている
The house is vacant.
家がふさがった
The house is taken.
家を明ける
to quit a house―clear a house―clear out
家を明け渡す
to vacate a house
家を持つ
to keep house―(初めてなら)―begin housekeeping
僕は下宿屋生活に飽きたから家を持とうと思う
I am tired of lodging-house life, and am going to begin housekeeping.
今度の家は山の手です
My new place is in the suburbs.
犬は家の番をする
The dog watches the house.
友人の家に泊まっている
I am staying at a friend's―staying with a friend.

content: 2. (=家族)a family; a house

content.content: 家を起こす
to found a house―make one's fortune
家を継ぐ
to succeed to the family estate
あの家は代々家老を勤めた
The family held the office of Karo from generation to generation.
あのような息子は家の面目だ
Such a son is a credit to his family.
お前のような奴は家の面汚しだ
You are a disgrace to your family.
お家の一大事
It is a matter of grave concern to the House.
不義はお家のご法度
Illicit intercourse is under the ban of the House.
あの家は気違いの血統だ
Insanity runs in the family.

content: 3. (=家庭)home; a household; a family

content.content: 家を治める
to manage a household―regulate one's family
家に帰る
to go home―come home
家に居る
to stay at home
父は家におります
Father is at home.
家に居ない
He is not at home―away from home.
家を明ける
to stay away from home
家を出る
to leave home
吉原が明るくなれば家は闇
When one is at home about town, it is dark at home.
女房は家の宝
A good wife is a household treasure.
家の中は彼の言いなり放題だ
The whole household is at his beck and call.

content:
4. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君の家はどこか
Where do you live?
彼の家は築地の方だ
He lives down Tsukiji way.
家は広いけれども道具が無い
We have plenty of room, but little furniture.
家の中に引込んでいる
I stay indoors.
家の中は暑い
It is hot within.
富貴の家に生まれた
He was born rich―born to wealth―born with a silver spoon in his mouth.
貧賤の家に生まれた
He was born poor―born to poverty.
家貧にして孝子出づ
“Adversity brings out a man's virtues.”
家を再興する
to retrieve one's fortunes
家をたたむ
to wind up one's affairs
家に盗人を養う
“So many servants, so many thieves.”
家には鼠、国には盗人
“Every mountain has its wolf.”
積善の家に余慶あり
Virtue brings its reward with it.

content:

〈名〉The style of a house; the appearance of a house

content.content: 立派な家構えだ
The house makes a fine appearance.
家構えは医院向きだ
The style of the house suits it for a doctor's office.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=家格)(one's) family standing, birth, blood, descent, lineage, stock, strain, parentage

content.content: 彼は家柄が好い
He comes of a good family―comes of a good strain―He is sprung from a good stock―He is of good descent―of good lineage―of good parentage.
彼は高貴な家柄だ
He is of noble birth―of noble blood.
彼は家柄自慢だ
He is proud of his birth.

content: 2. (=門閥)a good family

content.content: あの人は家柄だ
He comes of a good family.

to canvass from door to door
家ごとに国旗が掲げてある
The national flag waves over every door.

content.content: 家捜しに行く

content.content: 家路につく
to start on one's return―start for home

content:
いえすじ〔家筋〕

content.content: 彼は気違いの家筋だ

content.content: やそ〔耶蘇〕

いえで〔家出〕
〈名〉Leaving home:(=する) to leave home

content.content: 彼は三年前に家出してその後何の消息も無い
He left home three years ago, and has not been heard of since.
無断で家出した
He left home without the knowledge of his people.

content:

content.content: 彼老いたりといえどももとの元気を失わぬ
Though he is old―Old as he is―He is old, and yet―he has lost none of his energy.
当たらずといえども遠からず
It is not far from the mark.

いかに良艦といえどもこれを操縦することあたわざれば無用の長物なり
(Even) the best ships are useless if you do not know how to work them.

content.content: 家並が揃っている

この通りは家並が揃っている
The street presents a good row of houses.

content.content: 家持ちの上手な女だ

〈名〉The founder (of a school); the head-family (of a profession)

content:

〈名〉House and land; messuage

content.content: 家屋敷は抵当に入っている
His house and land are mortgaged.

content:
いえる〔癒える〕
〈自動〉To heal; to be healed; to be cured

content.content: 傷が癒えた
My wound has healed―I am healed of my wound.
これでまず腹が癒えた
I have had my revenge.
これくらいではまだ腹が癒えない
This is not enough to glut my ire.

いおう〔以往〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=以前)before; prior to
2. (=以後)after; subsequently to

content:
いおう〔硫黄〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆおう〔硫黄〕

content:
いおのめ〔魚の目〕
〈名〉A corn

content.content: 足の指に魚の目ができた
I have a corn in my toes.

content:
いおり〔庵〕
〈名〉A hermit's cell; a hermitage

content.content: 庵を結ぶ
to build oneself a hermitage

content:
イオン
〈名〉Ion

content.content: 陽イオン、陰イオン
positive ion―negative ion

content:
いか〔以下〕
〈前置詞相当〉Below; under; less than

content.content: 五円以下
under five yen―less than five yen―five yen or less
五銭以下はお預かり申さず候
Sums under five sen can not be deposited.
彼は四十以下ではあるまい
He can not be below forty―under forty.
五歳以下の小児は無賃
Children under five years―Children of five years and under―are not charged.
株は平価以下
The shares are below par―at a discount.
中流以下の者
people below the middle class
奏任以下の者
officials below the sonin rank
戦闘艦は二年以下ではできぬ
A battleship can not be built under two years.
彼女は伯爵以下では相手にしない
She turns her nose at any one under a count.
百円以下で売っては合わない
It can not be sold under 100 yen―It would not do to take less than 100 yen for it.

content: 〈形〉(=の) the following

content.content: 以下次号
To be continued.
以下略す
The rest is omitted.
以下これに準ず
The same applies to those that follow.
以下これに同じ
Those that follow are the same.
詳細は以下に示す
Details are given as under.

content:
いか〔医科〕

content.content: 医科大学
the College of Medicine

content:

〈名〉The cuttlefish; the inkfish; the sea-sleeve; the sound

content.content: イカには足が八本ある
The cuttlefish has eight arms［tentacles］.
イカが墨を吹く
A cuttlefish ejects its ink.
イカの墨
the ink of the cuttlefish―sepia
イカの甲
cuttle-bone
イカの甲より年の功
Age will tell―Older and wiser.
そううまくはイカの睾丸
Not so fast!―There are two words to that bargain.
(シャツの)イカ胸
a dicky

content:
いが〔毬〕
〈名〉A bur; a burr

content.content: 栗の毬
a chestnut-burr

〈名〉A court rank

いかい〔遺戒〕
〈名〉One's dying injunctions

いかい〔医界〕
〈名〉The medical world

content:
いがい〔意外〕
〈形〉
1. (=な) unexpected, unlooked-for, strange, surprising, astonishing, amazing (result); unexpected, unhoped-for (success); unexpected, disappointing (failure); unsuspected (corners):(=に) contrary to expectation, contrary to one's expectations; beyond expectation, beyond one's expectations; more than one expected ［thought, hoped, feared］

content.content: 君がそう言うのは意外だ
It is strange―I am surprised―that you should say so.
事実は小説よりも意外なり
“Fact is stranger than fiction.”
結果は意外だ
The result is unexpected―contrary to expectation―contrary to my expectations―not what I expected―surprising―a surprise.
意外にも彼は成功した
Contrary to expectation,―Contrary to my expectations,―he has succeeded.
意外に好くできた
He has done it better than I expected―beyond expectation―beyond my expectations―surprisingly well.
成績は意外に好い
The result is better than I expected―beyond expectation―beyond my expectations―surprisingly good―an agreeable surprise.
成績は意外に悪い
The result is worse than I expected―disappointing―a disappointment―The result does not come up to my expectations―falls short of my expectations.
彼の成功は意外だ

It is strange that he should have succeeded―He has succeeded better than I expected―beyond expectation―beyond my expectations―His success is unexpected―beyond expectation―beyond my expectations―surprising―a surprise―an agreeable surprise.
彼の失敗は意外だ

It is strange that he should have failed―He has failed contrary to expectation―contrary to my expectations―His failure is unexpected―contrary to expectation―contrary to my expectations―disappointing―a disappointment.
意外に好い天気になった
The weather has turned out fine―Contrary to expectations, the weather has turned out fine―The weather has turned out fine beyond expectation―The weather has turned out to be a pleasant surprise.
仕事は意外に骨が折れる
I find my work harder than I expected.
試験は意外にやさしかった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
君の病気は意外に早く直った
You have recovered sooner than I expected―much sooner than I hoped.
彼の病気は意外に長くかかった
His illness has taken longer than I expected―even longer than I feared.
利益は意外に多い
The profit is greater than I expected―far greater than I hoped.
損は意外に少ない
The loss is less than I expected―much less than I feared.
意外なことがあるものだ
It is always the unexpected that happens.
意外な方面から助力を得た
We received aid from an unexpected quarter.
意外なところに宝があるものだ
You will find treasures in unsuspected corners.
こんなことがあろうとは実に意外だ
I was unprepared for this.
あの経験家があんなばかなことをするとは意外千万だ
We should not have expected such folly from a man of his experience―Who would have thought it?
意外に思う
to be surprised―be astonished―be amazed―be disappointed
結果を見て意外に思った
I was surprised at the result―The result was a surprise to me.
彼が成功したと聞いて意外に思った
I was agreeably surprised at the news of his success―His success was an agreeable surprise to me.
彼が失敗したと聞いて意外に思った
I was disappointed at news of his failure―His failure was a disappointment to me.
(親独派いわく)ドイツが負けたのは実に意外に思った(夢にも思わなかった)
I little thought―Little did I think―that Germany would be defeated.
ドイツが負けたと聞いて実に意外に思った人がある(寝耳に水)
Some people were thunderstruck at the news of Germany's defeat―Germany's defeat was a thunderclap to some people.
こんなものがあろうとは実に意外に思った
This was a revelation to me.

content:
いがい〔遺骸〕
〈名〉One's remains:(詩歌にては)one's ashes

content.content: 遺骸は遺族に引渡された
His remains were handed over to his family.
遺骸を引取る
to take over one's remains
遺骸の引取り手が無い
No one claims his remains.
遺骸を骨にする(荼毘に付す)
to cremate one's remains
遺骸を埋葬する
to bury one's remains―consign one's remains to the grave

content:
いがいに〔以外に〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. Outside; beyond; other than

content.content: 彼の家族以外に彼を知る者は無い
Outside his family, nobody knows him.
この事実以外に何も知らぬ
Beyond this fact, I know nothing.
職員以外の入場を謝絶す
No admission to other than members of the staff.

content: 2. (=以外にも)(something) besides, in addition to, over and above

content.content: 彼は給料以外に収入があるに違いない
He must have some income besides his pay.
英語教授以外に著述に従事している
In addition to teaching English, he is engaged in literary work.
彼が去る時給料以外に礼をした
When he left, I gave him something over and above what was due to him.

content: 3. (=以外には)(nothing) but, save, except, excepting, with the exception of

content.content: 彼は給料以外に収入のあるはずが無い
He can have no income but his pay.
この事実以外には何も知らぬ
I know nothing except this fact―Excepting this fact, I know nothing―With the exception of this fact, I know nothing.

How do you do?―How are you?―How goes it with you?
お店の景気はいかがですか
How is the business doing?
ご病気はいかがですか
How do you find yourself?
風呂はいかがですか
Won't you take a bath?
風呂の加減はいかがですか
How is the bath?
一ついかがですか
Won't you try one?
日光遊覧はいかがですか
What do you say to a trip to Nikko?
日光行きはいかがでしたか
How did you enjoy your trip to Nikko?
今度の芝居はいかがですか
What do you think of the new play?―How do you like it for a play?
食事はいかが致しましょうか
What shall we do for the meals?
(暑いから)お羽織をお脱ぎになってはいかがですか
Won't you take off your coat?

〈形〉Questionable (character); doubtful (business); dubious (attitude); suspicious (air); shady (transaction, etc.)

This is menace to the peace of the East.
威嚇砲撃
an intimidating fire

content.content: 医学を研究する
to study medicine
医学を実地に研究する
to walk the hospitals

a medical (student)

a medical school

a medical college

content.content: 鋳掛屋でござい

content:
いかさま〔如何様〕
〈形〉Questionable (article); dubious (business); bogus (goods)

content.content: いかさま物
a bogus article―a fake
僕はいかさま物を売りつけられた
I had a bogus article imposed upon me.
彼らは日本に慣れない外国人と見るとこんないかさま物を売りつける
When they have to do with foreigners new to Japan, they foist such fakes upon them.
いかさま物をごまかして本物に見せる
to fake up bogus articles―duff bogus articles
いかさま師、いかさま屋
a faker―a duffer―a charlatan―a mountebank
いかさま普請
jerry-building
いかさま大工
a jerry-builder

content.content: いかにも〔如何にも〕

content:
いかす〔生かす、活かす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=蘇生せしむ)to revive; to resuscitate; to bring (one) to life; to restore (one) to life

content.content: 死者を活かす
to bring a dead man to life―restore a dead man to life―resuscitate a dead man
枯れかけた木を活かす
to revive a dying tree

content: 2. (=殺さずにおく)to keep (one) alive; to spare (one)

content.content: 魚を生かしておけ
Keep the fish alive.
彼を生かしておきたかった
I wish he could have lived.
今日まで生かしておきたかった
I wish he could have been alive to this day.
生かしておいて今日の日本が見せたかった
I wish he could have lived to see the Japan of today.
彼は生かしておけぬ
He shall not live―He shall die.
生かしておいては後日の禍
If he lives, he will make trouble.
彼を殺すも生かすも我が掌中に在り
It is in my power to kill or spare him―He is in my power.
殺すか生かすか
to kill or spare
妾身任君殺
My life is thine to kill or spare―
妾身任君生
It rests with thee to spare or kill!
妾身有阿郎
My heart's not mine to give or hire―
妾心不可奪
'Tis not for thee to win at will.
絵を活かす
to give life to a picture―accent a painting
金を活かして使う
to make the most of of one's money―make one's money go a long way
学問を活かして使う
to put knowledge to practical use
彼は学問があっても活かして使うことを知らぬ
He possesses knowledge, but he does not know how to put it to practical use.
人を活かして使う
to make the best use of men―use the right man in the right place

content.content: いかだを組む

いかだ乗り
a raftsman

content:
いがた〔鋳型〕

content.content: 鋳型へ流し込む

彼はすべての人を同じ鋳型にいれようとする
He tried to stretch all men on the bed of Procrustes.

content:
いかだいがく〔医科大学〕
