content.content: 医科大学長
the Dean of the Medical College
医科大学付属病院
the Hospital attached to the Medical College―the College Hospital

いかたる〔胃加答児<胃カタル>〕
〈名〉Catarrh of the stomach

いかたる〔胃加答児<胃カタル>〕
〈名〉Catarrh of the stomach

いかつい
〈形〉Stern, fierce (look); fierce-looking (man); majestic (air, etc.)

content:
いかで〔如何で〕
〈疑問副詞〉How!

content.content: いかで袖手傍観すべき
How can I remain an idle spectator?
いかで感謝せざるべき
How can I but feel grateful?

content:
いかなる〔如何なる〕
〈疑問形容詞〉What kind of (animal or plant)?; What sort of a (man or place)?

content.content: 彼はいかなる人物か
What sort of a man is he?―What is he like?
今日はいかなる悪日ぞ
Woe worth the day!
これはいかなる風の吹き廻しか
What lucky wind has blown you here?―What lucky chance has brought you here?―To what business do I owe this honour?

content: 〈不定形容詞〉Any; whatever

content.content: いかなる職も無職には勝る
Any occupation is better than none.
いかなることがあっても稽古を休むな
Do not absent yourself from school on any account.
いかなることがあろうとも覚悟をきめている
Whatever may happen,―Come what may, I am prepared for it.
いかなる困難があっても為すべき事をする
Nothing shall hinder me from doing my duty.
いかなる専門を選ぼうとも語学は必要だ
Whatever profession you may choose, you will find the knowledge of languages necessary.

content:
いかに〔如何に〕
〈疑問副詞〉How?

content.content: 味方の戦況いかに
How goes the day with us?
ご意見いかに
What is your opinion?
いかに仲国
How now, Nakakuni?

content: 〈不定副詞〉However

content.content: いかに努めたとて一朝一夕にはできぬ
However hard you may try, it is not to be done in a day.
いかに金持ちでも徒食するものでない
However rich a man may be, he ought not to eat the bread of idleness.

content:
いかにも〔如何にも〕
〈副〉Indeed; certainly; to be sure; even so

content.content: いかにも好くできている
It is very good, indeed.
いかにもご説の通り
It is certainly as you say.
彼の英語はいかにも立派なものだが発音に少し遺憾なところがある
His English is nearly perfect, to be sure, but his pronunciation leaves something to be desired.
彼はいかにも青年らしく熱心に仕事をする
He devotes himself to his work with all the ardour of youth.
いかにも彼の言いそうなことだ
It is just like him to say so―The remark is characteristic of the man.
それはいかにもありそうなことだ
That is very likely―That may well be.
その子が女なのはいかにも残念だ
It is a great pity that the child is a girl.
君が中途で廃学するのはいかにも惜しいことだ
It is a great pity that you should give up your studies half-way.
彼はいかにも本当らしい嘘をつく
He tells plausible lies.

content: 〈応答詞〉Yes; yes, indeed; indeed it is; just so; quite so; even so

content.content: 如何にも存じて居る
Yes, I know.
如何にも左様
Quite so―Just so―Even so―Exactly.

content:
いかぬ
〈助動詞〉→『

content.content: いかん〔不可〕

content:
いかばかり〔如何計り〕
〈疑問副詞〉How much!; How great!; What!

content.content: その悦びはいかばかり
How great must have been his joy!
その驚きはいかばかり
What was (not)his surprise on finding that!

content:
いかほど〔如何程〕
〈疑問代名詞〉How much?; What?

content.content: 価はいかほど
What is the price?―How much (is this)?
勘定はいかほどになりますか
What does the bill come to?―What's to pay?

content:
いがみ〔歪み〕
〈名〉Crookedness; distortion; strain

content.content: 船はいがみを生じた
The ship is strained.

いがみあい〔啀み合い〕
〈名〉Snarling at each other

いがみあう〔啀み合う〕
〈自動〉To snarl at each other

content:
いがむ〔歪む〕
〈自動〉
1. To strain; to be strained; to be crooked; to be distorted; to be contorted; to be awry; to be out of shape

content.content: 茶碗がいがんでいる
The tea-cup is crooked out of shape.
船がいがんだ
The ship is strained.
口がいがんでいる
His mouth is awry.

content: 2. (=心がいがむ)to be perverse; to be crabbed; to be cross-grained

content.content: 心のいがんだ老翁だ
He is a perverse old fellow―a crabbed old fellow―a cross-grained old fellow.

いがむ〔啀む〕
〈自他動〉To snarl (at everybody)

content:
いかめしい〔厳めしい〕
〈形〉Stern (look); majestic (air); solemn (ceremony); stately (building); magnificent (front); pompous (manner); high-sounding (title)

content.content: いかめしい顔つきをしている
He has a stern look―He looks stern.
いかめしい風をしている
He has a majestic air.
いかめしい玄関構えの家だ
The house has a magnificent front.
いかめしい肩書きだ
He has a high-sounding title.

content:
いがめる〔歪める〕
〈他動〉To crook; to distort; to contort

content.content: 顔をいがめる
to distort one's face―make a wry face

content:
いかもの〔偽物〕
〈名〉A false article; a spurious article; a bogus article; a fake

content.content: いか物を売りつけられた
I had a false article foisted upon me.
いかもの師
a faker―a duffer

content:
いかように〔如何様に〕
〈疑問副詞〉→『

content.content: いかに〔如何に〕

content:
いからす〔怒らす〕
〈他動〉To make (one) angry; to provoke (one) to anger; to enrage; to irritate; to incense; to displease; to offend; to give offence; to stir one's wrath; to outrage one's feelings

content.content: 目を怒らす
to make one's eyes glare
目を怒らして向かって来た
He turned upon me with glaring eyes.
肩を怒らす
to perk up one's shoulders

content:
いかり〔怒り〕
〈名〉Anger; rage; passion; offence; displeasure; wrath

content.content: 人の怒りに触れる
to arouse one's anger―incur one's displeasure―offend one
怒りをなだめる
to calm one's anger―appease one's anger
怒りを抑える
to repress one's anger―contain one's anger
怒りを忍ぶ
to keep one's temper
怒りを和らげる
to disarm one's anger
穏かな言葉は怒りをそらす
“A soft answer turneth away wrath.”
怒りに乗じて僕を打った
He struck me in a moment of anger―in a fit of passion―in the heat of passion.
神の怒りを招く
to call down Divine wrath

content:
いかり〔錨〕
〈名〉An anchor

content.content: 錨をおろす
to cast anchor―drop anchor
船が錨をおろしている
A ship is at anchor―A ship lies at anchor―A ship rides at anchor.
錨を上げる
to weigh anchor
錨を捲き上げる
to heave up the anchor
船が錨を引きずる
A ship drags her anchor.
(底が悪いから)錨が持たぬ
The anchor will not hold―The anchor will drag.

content:
いかる〔怒る〕
〈自動〉To get angry ; to be angered; to be enraged; to be offended; to be displeased; to get into a rage; to fly into a passion; to lose one's temper; to lose one's patience; to take offence; to take umbrage

content.content: 烈火の如く怒る
to fire up―flame up―flare up
彼は烈火の如く怒っている
He is in a fury―furious with anger―in a towering passion.
侮辱を受けて烈火の如く怒った
He was infuriated at the insult.
怒りやすい
He is irritable―irascible―passionate―choleric―quick-tempered―short-tempered―hot-tempered―ill-tempered―quick to take offence.
小人は怒りやすし
“A little pot is soon hot.”
彼は容易に怒らぬ
He is slow to take offence―slow to anger―He has a good temper―a sweet temper.

content:
いかん〔偉観〕
〈名〉A grand sight

content.content: 観艦式は偉観を呈す
A naval review presents a grand sight.
絶大の偉観である
It is a magnificent sight.

いかん〔尉官〕
〈名〉(陸軍のは)a company officer; a subaltern:(海軍のは)a lieutenant

content:
いかん〔遺憾〕
〈名〉
1. Regret; a pity:(=な) regrettable; deplorable

content.content: 今日天気の悪いのは遺憾である
I am sorry―I regret―It is to be regretted―It is a pity―that the weather is bad today.
遺憾ながら
I regret to say―I am sorry to say.
遺憾ながらご依頼に応じかねます
I regret to say that I am not in a position to comply with your request―To my regret, I can not oblige you.
それは遺憾ながら事実である
It is but too true.
彼の欠席を深く遺憾とす
I deeply regret―It is deeply to be regretted―that he should be absent today.
今日彼の欠席されたのは遺憾千万である
It is a thousand pities that he should have absented himself today.
事ここに至らんとは遺憾千万だ
What a pity that things should have come to this!―That things should have come to this!
彼の英語は遺憾なし
His English leaves nothing to be desired―His English is perfect.
彼の発音は少し遺憾なところがある
His pronunciation leaves something to be desired.
遺憾なく
fully―to the full
彼は成金ぶりを遺憾無く発揮している
He plays the upstart millionaire to the full.
天才を遺憾無く発揮している
His genius has full fling―He gives free play to his genius.
商人根性を遺憾無く発揮している
He displays his sordid spirit in all its naked glory.

いかん〔医官〕
〈名〉A medical officer; a surgeon

content:
いかん〔如何〕
〈疑問副詞〉How?; What?

content.content: ご意見いかん
What is your opinion?
日本の将来はいかん
What will be the future of Japan?
君もっていかんと為す
What do you think of it?
日光遊覧はいかん
What do you say to a trip to Nikko?
入湯はいかん
Won't you take a bath?
形勢如何
How goes the day?
虞や虞や汝をいかんせん
What shall I do with thee, my charming Gu?
貧なるをいかんせん
I am poor, so what can I do?
いかんせん金が無かったから
What could I do? I had no money.
百計尽きていかんともするあたわず
I am at the end of my resources―at my wits' end―helpless.
目下の状況にてはいかんともするあたわず
As matters now stand, nothing can be done.
彼の教授法いかんについては断言することはできぬ
I can not be positive about his teaching.
費用のいかんに関せず造れ
Make it, regardless of expense.
結果のいかんに関せず本分を尽せ
Do you duty, irrespective of the consequences.

content: 〈名〉Nature

content.content: (出京の)目的いかんを尋ねた
I inquired what was his business―I inquired the nature of his business.
断罪は動機のいかんによる
Conviction depends on (the nature of) the motive.
それは結果いかんによって決すべきである
It will depend on (the nature of) the result.

content:
いかん〔不可〕
〈助動詞、自動、形〉→『

content.content: いけない
そりゃいかん
That's too bad.

いがん〔胃癌〕
〈名〉Cancer of the stomach

content:
いかんせん〔如何せん〕
〈熟語〉What can I do?

content.content: 貧窮なるをいかんせん
I am poor, so what can I do?
いかんせん金が無かったから
What could I do? I had no money.
虞や虞や汝をいかんせん
What shall I do with thee, my charming Gu?

いかんそくたい〔衣冠束帯〕
〈名〉(Old-time) full court dress

content:
いかんとなれば〔如何となれば〕
〈接続詞〉Because

content.content: いかんとなれば彼は勤勉なるが故である
It is because he is diligent in attending to his duties.

いがんめんかん〔依願免官〕
〈熟語〉To be relieved of one's post at one's own request

いき
〈命令法〉(=校正の指図)stet

content:
いき〔位記〕
〈名〉A diploma of court rank ; honours

content.content: 位記を返上する
to forfeit one's honours
位記を剥奪する
to divest one of one's rank―strip off one's honours
位記を剥奪さる
to be stript of one's honours

content:
いき〔意気〕
〈名〉Spirit (spirits); humour; temper

content.content: 意気眉宇に現わる
His spirit sits on his brow.
人の意気に感ずる
to catch one's spirit―be inspired by one
部下は大将の意気に感じた
The men caught the spirit of their leader―The men were inspired by their leader.
その計画は僕の意気に投合した
The project jumped with my humour―hit with my temper―fell in with my humour―struck in with my temper.
彼と僕とは意気相投合する
He and I are congenial spirits.
その意気で行くんだね
You must go about it in that spirit.
意気揚がる(意気軒昂)
They are in high spirits―elated.
意気衝天
Their spirit is sky-high―They are in soaring spirits.
意気揚々
They are triumphant.
意気揚々として帰って来た
They returned in triumph.
彼らは成功して意気揚々としている
They are elated with success.
意気揚がらず
He is in low spirits―depressed in spirits―dejected―cast down.
意気消沈す
He is depressed in spirits―in low spirits―in the blues―in the dumps―in the dismals―in the doldrums―He has a fit of the blues.

content: 〈形〉Chic; smart; stylish

content.content: 意気な男だ
He is a smart fellow.
意気な女だ
She is a smart girl―She is chic.
意気な支度
stylish dress
意気で人柄
smart and elegant
意気筋
a romance―a love affair

content:
いき〔遺棄〕
〈名〉Abandonment:(=する) to abandon

content.content: 船を遺棄する
to abandon a ship to her fate―leave a ship to her fate
遺棄船
a derelict
敵は死傷者を遺棄して逃走した
The enemy ran away, leaving behind their killed and wounded.

content:
いき〔域〕
〈名〉A stage

content.content: 名人の域に達する
to attain perfection

content:
いき〔生き〕
〈名〉Freshness

content.content: この魚は生きが好さそうだ
The fish looks fresh―looks rosy about the gills.
この魚は生きが悪い
This fish looks blue about the gills.

content:
いき〔息〕
〈名〉Breath; breathing; respiration:(=する) to breathe; to draw breath; to respire; to inspire and expire

content.content: 息をつく
to breathe―draw breath
まだ息をついている
He is still breathing―still alive.
ひと息つく
to take breath―take a rest
坂の中段でひと息ついた
We took break―took a rest―when half-way up the slope.
(安心して)ほっとひと息つく
to draw a long breath―give a sigh of relief
鼻で息をつく
to breathe through the nose
鼻を曲げても息をつく
He manages to live by hook or by crook.
肩で息をつく
to breathe with difficulty
もう百円あると息がつける
A hundred yen more would relieve me―help me out of the difficulty.
馬に息をつかせる(息を入れる)
to breathe a horse―wind a horse
息もつかずに飲み干した
He drained the glass at a draught―without stopping for breath.
息もつかずに勝負を眺めた
We watched the contest with breathless interest.
息を吸う
to breathe in the air―inhale air―inspire
息を吐き出す
to breathe out the air―exhale air―expire
鏡に息を吹きかける
to breathe on a mirror―blow on a mirror
鏡に息を吹きかけると曇る
A mirror, when breathed upon, grows dim.
息が荒い
to breathe hard―blow like a grampus
あの人は息が臭い
He has a foul breath―a stinking breath.
息を切らす
to lose one's breath―get out of breath―pant―puff and pant―lose one's wind―One's wind fails
彼は息を切らしている
He is out of breath―puffing and panting.
息を切らして走る
to run oneself out of breath
一人の男が息せき切って走って来た
A man came running himself out of breath.
彼は息を切らしてしゃべっている
He has talked himself out of breath.
息を切らす
to get out of breath
息が切れる
I am short of breath―short-winded.
息が切れて坂が上がれない
I am so short of breath that I can not ascend a slope.
息が続かぬ
to have a short wind―a bad wind
息が長く続く
to have a long wind―a good wind
息を回復する
to recover one's wind―get one's wind
息を殺す
to hold one's breath―bate one's breath
息を殺して勝負を眺めていた
We watched the contest with bated breath―with breathless interest―hardly daring to breathe.
息をはずませる
to breathe short―gasp for breath
息をはずませて言った
He spoke in excitement.
息を吹返す
to fetch one's breath―come to (oneself)
冷たい風に当たって息を吹返した
The cold air brought me to (myself).
彼は息を吹返した
He has come to―He stirs.
息が絶える、息を引取る
to breathe one's last―expire
息を引止める
to catch one's breath
(鳩尾を突かれて)息を引止める
to have one's wind taken
息が詰まる
to be choked―be stifled―be suffocated―be smothered
この室は息が詰まるようだ
This room is close―stuffy―choking―stifling―suffocating.
息がこもる
The air grows foul.
息を留める
to choke one―stifle one―suffocate one―smother one
息の音を止める
to kill one
息が絶える
to expire―die
虫の息になっている
He is at his last gasp.
虫の息も無い
Not a spark of life remains.
息のあるうちに
while one breathes―while one is alive
この息の通う間は御身を守護し参らせん
I will protect you while I have a drop left in my veins―to the last drop of my blood.

content:
いぎ〔威儀〕
〈名〉Dignity; majesty:(=ある) dignified; majestic; stately; commanding

content.content: 彼は威儀堂々たる風采を有しておる
He is a man of majestic mien―a man of commanding presence.
威儀堂々たる一列
a stately array of men
威儀を正す
(西洋では)to draw oneself up―(日本では)―sit up straight
威儀を正して控えていた
I found him seated in a dignified attitude.

content:
いぎ〔意義〕
〈名〉Meaning; sense; signification; significance; import:(=ある) significant

content.content: 人生の意義がやっとわかってきた
I now come to see the meaning of life.
意義ある生活をする
to live to purpose
これで初めて人生が意義あるものとなる
It is this which makes life significant.
意義の深い話だ
It is a story of deep significance―a significant story.
意義の広い言葉だ
The word is comprehensive in meaning―of comprehensive signification―It is a comprehensive term.
意義明哲
The meaning is clear.
意義不明
The meaning is obscure―It is obscure in meaning.
意義曖昧
The meaning is ambiguous―It is ambiguous in meaning.
意義を解する能わず
I can not make out the meaning―It is unintelligible.

content:
いぎ〔異議〕
〈名〉An objection; a protest; a demurrer; exception; dissent

content.content: 異議を唱える
to object to a measure―make objections to a measure―raise objections to a measure―protest against a measure―demur to a measure―dissent from one's views
異議を申立てる
to make a protest against―enter a protest against―lodge a protest against―file a protest against―a measure
異議を差挟む
to interpose an objection―(証人などに対してなら)―take exception to(or against) a witness
君の去るのには異議は無い
I have no objection to your leaving―I have nothing to say against it―I am agreeable to it.
動議は異議無く可決した
The motion was carried without dissent―without a dissentient voice.
異議に答弁する
to meet an objection

content:
いきあう〔行合う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ゆきあう〔行き合う〕

content:
いきあたりばったり〔行き当りばったり〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ゆきあたりばったり〔行当りばったり〕

content:
いきいきした〔生き生きした〕
〈形〉Lively; full of life

content.content: あの女は生き生きしている
She is very lively―all life.
生き生きした肖像だ
The portrait looks full of life.

content:
いきうつし〔生き写し〕
〈名〉A lifelike portrait; a living likeness; a speaking likeness:(=の) lifelike

content.content: この肖像は生き写しだ
The portrait is lifelike―drawn to the life.
この子は父親の生き写しだ
The boy is the very image of his father―the very moral of his father―a chip of the old block.

content:
いきうま〔生き馬〕
〈名〉A live horse

content.content: 生き馬の目を抜く
to pull out one's eye-teeth
江戸っ子は生き馬の目を抜く
The Edokko is as sharp as a needle.
生き馬の目を抜くような事をして儲けた金だ
He made his fortune by sharp practice.

content:
いきうめ〔生き埋め〕
〈名〉Burying alive

content.content: 生き埋めにする
to bury one alive
生き埋めになる
to be buried alive

いきえ〔生餌〕
〈名〉Live bait; live food

content:
いきおい〔勢い〕
〈名〉
1. (=勢力)power; force; might; energy; influence; authority; vigour; spirit

content.content: 勢いの好い
a powerful state―a forcible style―a mighty monarch―an influential statesman―an energetic way of doing things―vigorous growth―a spirited attack
彼は大した勢いだ
He is influential―powerful―mighty.
非常な勢いで働く
He works with great force―with great energy―like fury―like anything.
勢い当たるべからず
His energy is irresistible―He is as proud as Lucifer.
勢いを振るう
to exercise one's authority
勢いをくじく
to break one's power
勢いをくじかれる
to have one's power broken
勢い鋭く攻め立てた
They went at it with spirit.
互角の勢い
The chances are even.
酒の勢いでそう言ったのだ
He said so under the influence of wine.
日本軍は破竹の勢いで進んだ
The Japanese carried everything before them.
彼は日の出の勢いだ
He is a rising man.
日の出の勢いにつく
to worship the rising sun―hail the rising sun
旭日冲天の勢い
His star is in the ascendant.
獅子奮迅の勢い
He is a raging lion.
飛ぶ鳥を落とす勢い
He nods and shakes the spheres.
始めの勢いどこへやら
His initial vigour has evaporated.

content: 2. (=はずみ)momentum; impetus

content.content: 汽車が非常な勢いで走りながら衝突したのだ
The trains collided with great impetus.

content: 3. (=なりゆき)course of nature; course of events; force of circumstances

content.content: 自然の勢い
course of nature
そうなるのは自然の勢いだ
It is in the course of nature―natural―that it should be so.
勢いの然らしむるところ
It is in the natural course of things―in the natural course of events.
天下の勢いを察する
to observe the course of events
勢い止むを得ずこうなるのだ
Things are shaped by force of circumstances.
騎虎の勢いでやむを得ず競争したのだ
I was obliged by force of circumstances to engage in competition―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Circumstances obliged me to engage in competition.
勢い既に定まる
Things have taken a definite course.
勢い定まれば変ず
“When things are at their worst, they will mend.”
勢いに乗ずる
to swim with the stream―go with the current
智ありといえども勢いに乗ずるに如かず
The wise will go with the current.
あまり勢いに乗じて失敗した
He failed by suffering himself to be carried away by his initial successes.

content: 〈副〉(=自然、当然、必然)naturally; in the nature of things; as a natural consequence; as a matter of course; by force of circumstances; of necessity

content.content: 勢い実力が勝つ
It is in the nature of things―natural―that real ability should win.
勝った者が勢い天下を取る
The victor makes himself master of the realm as a natural consequence―as a matter of course.
勢いやむを得ず競争することになったのだ
I was obliged by force of circumstances to engage in competition.
勢いそうならざるを得ぬ
It must of necessity be so―It must needs be so.

いきおいこむ〔勢い込む〕
〈自動〉To brace one's energies; to brace oneself up

いきおいづく〔勢いづく〕
〈自動〉To gain vigour; to become energetic; to become spirited

content:
いきがい〔生き甲斐〕
〈名〉Worth of living

content.content: 生きがいがある
Life is worth living.
この世に楽しみが無ければ生きがいが無い
Without an object in life, life is not worth living.
生きがいの無いこと夥しい
Life is not in the least worth living.

content:
いきかえる〔生き返る〕
〈自動〉To revive; to be resuscitated; to come to life; to be restored to life; to rise from the dead

content.content: 彼は人工呼吸で生き返った
He was resuscitated by artificial respiration.
生き返ったような心地がする
I feel myself a new man―feel myself another man.
生き返らす
to resuscitate one―restore one to life―bring one to life

いきがお〔生顔〕
〈名〉A living face

content:
いきがけ〔行きがけ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆきがけ〔行掛け〕

content:
いきき〔行き来〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆきき〔行き来〕

content:
いきぎも〔生肝〕
〈名〉The liver of a living person

content.content: 人の生肝を抜く
to take away one's breath―knock the breath out of one's body

content:
いきぎれ〔息切れ〕
〈名〉Shortness of breath

content.content: 息切れがする
I am short of breath―short-winded.
息切れがして坂が上がれない
I am so short of breath that I can not go up a slope―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Shortness of breath prevents my going up a slope.

content:
いきぐさり〔生き腐り〕
〈名〉Stink-alive

content.content: この魚は生き腐りだ
This fish stinks alive.

content:

The enjoyment of first-fruits is said to lengthen one's term of existence by 75 days―add 75 days to one's natural term of existence.

content:
いきる〔生きる〕
〈自動〉
1. To live

content.content: 彼は長くは生きまい
He will not live long―last long.
その人はまだ生きている
The man is still living―still alive.
今生きている人の覚えてからの大地震だった
It was the greatest earthquake within living memory.
百まで生きる者は少ない
Few people live to be a hundred.
俺が生きているうちはお前達に不自由はさせぬ
You shall want for nothing while I live―as long as I live.
人は食うために生きるか生きるために食うか
Does man live to eat or eat to live?―live that he may eat or eat that he may live?
我々は米を食って生きている
We live on rice.
食わずに生きておれぬ
We can not live on nothing―live on air.
生きて故郷に還ることはできまい
I shall never live to see my native land.
生きて還る者ただ一人
Only one man lived to tell the tale.
彼はどうして生きているか僕には解せぬ
How he manages to live, is more than I can tell.
あの女は何が楽しみで生きているか
What does she live for?
子どもが楽しみで生きている
She lives for her children.
彼は生きる楽しみが無い
He has nothing worth living for.
娘が死ぬの生きるのと言っている
She talks of dying.
生きて恥をさらさんより死するにしかず
I would rather die than live in dishonour.
生きた空が無い
to lead a miserable existence―lead a dog's life of it
この商売はかながな生きているというばかりです
I make a bare living by this trade.
正義に死して百世に生く
to die in the cause of justice and live in the memory of posterity
死地に陥って然る後に生く
to find life in death
彼が生きているならきっと探し出す
I will find him out if he be above ground.
彼はもう一年は生きまい
He will not live another year―His life is not worth a year's purchase.
感情に生きる人は理性に死んでいる人とは限らぬ
Those who live by feeling are not necessarily dead to reason.→『いきた〔生きた〕』→『いきながら〔生き乍ら〕』

content: 2. (=絵などが生きる)to have life given to it; to be accented

content.content: 山水の絵は人物で生きる

This character gives life to the novel.

The style saves the book.

A joke is saved or lost by a trifle―A trifle decides the success of a joke.
戦いは最後の五分で死ぬか生きるかが決まる
A battle is won or lost by the last five minutes―The last five minutes decide the day.

よくよくのことでなければいくさをするものでない

いくたり〔幾人〕

content.content: いくにん〔幾人〕

いぐち〔欠唇〕
〈名〉A hare-lip:(=の) hare-lipped

content:
いくちよ〔幾千代〕
〈名〉Eternity

content.content: 幾千代かけて契る
to vow eternal love
日の本は幾千代までも栄えよかし
May Japan endure for ever!

content:
いくつ〔幾つ〕
〈疑問形容詞〉
1. How many?:(年齢を問えば)how old?

content.content: 窓はいくつあるか
How many windows are there?
おいくつですか
How old are you?―What is your age?
いくつと見えますか
How old do you take me for?
いくつか
some
いくつかまだ残っている
There are some left.
いくつも
many
あの家は座敷がいくつもある
There are many rooms in that house.
いくつでも
as many as one likes―ever so many―any number
いくつでも要るだけお取りなさい
Take as many as you want.
東京には学校がいくつでもある
There are any number of schools―ever so many schools―in Tokyo.
円にいくつ
so many for a yen
鶏卵は円にいくつで売買する
Eggs are sold at so many for a yen.

content:
いくつき〔幾月〕
〈疑問副詞〉
1. How many months?; How long?
2.

content.content: 幾月か
some months
幾月かたって
after some months―some months later
幾月も
for months

content:
いくど〔幾度〕
〈疑問副詞〉
1. How many times?; How often?

content.content: 幾度やってみたかね
How often have you tried?
幾度も
many times―several times―often―frequently
彼は幾度も洋行した
He has been abroad several times.
幾度やっても失敗した
I failed every time I tried.
あまり幾度も失敗したからとうとう断念した
I failed so often that I gave up the attempt in despair.
彼は幾度行っても不在だった
He was absent every time I called.
幾度も幾度も
again and again―time and again―time after time―over and over again―repeatedly
ひと事を幾度も幾度も繰返して言う
He repeats the same thing over and over again―He harps on the same string.
幾度でも
as often as one likes
幾度でもやってご覧
Try as often as you like―Keep on trying.
幾度となく
ever so many times―times without number
幾度となくやってみたけれども駄目でした
I tried ever so many times, but in vain.

content:
いくどうおん〔異口同音〕
〈名〉Unanimity:(=に) unanimously; with one voice; with one consent; in a chorus

content.content: 皆異口同音に承知した
They all agreed with one voice.
異口同音に「然り」と叫んだ
They cried out “Yes” in a chorus.

content:
いくとおり〔幾通り〕
〈疑問詞〉How many kinds?
〈形〉(=の) many kinds of; several kinds of

content.content: この品は幾通りもあります
There are several kinds of this article.

content:
いくとせ〔幾年〕
〈疑問詞〉→『

content.content: いくねん〔幾年〕

content:
いくにち〔幾日〕
〈疑問副詞〉
1. (=何日)What day of the month?

content.content: 今日は幾日か
What day of the month is this?―What is the day of the month?

content: 2. (=何日間)how many days?; how long?

content.content: 幾日かかるか
How long will it take?
幾日も
for days
彼は幾日も続けて帰らないことがある
He will sometimes stay away from home for days on end.
幾日経っても便りが無い
Days passed without a line from him.
幾日でも
as long as you like―for ever so many days―for any number of days

content:
いくにん〔幾人〕
〈疑問詞〉
1. How many persons?

content.content: 成功した者が幾人あるか
How many have succeeded?
幾人かかるか
How many men does it take?
幾人か
some men
成功した者は幾人かある
Some have succeeded.
幾人も
many men
成功した者は幾人もある
Many have succeeded.
成功した者は幾人も無い
Not many have succeeded―Few have succeeded.
幾人でも
any number of men―as many men as you like―ever so many men
幾人でも来るだけ入れる
As many as come, will be admitted.

content:
いくねん〔幾年〕
〈疑問副詞〉
1. How many years?; How long?

content.content: 幾年洋行したか
How long did you stay abroad?
幾年も
for years
幾年も洋行していられない
I can not stay abroad long.
幾年でも
as long as you like―for ever so many years

content:
いくばく〔幾何〕
〈疑問形容詞〉
1. How many?; How much?

content.content: 残りいくばく
How much is left?―How many are left?
その価いくばく
What is the price?
いくばくか
some
いくばくかの金
some money
いくばくもなし
There is little―There are few.
彼は余命いくばくもなし
He has not long to live.
もはや目的地までいくばくもなし
We have not far to go.
いくばくもなく
before long―soon
いくばくも無くして機会ありき
Soon an opportunity presented itself―It was not long before an opportunity occurred.
行くこといくばくならずして人に会す
I had not gone far before I met a man.
待つこといくばくならずして彼来れり
I had not waited long before he appeared.

いくび〔猪頸〕
〈形〉A bull-neck:(=の) bull-necked (person)

content:
いくひさしく〔幾久しく〕
〈副〉For ever; long

content.content: 幾久しくご繁栄を祈る
I wish you may prosper for ever.
幾久しくお引立てを願います
I beg you will long favour us with your patronage.

content:
いくぶん〔幾分〕
〈形〉A part (of anything)

content.content: 私も入費のいくぶんを負担してもよろしい
I am willing to bear (a) part of the expenses.

content:
いくぶんか〔幾分か〕
〈副〉Partly; in part; in some measure; in some degree; to a certain extent; somewhat; something

content.content: 双方ともいくぶんか悪い
Both sides are partly to blame.
彼の成功はいくぶんか僥倖だ
His success is in part due to luck―in some measure due to chance.
それはいくぶんか真理だ
That is true to a certain extent.
病人はいくぶんか快い方だ
The invalid is somewhat better―something better.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼はいくぶんか詩人の性格をそなえている
He partakes of the character of a poet.
子どもは両親の性質をいくぶんかずつ受けて来る
A child partakes of the natures of both parents.

content:
いくら〔幾ら〕
〈疑問副詞〉
1. How much?; What?

content.content: 値段はいくらか
What is the price?―How much?
この徳利はいくら入るか
How much does this bottle hold?
普請はいくらかかるか
What will the building cost?
この本はいくらしたか
What did the book cost you?
建築費はいくらで上がるか
What will the cost of building come up to?
家賃はいくら払うか
What do you pay for your house?
しめていくらになるか
What do you make the total?
良い馬はいくら出せば買えるか
What must one give for a good horse?
この馬はいくらで買ったか
What did you give for your horse?
この馬はいくらで売ってくれるか
What will you take for the horse?
この本はいくらに売るか
At what price is this book sold?
米国ではいくらあったら暮らせるか
What does living cost in America?

content: 2. (=いくらいくらの割合で)at so much

content.content: 月いくらで人を雇う
to engage a man at so much a month―by the month
米国では一週間いくらで下宿する
In America, they board by the week.
鶏卵は一ダースいくらで売る
Eggs are sold by the dozen.
あの集会所は一日いくらで貸します
That hall can be hired by the day.
あの学校では一時間いくらで教員の給料を払う
The teachers of that school are paid by the hour.
一日いくらで働く
to work by the day

content: 3. (=いくら何々しても、いくら何々でも)however (... may); any; no; for all; with all

content.content: 人はいくら金持ちでも徒食するものでない
However rich a man may be,―Be a man as rich as he will,―he should not eat the bread of idleness.
いくら勉強しても一朝一夕には学べぬ
However hard one may work,―Work as hard as one will,―one can not learn it in a day.
いくらなりとよろしいとおぼしめすだけ下さい
Give me whatever you think fit.
いくら金がかかっても子どもを大学へ入れる
My boy shall have a college education, whatever it may cost―cost what it may.
いくら助けを求めても取り合う者が無かった
I might cry for help, but nobody took any notice of my cries.
いくら主人の命令でもそればかりは聴かれない
Though these are my master's orders, I can not obey them.
いくら出しても買う
I will buy it at any price.
いくら貰っても売られぬ
I can not part with it at any price.
良い教師はいくら高くとも安いものだ
A good teacher is cheap at any price.
悪い物はいくら安くとも高いものだ
A bad thing is dear at any price.
不漁{しけ}続きで魚類はいくら金を出しても無い
Owing to stress of weather, so fish was to be had at any price―for love or money.
いくら金を出しても幸福は買われぬ
No amount of money can buy happiness.
いくら天才があっても怠ける埋合わせにはならぬ
No genius can compensate for idleness.
いくら脅かしてもビクともせぬ
No threats can make him move a muscle of his face.
彼はいくらさがしてもいません
He is nowhere to be seen.
いくら働いても相変わらず貧乏だ
For all my labours, I remain as poor as ever.
いくら金があっても満足しない
For all his wealth, he is not contented.
いくら欠点があってもやはり偉い
With all his faults, he is a great man.
いくら君でも彼にはかなうまい
However great you may be, you can be no match for him.
いくら僕でもそれくらいのことは知っている
However ignorant I may be, I am not so ignorant as not to know that.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼にはいくら勧めても駄目だ
It is no use trying to persuade him.
いくら意見をしても駄目だ
It is no use reasoning with him.
いくら待っても来なかった
I waited and waited, but he did not appear.

content: 4. (=いくら好いものでも)(even) the best

content.content: いくら良い軍艦があっても使い方を知らなかったら無用の長物だ
The best ships are useless if you do not know how to work them.
いくら好い翻訳でも多少は原文と違うものだ
The best translation will vary more or less from the original.
いくら賢い人でも失錯はある
The wisest man will make mistakes.
いくら善い人でも欠点の無い人は無い
The best men have their faults.
いくらひいき目で見ても別に取柄が無い
Even when viewed in the most favourable light, there is nothing particular in him.

content:
いくらか〔幾らか〕
〈不定代名詞〉Something

content.content: いくらか寄付し給え
Give something towards the expenses.

content: 〈不定形容詞〉Some

content.content: 彼はいくらか学問がある
He has some knowledge.

content: 〈不定副詞〉Somewhat; in some measure; to a certain extent

content.content: 病人はいくらか快い方だ
The invalid is somewhat better.
彼の成功はいくらか僥倖がある
His success is in some measure due to luck.
彼の言うことはいくらか本当だ
What he says, is true to a certain extent.

content:
いくらでも〔幾らでも〕
〈不定形容詞〉As many as you like; as much as you like; any number of; any amount of ; ever so many; ever so much

content.content: 金はいくらでも上げる
You shall have as much money as you want.
本はいくらでも貸して上げる
I will lend you as many books as you can read.
本はいくらでもある
There are any number of books―There are ever so many books―Books are to be had in any number―Books, their name is legion.
まだまだいくらでもある
There are ever so many more.
彼は金がいくらでもある
He has any amount of money―no end of money.

content:
いくらも〔幾らも〕
〈不定形容詞〉
1. Any number of; any amount of; ever so many; ever so much

content.content: まだまだいくらもいくらもある
There are ever so many more.
本はいくらもある
There are any number of books―There are ever so many books―Books may be had in any number―Books, their name is legion.
彼は金はいくらもある
He has any amount of money―no end of money.
買手はいくらもある
There are any number of buyers―a legion of buyers.

content:
2. 
〈打消〉 Not much

content.content: いくらも儲けは無い
There is not much gain.
金はいくらも残っていない
There is not much money left.
道はいくらも無い
The way is not long.

content:
いくん〔偉勲〕
〈名〉A great deed; a great service

content.content: 偉勲を樹てる、偉勲を奏す
to perform a great deed―render great services

content:
いくん〔遺訓〕
〈名〉One's dying injunctions; teachings of the dead

content.content: 先祖の遺訓を守れ
Follow the teachings of your fathers!

content:
いけ〔池〕
〈名〉A pond; a pool

content.content: 池を掘る
to dig a pond
池に金魚が飼ってある
Gold-fishes are kept in the pond.
池の水が凍った
The pond is frozen over.
池を干す
to drain a pond―pump a pond dry
血汐の池に倒れていた
He was weltering in a pool of blood―wallowing in his blood.
池のはた
by the pond

content:
いけい〔畏敬〕
〈名〉Reverence; awe:(=する) to revere; to reverence; to hold (one) in awe; to stand in awe of (one)

content.content: 彼は人に畏敬されている
He is held in awe―People stand in awe of him.

content:
いけいざい〔違警罪〕
〈名〉A police offence; an offence against the police regulations

content.content: 違警罪を犯す
to offend against the police regulations
違警罪を犯して罰金を取られた
I was fined for offending against the police regulations.
違警罪は現行犯
A police offender must be caught in the act.

いけいれん〔胃痙攣〕
〈名〉Convulsion of the stomach

content:
いけがき〔生垣〕
〈名〉A hedge; a quickset

content.content: 生垣を作る
to plant a hedge
庭に生垣をめぐらす
to enclose a garden with a hedge―hedge a garden
生垣を刈込む
to prune down a hedge

content:
いけす〔生簀〕
〈名〉A fish-preserve; a stew

content.content: 生簀には魚が生けてある
Fish are kept alive in the stew.

いけすかご〔生簀籃〕
〈名〉A corf

content:
いけすかない〔いけ好かない〕
〈形〉Hateful; odious; horrid

content.content: いけ好かない老翁だ
He is a horrid old man.

content:
いげた〔井桁〕
〈名〉A well-curb (of parallel crosses)

content.content: 井桁に組む
to arrange in parallel crosses
井桁に積む
to pile up in parallel crosses

content:
いけづくり〔生け作り〕
〈名〉Dressing of live fish

content.content: 鯉を生け作りにする
to make slices of a living carp
鯉の生け作り
slices of a living carp

content:
いけどり〔生捕り〕
〈名〉Capture; captivity

content.content: 生捕りになる
to be captured―be taken prisoner

content:
いけどる〔生捕る〕
〈他動〉To capture (an enemy); to take (an enemy); prisoner; to lead (an enemy) captive; to take or catch (an animal) alive

content.content: 敵の大将を生捕った
They took the enemy's general prisoner.
敵に生捕られた
He was captured―taken prisoner―They were captured―take prisoners―by the enemy.
女が男を生捕る
A girl makes a conquest of a man.

content:
いけない
〈助動詞〉Must not

content.content: ここで煙草を飲んではいけない
You must not smoke here.
居眠りしてはいけない
You must keep awake.
入ってはいけないかね
(いいでしょう?)May I not come in?―(どうしてもいけない?)―Must I not come in?

content: 〈自動〉Won't do

content.content: これではいけない
This won't do.
この紙じゃいけない
This paper won't do.
今日は用があるから明日ではいけないかね
I am busy today. Won't tomorrow do?
いつかほかの時ではいけないかね
Won't some other time do?

content: 〈形〉Bad; wrong

content.content: そりゃいけない
That's too bad.
嘘をついてはいけない
It is wrong to tell a lie.
あれはいけない奴だ
He is a bad fellow.
ここは蚊がいていけない
The mosquitoes are very bad here.
今日は雨が降っていけない
It is bad weather today.
この部屋は暑くていけない
This room is too hot.
この室は暗くていけない
This room is too dark.
病気か、そりゃいけない
I am sorry you are ill.
落第したって、そりゃいけない
I am sorry you have failed.
この時計はどこかいけない
Something is the matter with the watch.
君はどこがいけないのか
What is the matter with you?
あの人はどこがいけないのか
What is wrong with him?
この卵はもういけない
The egg is spoilt.
この魚はもういけない
The fish is stale.
この肉はもういけない
The meat is tainted.
夏は牛乳がいけなくなる
Milk turns sour in hot weather.
漬物がいけなくなった
The pickles have gone bad.
病人はもういけない
It is all over with the invalid―It is all up with the invalid.

content:
いけないから
〈接続詞〉Lest (should); for fear (should)

content.content: 落第するといけないから勉強するのだ
I must work hard, lest I should fail―for fear of failing.
降るといけないから傘をお持ち
Take an umbrella with you, for fear it should rain.

content:
いけにえ〔生贄〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ぎせい〔犠牲〕

content:
いけばな〔生花〕
〈名〉Flower arrangement; floral arrangement

content.content: 生花を習う
to take lessons in flower arrangement
生花指南
Lessons given in flower arrangement.

content:
いける〔活ける〕
〈他動〉
1. To keep (fish) alive

content.content: 生簀には魚が生けてある
Fish are kept alive in the stew.
花を活ける
to arrange flowers―put flowers in a vase
床の間には花が活けてある
In the alcove stands a vase of flowers.
火を活ける
to bank up the fire

content:
いける〔行ける〕
〈自動〉Can go; can do

content.content: 君は酒がいけるか
Do you drink?
ビールなら少しはいける
I can drink a little beer.

content:
いける〔生ける〕
〈形〉Live; living

content.content: 生ける魚
a live fish
生けるが如し
It looks as if it were alive.
筆勢生けるが如し
The bold strokes appear instinct with life.
生きとし生けるもの
all living things―all life

content:
いけん〔威権〕
〈名〉Authority

content.content: 威権を振るう
to exercise one's authority
威権を恣にする
to abuse one's authority

content:
いけん〔意見〕
〈名〉
1. (=考え)an opinion; a view (one's views); a sentiment (one's sentiments); a conviction (one's convictions); a suggestion

content.content: 医者は病人が治るという意見だ
The doctor is of (the) opinion that the invalid will recover.
僕の意見では二人は段が違う
In my opinion,―In my mind,―To my thinking,―there is no comparison between the two.
ご意見が伺いたい
I wish to hear your opinion about the matter―hear your opinion on the subject.
意見を持つ、意見を懐く
to hold an opinion―entertain an opinion
意見を立てる
to form an opinion
意見を述べる、意見を吐く、意見を吐露する

to give an opinion―deliver (oneself of) an opinion―advance an opinion―set forth one's views―air one's views―utter one's sentiments―voice one's sentiments―make oneself heard―(直言するの意味なら)―speak one's mind
僕は意見を述べるのに誰の前をもはばからぬ
Nobody can deter me from speaking my mind.
意見というほどの意見でもないが述べてみましょう
I will give my opinion, such as it is.
僕は意見を述べる権利は無いが、止した方がよくはないか
If I might given an opinion, I would advise you to desist.
彼は忌憚無く意見を述べる
He has the courage of his opinions.
ご参考までに意見を述べます
I will make a suggestion―offer a suggestion.
彼は事を見合わした方がよかろうという意見を述べた
He suggested that the project had better be abandoned.
(新聞などに)意見を発表する
to publish one's views―ventilate one's views―through the press
新著述に意見を公表しました
I have set forth my views―held forth my views in my new work.
人の意見を叩く、 人の意見を探る
to sound one's views―sound one on the subject―feel one's pulse―feel one on the subject―feel out one's views
意見を同じうする
to be of the same opinion―to agree in opinion
僕は君と同じ意見だ
I am of the same opinion as you―I agree with you.
霊魂不滅論は Plato と 意見を同じうする
I hold with Plato that the soul is immortal.
意見を異にする
to differ in opinion―dissent from one's views―take different views of the matter
二人意見を異にする時は一人は間違っているに違いない、また双方とも間違っていることもある
When two men differ in opinion, one must be wrong, and both may be wrong.
僕は君と意見が違う
I must differ with you―dissent from your views.
校長はこの点において教員と意見を異にしている
The principal differs with the teachers on this point.
君と意見が合う
We agree in opinion―I agree with you―My views coincide with yours―I concur with you in your views.
意見が合わぬ
to disagree in opinion―differ in opinion―differ with each other―disagree with each other
僕は校長と意見が合わない(折合わない)
I can not get on with my principal.
人の意見に賛成(賛同)する
to endorse one's views―subscribe to one's views―enter into one's views―fall in with one's views
人の意見に雷同する
to echo one's views
意見を固守する
to hold (fast) to one's opinion
彼は意見を固守している
He is wedded to his opinion.
意見を通す
to carry one's point―gain one's end
意見を交換する
to exchange views―compare views―on a subject
意見が衝突する
Opinions clash.
意見の衝突がある
There is a clash of opinions―a conflict of opinions―a difference of opinions.
彼と少しく意見の衝突があった
I have a slight difference with him―a slight variance with him.
意見の差はしかたがない
We must make allowances for honest differences of opinion.
世の意見を募集する
to invite suggestions
君のような大家がそう言うならご意見に従わざるを得ぬ
If you say so, I must yield to your views―give in to your views―bow to your opinion.
ご意見に従おう
I will act upon your suggestion―take your suggestion.
ご意見通りに規則を変更しました
The rules have been altered on your suggestion.
この問題については意見が分かれている
They are divided in opinion―Opinion is divided―on this question.
彼は一定の意見が無い
He has no settled convictions.
反対の意見
opposite views
僕の意見は君とは正反対だ
My views are diametrically opposite to yours.
偏した意見
a biassed view

content: 2. (=忠告)advice; counsel; remonstrance; warning; admonition:(=する) to give (one) advice; to give (one) counsel; to remonstrate with, reason with (one on one's folly); to warn, admonish (one against error); to give (one) a piece of one's mind; to talk (seriously) to (one)

content.content: 彼に逢う度ごとに意見する
I talk seriously to him every time I meet him.
折りを見て意見しよう
I will take occasion to talk to him.
あんまりだから一つ意見してやりたいものだ
I should like to give him a piece of my mind.
彼は誰が意見をしても耳に入れない
He gives no heed to advice or warning.
彼には意見をしても駄目だ
It is no use reasoning with him.
意見をしたら効能があった
My words had effect on him.
彼は親の意見を聴かずに相変わらず放蕩している
He sets paternal authority at naught, and keeps running wild.
意見をしても豆腐に鎚、糠に釘
Advice slides off him as water off a duck's back.
真綿で首の強意見
velvet-pawed admonition―He talked to me like a Dutch uncle
無いが意見の総じまい
“An empty purse makes a man wise.”

content:
いけん〔異見〕
〈名〉A different view; an objection

content.content: 異見を立てる
to hold a different view―raise an objection

content:
いけん〔違憲〕
〈形〉Unconstitutional

content.content: 違憲の処置
an unconstitutional measure

content:
いげん〔威厳〕
〈名〉Dignity; majesty:(=ある) dignified; majestic; stately

content.content: 威厳のある人だ
He is a dignified man―a man of dignified mien.
威厳の無い風だ
He has an undignified manner.
彼はどこやら犯し難い威厳がある
He has about him a dignity which keeps people at a distance.
地位相当の威厳を保つ
to maintain a dignity due to one's status
この問題は国家の威厳に関する
The question concerns the dignity of the State.
そんなことをしては紳士の威厳を落とす
I would be beneath the dignity of a gentleman to do such a thing.
威厳を損ずる
(他からなら) to impair one's dignity―(自分でなら)―compromise one's dignity

content:
いご〔以後〕
〈副〉
1. (=今後)after this; hereafter; henceforth; hence; in future:(from に伴えば)forth, forward, onward:(=の) future

content.content: 以後慎みます
I will be more careful in future.
以後ご別懇に願います
I beg you will favour me with your friendship after this.
今日より以後禁酒
I give up drinking from this day forth―from this day forward―from this day onward.
百年以後の日本が見たい
I should like to see Japan a hundred years hence.

content: 2. (=その後)after that; afterward; thereafter; thenceforth:(今まで)since then; ever since:(=の) subsequent

content.content: 以後一度も逢わない
I have not met him ever since.
以後ここに居る
I have lived here ever since.
以後酒を慎んだ
I abstained from wine after that.
それ以後の出来事
subsequent events

content: 〈前置詞相当〉After; since

content.content: 維新以後の出来事だ
The event happened after the Restoration―subsequently to the Restoration.
震災以後彼に会わない
I have not seen him since the earthquake.

content:
いご〔囲碁〕
〈名〉The game of go

content.content: 囲碁指南
Lessons given in go

content:
いこう〔以降〕
〈前置詞相当〉After

content.content: 十日以降
on and after the 10th―from the 10th onward

content:
いこう〔偉功〕
〈名〉A great deed; a great service; a great success

content.content: 偉功を奏す
to perform a great deed―achieve a great success―render great services

content:
いこう〔威光〕
〈名〉Authority; influence; power

content.content: 日本では親の威光が強い
The Japanese father has great authority over his children.
親の威光を振るう
to exercise paternal authority
彼は親の威光で出世したのだ
He has risen through his father's influence.
親の威光を笠に着る
to shelter oneself under one's father's influence
彼は親の威光を笠に着てわがままをし尽している
He has everything his own way under the shelter of his father's influence.
親の威光を笠に着るものでない
One should stand on one's own merits.
教師の威光を振るう
to exercise one's authority as teacher
彼は教師の威光で好きなことをする
He exercises his authority as teacher to do whatever he likes.
大臣の威光で無理往生させられた
I was coerced by the Minister's authority.
金の威光は恐ろしいものだ
Such is the power of wealth.

content:
いこう〔意向〕
〈名〉Intention; inclination; view

content.content: 先方の意向を確かめよう
I will ascertain his intentions.
彼は仕事を引受ける意向があるか
Is he inclined to undertake the work?―Is he disposed to undertake the work?―Has he a mind to undertake the work?
人の意向を探る
to sound one's views―feel one's pulse―beat about the bush―throw out a feeler
世間の意向を探る
to feel the pulse of the public―fly a kite

いこう〔衣桁〕
〈名〉A clothes-rack; a clothes-horse

いこう〔遺稿〕
〈名〉One's posthumous works

いこう〔憩う〕
〈自動〉To rest oneself; to take a rest

いこく〔異国〕
〈名〉A foreign country; a strange land

いこくじん〔異国人〕
〈名〉A foreigner; a stranger

content:
いごこち〔居心地〕
〈名〉The feeling a house or a room gives one

content.content: 居心地の好い座敷だ
It is comfortable room―a snug and cosy room.
居心地の悪い家だ
It is an uncomfortable house.

いこじ〔依怙地〕
〈形〉Perverse; crabbed; cross-grained

いこつ〔遺骨〕
〈名〉One's remains:(詩歌にては)one's ashes

いころす〔射殺す〕
〈他動〉To shoot (one) dead (with an arrow)

content:
いこん〔遺恨〕
〈名〉Grudge; spite; malice; resentment; enmity; anger; wrath; ire

content.content: 彼に対して遺恨がある、遺恨を懐いている
I bear him a grudge―owe him a grudge―have a grudge against him―owe him a spite―have a spite against him.
遺恨を晴らす
to wreak one's grudge―glut one's ire―revenge oneself―be revenged―settle accounts with one―get even with one―get square with one―quit scores with one
多年の遺恨を晴らす
to pay off old scores―wipe off old scores
恋の遺恨
(男同志、女同志なら)rivalry in love―(ふられた男や女に対してなら)―a lover's revenge
遺恨重なる敵
a bitter enemy―the object of one's old resentment

content:
いごん〔遺言〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆいごん〔遺言〕

content:
いざ
〈間投詞〉
1. Come; now

content.content: いざ参ろう
Come, let us be going!
いざ勝負せん
Come on, let us try conclusions!
そこは端近{はしぢか}、いざまずこれへ
Pray, walk in!
いざという時(いざ鎌倉という時)
in case of emergency―in case of need―in time of need―in the day of trouble―in the hour of danger―in the moment of action
ああいう人はいざという時役に立たぬ
Such friends will fail you in time of need.
常に訓練しておかないといざという時まごつく
If you do not drill at other times, you get confused in the moment of action.
いざという時、すぐ間に合う
It is ready at a moment's notice.
いざという時の用意に貯金する
I lay by against the time of need.
いざ鎌倉という時、槍の錆びておらぬように
Keep your sword bright against the day of battle.
いざという時事に当たれる人は少ない
Few men can rise to the occasion.
いざとなれば全力を尽す
I will do my best when I am put to the push.
いざとなると彼は尻込みした
When it came to the push,―When it came to the scratch,―he hung back.
人はいざ知らず僕だけは異存は無い
As for me,―For my part,―I have no objection.

いさい〔偉才〕
〈名〉A great man

content:
いさい〔委細〕
〈名〉Details; particulars; circumstances; a detailed account; all, everything (about the matter)

content.content: 委細を物語った
I related the whole circumstances―gave full particulars―told him everything about the matter―entered into particulars―went into details.
委細は後便に譲る
I will give the particulars in my next.
委細は拝眉の上
I will tell you all about the matter when I have the pleasure of seeing you.
なお委細は幹事にお聞き下さい
For further particulars, I must refer you to my manager.
委細の様子は残らず聞いておりました
I have overheard all your talk.
委細承知仕りました
Very well, sir―I will see about it―You shall be obeyed in every particular.
御書面の趣き委細承知仕候
I have noted the contents of your letter.
［貸家札］委細は差配
For particulars apply to agent.
［広告文］委細面談
Particulars to be arranged personally.

いさい〔異才〕
〈名〉A remarkable man

いざいそく〔居催促〕
〈名〉Hanging on for a debt:(=する) to hung on (one) for a debt
